story:
Friends! Family! Music lovers! Adventure enthusiasts! We would greatly appreciate it if you checked this out!

We (Rio Star, Beaven Waller, and Nicole Grace) are all dear friends who make music. Collectively, all three of us are releasing new albums and EP's in the coming two months; Rio Star - "Heart and Soul"; Beaven Waller - "Indigo Trails"; Nicole Grace - "heavy-handed"; new music that we are so excited to share with you! 

With this new music, we will be hitting the road this May for two weeks to tour the West Coast, across into the Midwest, and end deep in the heart of Texas, playing at one of our childhood friend's wedding. It's going to be an incredible time. We have the music, we have the vehicles, we have the venues. Here's where we need your help - gas.

For some context, check out our tour schedule (and come chill with us if you're in the area!):

May 14th - Tribal Cafe - Los Angeles, CA

May 15th - Revolution Cafe - San Francisco, CA

May 16th - Oberon's Tavern - Ashland, OR

May 17th - Insomnia Coffee Co. - Portland, OR

May 18th - Funhouse - Seattle, WA

May 20th - Lewis and Clark Brewery - Helena, MT

May 21st - Yellowstone Valley Brewery - Billings, MT

May 23rd - House Show - Chicago, IL

May 24th - Seward Cafe - Minneapolis, MN

May 26th - The Prophet Bar - Dallas, TX

May 28th - Wedding Fiesta - Austin, TX

May 29th - TBA - San Antonio, TX

In between our hectic schedules, finding time to work is extremely difficult. Somehow, we still manage to do it; however, what we will have made by the time we leave is not enough to pay for the projected gas expenses that we'll be facing  on this extremely exciting tour. SO, we are asking for your generosity and support.

Every little bit helps. If you don't feel as if you're financially able to contribute anything at the time, simply sharing this page would help spread the word. Any and all help is greatly appreciated. We owe so much of who we are to the people who support us. We couldn't do what we do without you all. Thank you, in advance.

 There are some really cool rewards in store for you, depending on how much you donate. Check them out on the side of the page!

Anything helps. Please consider contributing to the spread of music - the pursuit of dreams - the spread of love. See you on the road!

story:
Levé de fond pour financer le "Crush Your Fest"


Bonjour a tous , je me nomme Yan Favreau de CrushYourFace Production, promoteur/Manager au Quebec . 
Comme certain d'entre vous le savent , produire des spectacles peu-être parfois difficile , le coût des salles , équipements de sonorisation etc sont des éléments qui sont parfois très couteux pour un promoteur et ce avant même de payer les artistes de votre événement .
C'est pourquoi aujourd'hui j'ai ouvert une levé de fond pour financer mon festival qui va avoir lieu le 16 Avril 2016 à la salle des chevaliers de colombs . Il y aura au total 10 groupes musicaux émergent du Québec à l'affiche et la raison du financement est très simple :
Atteindre l'objectif du montant de 865$ qui va servir a couvrir 
-265$ pour la location de la salle
-600$ pour la location d'équipement de sonoriation avec le techicien sur place toute la journée . Ce montant servira exclusivement a payer ses frais , il y aura 10 groupes donc , les billets vendu servirons a payer les artistes.

Un don de 10 , 5 même 1 $ va faire toute la différence , même seulement juste partager mon projet a votre entourage va nous aider grandement .
Plus proche nous atteindrons l'objectif , moins seront le billet . 

En contrepartie , tout les gens qui feront un don au dessus de 20$ , aura automatiquement la chance d'avois 50% de rabais sur le prix du billet .
Je ferai des updates régulièrement pour mettre a jours ou nous sommes rendu avec la levé de fond .
Merci d'avance du fond du coeur .

story:
Introduction

Has your inner soul ever be touched by an original piece of music performed by an unknown musical artist? If it has, did you ever ask yourself ….“How it is possible that such talent and creativity is not shared with the rest of mankind”?

The answer is actually quite simple. It takes more than talent to complete this magical transformation process.

There are countless musicians and composers with dreams of sharing their love of music but don’t have the means or opportunity to transform their dreams into reality.

Gathering The Music (GTM) has created an environment where talented musicians and composes can come together to mold their concepts and ideas into unique pieces of musical art to be shared with a worldwide listening audience.

Verse:

We are enabling “Music Makers” to realize their dreams by providing a musical environment where our core values of “Transparency and Collaboration” form the cohesive elements in our musical family.

GTM provides the Management and Technical expertise required to record and produce original music in parallel with a creative marketing strategy and an effective launching campaign.

Bridge:

Our focus is on the music without restrictions to a limited number of Genres. Whether this music is Blues, Jazz, Rock, Soul, Funk or even Blue Grass among others we are enthusiastic about getting the best possible quality results out there for listeners to enjoy.

Chorus:

Fortunately our musical family includes a number of accomplished musicians awarded recognition in The Netherlands as Best Blues Guitarist, Best Rock Guitarist and Best Guitarist.

We are on the verge of releasing our first album.

Our GTM organization has been self- funded. This means we have been covering our expenses from personal savings and cash scraped together without subsidies from government funded organizations.

Due to the limited funding available we are not able to provide musicians with financial support during their dream development process. Most of them struggle to earn enough to cover their living expenses without the luxury of saving for the future or building up a pension.

We are at a cross-road and are asking you for funding help so we can continue our momentum, build on our strengths and give the needed financial support to our musical family as they concentrate on their passion for music and fulfilling their dreams.

 Conclusion:

Within the next six months we expect to begin to reap the benefits of our efforts and will be self-supporting in helping “Music Makers” realize their dreams.

Even if you are not in a position to help us with the funding there are other ways to show you support.

Get familiar with our work and spread the word…..to your family, friends and colleagues who enjoy the magic in the music.

Your support will go a long way toward having a new generation of “Music Makers” dreams come true.


BUDGET NEEDED
   
Studio Rent  2500 P.M. 
Producer Costs 2000 P.M. 
Engineer(s), Assistants 800 P.M. 
Tech Work  1500 P.M. 
Band Allowance  1500 P.M. 
Band Salary per member (900 per member with a minimum of 4) 3600 P.M. 
Travel Costs 1000
Total per Month 12900 P.M. 
Total Half a Year 77400
 
Production of a Album (with a minimum of 6 Albums A Year)    
Pre - Production (200 a Song) 2400 A min. of 12 Songs
Mixing Fees 8000  
Mastering  2500  
Artwork 2500  
Pressing Costs  1000  
Total 16400  
Total Half a Year 46200  
   
77400  
46200  
TOTAL COSTS 123600  
   
Indiegogo Fee 5562  
PERKS 2500  

131662

story:
Who Are We?

Rhymes With Opera (RWO) is a New York-based ensemble that commissions, develops and performs new chamber operas, encourages theatrical innovation through multimedia and interdisciplinary collaboration, fosters musical education and growth, and strives to create a dialogue between artists and audiences while adding to the repertory of contemporary opera.

Founded in 2007, Rhymes With Opera includes founding company members Ruby Fulton (composer); Elisabeth Halliday (soprano); George Lam (composer); Bonnie Lander (soprano); and Robert Maril (baritone). During the 2012-2013 season, Rhymes With Opera expanded to include a house band, the Rhymes With Orchestra, a chamber ensemble comprised of some of this generation’s most exciting contemporary instrumentalists. With the addition of the RWOrchestra, RWO has become a self-contained contemporary opera machine, commissioning and producing works that can be performed whole-cloth by the company.

Since 2007, RWO has commissioned more than 17 new operas, ranging from one-minute “signature” pieces to evening-length productions. Recent operas commissioned and produced by RWO include George Lam and John Clum's "Heartbreak Express", Anna Meadors and John Paul Carillo's "Manifesto on the Ledge", David Smooke’s "Criminal Element", Adam Matlock and Brian Slattery's "Red Giant", and Erik Spangler’s "Cantata For A Loop Trail", an outdoor hiking opera.

What's the money from this campaign going to buy?

We've engaged a Baltimore-based super team of videographer Rachel Dwiggins, director Connor Kizer, producer Adam Endres, screenwriter/script editor Baynard Woods, and set designer Maura Dwyer to design and shoot our first video opera, Adams Run, composed by Ruby Fulton. The RWO Orchestra and founding singers Elisabeth Halliday, Bonnie Lander, and Robert Maril will audio record at Mobtown Studios in Baltimore in January, February and March, 2016. The video recording will take place over the course of five days in March, 2016. 

Making a movie is a giant, exciting undertaking for RWO and we're asking you to be a part of it. Your contribution will help us bring our vision of this dark comedy to life. You'll be helping us cover all of the expenses that go along with producing an hour-long video, from camera rentals to recording studio fees to hiring a crew. To see the fantastic work of filmmaker Rachel Dwiggins, check out this very Indiegogo campaign video, which she crafted.

Adams Run is set amidst wild weather in a dystopic future world. Two television show hosts vie for the most viewed program in America. Despite their idealogical differences, existential weather woman Julie Shore and environmentalist evangelist the Reverend Billy Noble fall in love. Television producer Dana Daring tells their story from a news perspective as a series of flashbacks. With multiple screens telling stories within stories, post-Minimalist sounds of wild weather, the voices of eccentric characters, and strains of forbidden love, this video opera explores very real problems of climate change, screen obsession, and overblown media in unexpected ways.

Where's the show?

Adams Run will be coming soon to a screen near you, with screening events being planned in Baltimore, MD; Boston, MA; Durham, NC; San Diego, CA; Cherokee, IA; and more TBA. You can even win a screening in your own city if you donate $1000! Check out more info on www.rhymeswithopera.org. RWO will perform Adams Run in a screening combined with a live performance component at the 124 Bank St Theater in New York City on May 20 and 21, 2016.

story:
I'm a Hard Rock Band from Brazil, Belém of Pará, ( Amazon Forest) looking to raise $6,500 for the cost of my full length album called AMAZON´S ON FIRE. 


I want to make you part of the project and so any help in raising funds or sharing with your community of friends will help in fully funding this project and making this album fully come to life! 

This project will have the opportunity to fully come to life because of your support and I'm excited to have YOU and I collaborate in this process together because fans and friends are the driving force in making this album a reality.
Any support is MUCH appreciated! To know more about this album AMAZON´S ON FIRE, take a LOOK at my project at Reverbnation. 



I hope you'll consider supporting the production of my album. Whatever you can do will be a big help to me! please help us spread the word about my campaign!


Parts of the CD SALE Amazon's on Fire is to support my cause with the petition against the destruction of the Amazon Rainforest. LET´S STOP AMAZON FOREST DEFORESTATION- The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) confirmed on Thursday (14) high in Amazon deforestation. In the last 12 months, were devastated 5,843 km2 of forest, an increase of 28% over the period last year. Preliminary data are Prodes (Project Monitoring Deforestation in the Amazon Satellite) for the period August 2012 to July 2013. In 2012, measured 4571 km 2 of deforestation in the region. I would like to this petition touched people to the deforestation that is being done in the Amazon Rain Forest, which in the state of Para, nothing is being done to stop the deforestation, and yes a continuous madness to destroy the forest, And the construction of the Hydroelectric Power Plant of Belo Monte who will bring much destruction to the region and to the indian people and the population that lives near, where it will be built the hydroelectric. 



 Signed, 

 Antonio Junior

story:
YOU CAN HELP!

We want to remind you that even if you have no ability to help us right now with money – a simple repost in social networks, or a story to a friend about our company or our musical group is already a huge help and we appreciate it!

WHO WE ARE? 

We are the funk-rock/alt-rock band "From Subway To Soul" - four friends from Kyev, Ukraine who decided to give the world our view of rock music. We appreciate freedom and uniqueness that rock music gives us and believe that our music can make people better. We are inspired to create beautiful and soulful music which will be cherished by all and we will greatly appreciate your help with this. In this small video, we will answer the question - who we are? 

OUR PLAN!

The beginning is the hardest time for us but we take it seriously. We want to record and release our first EP album, continue to promote our rock-band and expand our concert map to other countries. Music and lyrics is what we can do and we want our music to inspire generations! 

OUR ACHIEVEMENTS! 

As soon as we entered the world of music announcing ourselves in social networks, we began to receive offers from different art directors with a request to sing in their places and to be honest we did not expect that, so we diligently began to sing. We gave out first concert on March 7, we started from the performances of several groups but soon we began to receive offers of recitals and we realized that our music inspires people and they like it! So we decided to record our first EP album. This is a small cutting from our live performances: 

WHERE THE MONEY GOES? 

The collected money will go to mixing and mastering our songs. We are going to record 7 songs for our debut EP album. The cost of one song recording is $200 so 7 tracks will take $1400 + comission for reciving money. The goal is not to earn money with this songs but to share it with public for free. Tht's why we are asking for help in raising funds for recording. If we do not collect enough money to record a full EP album, your money will not be wasted, we’ll put it in the record and the album will be released in any case !

OUR PERKS! 

We can offer you several unique perks from us! For a minimum contribution: from wholehearted thanks and +1to karma to the video message in which we express our gratitude to the sponsor and play a bonus track! For larger deposits: t-shirts

CD discs (Limited edition) \ boxes with secret \ as well as the performance at your home! Remember that your help to music art is always estimated much higher and our perks are just expressions of gratitude for the help!

We THANK YOU for being a part of this exiting adventure!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tray, and I am a rapper based out of Detroit, MI. This will be my first full-scale professional E.P. and I need your help to make it happen!

My team and I have put a lot of hours, hard work, and planning into making this E.P. happen and getting this far. We're putting all of the songs together, and now I need your financial support to take this project to another level!

What We Need

I will need $7,000 for this project. Here is the breakdown of where your money would go: 

  • Music Video - $2,500 (Creating a great music video)
  • Marketing - $1,600 (Promoting music)
  • CD Production - $1,440 (Producing the music)
  • Mastering - $500 (Making the songs sound sonically complete)
  • Physical CDs - $450 (Printing the physical CDs)
  • Shipping Costs - $300 (For gift packages)
  • CD Cover Art - $100 (Paying the artist)
  • Indie GoGo Fee - 5% (Paying back indigogo)
Total: $7,440
If I don't reach my goal, I will cut out the marketing price and move forward with the project. 

What You Get

  • $25 Donation: 

    Digital download of the E.P. two weeks before it comes out, s

    igned Tray poster
  • $100 Donation: 

    In-person listening/FaceTime or Skype session to exclusively hear the E.P. before it comes out, s

    igned Tray poster, three CDs 

    two weeks before it comes out


  • $200 Donation: Y

    ou and 1 friend will get backstage access to one of my concerts, 

    2 t-shirts, 

    2 CDs when they come out, d

    igital download of the E.P., s

    igned Tray poster
  • $500 Donation: I

     will buy dinner for you and a friend (if you are close by), w

    rite you a personal song, y

    ou will get backstage access to my next concert, y

    ou will get 2 t-shirts and 3 CDs, s

    igned Tray poster
  • $1,000 Donation: You and a friend get backstage access to one of my concerts, join me on stage, 2 t-shirts, 5 CDs, meal together provided by me (depending on your proximity), hear the E.P. before anyone else does, appear in one my music videos
See Perks Section for More Details!

The Impact

This E.P. is important to me because it shares my journey of rising out of the ashes, maturing through marriage and my faith, and coming to a greater clarity of who Christ made me to be and knowing my mission on this Earth. It is my desire to share the wisdom and passion I have gained through this E.P. with anyone who simply loves hip-hop, is looking for hope and answers, struggling with or being brought out of the street life like I was, or even just a curious ear. 

Since the past two mixtapes I've created, I've seen my influence and reception among audiences grow. I have especially seen the impact of my music on children's lives. Teens have been learning my lyrics and posting videos rapping them on social media. A friend told me my music helped him out of a depression. Someone I ran into while feeding the homeless told me women in correctional facilities that were trafficked listen to my music as they gain victory and recovery in their lives. I have been humbled to hear other countless testimonies of how God is using my music. A middle school student even took the time to write an essay on what I and my music mean to her. Take a look below. 

"My Fav Rapper"

It is for reasons like this that I make music, and it is in the hope of God using my gift across larger audiences that I ask you to partner with me.

My team and I have put a lot of hours, hard work, and planning into making this E.P. happen and getting this far. We're putting all of the songs together, and now I need your financial support to take this project to another level!

story:
W   E   I   G   H   T   L   E   S   S    


  • My name's Alex Kozobolis  .. I'm a self taught pianist and composer based in and around London, England. 
  • I've been releasing music for years around other bits of my life but thought it would be nice to actually put a physical release out this time  [something you can hold rather than just compressed binary for your computer to digest] and potentially give the music a bit of a bigger push / promote it from its position on the sidelines
  • Weightless is a collection of 4 concise solo piano compositions [ Unravel | Closure | And Find Yourself | Weightless ] accompanied by 4 corresponding reworks by Tom Adams // Siavash Amini
    // Hedia // Transept .. The remixes and their respective artists were meticulously considered and approached with the intention of creating a cohesive album rather than a fundamentally detached congregation of unrelated pieces of music. Each artist was asked to interpret not only the music but also the title of the tracks..  The result, i think, and hope, is something which you'll be able to listen to from start to finish and feel consistently engaged by, albeit through a fairly diverse collection of tracks
  • By helping fund this you'll be:
    a) expanding your music collection with something you'll hopefully enjoy
    b) helping me to carry on making music, something i'll definitely enjoy
have a listen to track 2 Closure _


"Why Are You Crowdfunding If You're Already On A Label"?

  • touché 
  • FutureSequence is a small independent label run for the love of music.. so there's not really a giant pot of $£€£$ lying around .. i scrape along trying to freelance (with varied and heavily intermittent success) so that's why i'm not able to bankroll it either ; ]  

"How Do I Pronounce 'Kozobolis' ? "

  • a) however you like, i've heard everything .. a teacher at school once called me "wallace"
  • b) take it one syllable at a time and you'll be just fine 
  • c) It's Greek so get all mediterranean (meh-dee-teh-rrráy-knee-un) on it 


"I Can't Really Afford To Help Out Right Now, Can I Still Help?"

  • if money is tight at the moment but you like what you've heard send me an email and i'll make sure you get a digital copy 
  • even if you can't afford to help out financially - a bit of sharing / weightlessvangelising goes a really long way .. if you have friends or family who you think may enjoy the album send them this way  : ] 


T H A N K  Y O U __

Alex
x

story:
Short Summary

It was with humble beginnings that the heavy rock/desert blues band Filthy Lucre was created. Forged from the power of then 15 year old [drummer] Ed Noble's heavy-handed "drumming", and the "fiercely" adequate riffs of then 16 year old Luke Marsh, at their local high-school. The two compadres have performed alongside each other in a multitude of musical projects ever since, it was only when the planets aligned (ie. everybody else was busy) that the two realised their thirst for riffs - and thus became "Filthy Lucre".

Since the band's conception in 2012, we have put our proper adult lives on hold in an attempt to make music our lives, spending week-in-week-out playing shows at home, touring the country, landing several incredible support slots (Truckfighters, Ash Grunwald, Tex Perkins, Dallas Frasca, The Beards), and finally recording our debut 14-track album "Mara" in the U.S.A. with internationally acclaimed producer Sylvia Massy (Tool, System of a Down, Price, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Johnny Cash). All 100% independently funded down to the pocket-lint!

THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN - our dear lovely fans, friends, and family! We're fresh outta dosh and need your help!

We landed a spot at this year's Lake on Fire Festival in Austria - a festival that literally has a stage floating on a lake. Help us follow through with our ridiculous ambitions!

What We Need & What You Get

In short - we need about $8,000 dollarydoos.

Band life ain't all lemonade and biscuits, folks. We're throwing in every last cent just to land our feet on European soil. Although we are a couple of resourceful young men, we can't spend every day foraging for berries and every night sleeping on a park bench.

Your donations/purchases will go directly towards helping cover the costs of travel and transport, food, and accommodation for the duration of our subesquent 6-week European tour following Lake on Fire Festival in August.

Donations can be made straight-up via the virtual hug perk, or you can help by purchasing one of the many goods and services we are willing to provide - including CDs, t-shrits, Aussie barbecue and cultural experiences (hosted by us), and many more! (see video)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are like us and you're currently in a tight spot for dollarydoos, fear not! You can help us out simply by sharing this page, spreading the world, and telling your friends. Sharing is caring!


Thank you all from the bottom of our hearts! The fact that you even visited this page means you're an awesome person and we love you.

Luke & Ed
FILTHY LUCRE.

story:
Who we are

Lucidity Chamberistas was formed by Eugene Takahashi in the fall of 2014 in Queens, New York with fellow professional musicians. The word “lucidity” in our name is a play on the sound of Long Island City, where the orchestra had its inaugural performance. The inaugural performance at the Secret Theatre in Long Island City was aired on the WQXR.
 

Our goal and strategies

Our goal is to deliver live classical music to wider audiences in Queens and beyond. We play not only standard repertoires but also works by living composers from our local communities. We have unique strategies in maintaining professional quality of music making and accessibility to the community. 
 

We strive to turn all of our concerts FREE so that our concerts will be absolutely inclusive of everyone in the community. The cost has to be cut down to minimum to make this happen. We have found a balance between the musical capability and the cost efficiency -- we made our orchestra as small as possible, while maintaining its musical capability. Also, we collaborate with community based non-profit organizations, which typically offer their spaces for free for admission free community events. This also keeps the cost low. We are thrilled to introduce live classical music to widely varied groups of people who are connected with such organizations, and to build new relationships in communities where people hardly have any access to live music performances.
 

Our orchestra is small enough to get out of concert halls, travel to where you are, and play in a smaller non-traditional venues. Despite its small size, this 11-piece-orchestra sounds very powerful because the size of the orchestra perfectly matches the intimacy of the venues we play in. Our live performances sound with full richness in spaces where orchestra performances have been considered to be impossible.
 

Artistically, we aim to perform the same program several times, in order to maintain the quality of the music and promote newly written works to a wider public. More than two performances of new works are usually a rarity due to the high production costs. In this, our strategy is unique;  We travel to several venues across Queens and repeat the same program. This will keep per-concert production costs low and keep the level of performance high; playing more performances foster a deeper understanding in the works we play. We are planning to record a CD at the end of a future concert tour across Queens, in which new works written by contemporary New York composers will be included.
 

Upcoming project

There are two concerts coming up in two different types of local communities as part of our pilot project. In this project, we will aim to create a collaborative relationships with the hosting organizations and their clients, where an orchestra has never been heard in live. The concert times are unique; both of these concerts will be a "pre-dinner concert," one for a weeknight (6:30pm-7:30pm), and the other for Sunday (5:00pm-6:00pm). The concert will be much shorter than usual concerts and finish right by the dinner time. This is part of our effort in fitting the musical trend to today's changing demands. The ultimate goal of this upcoming project is to find collective interests among different groups, such as our audiences, local businesses, local representatives, local non-profits, foundations, and us, and form a sustainable scheme that provides live music to the communities for many years to come. At this time, as a one time thing, we run this crowdfunding campaign to get the seed money in order to help present ourselves at our best and form future support bases.   

Dates:
October 8, 2017 Sunday 5pm-6pm  Sunnyside Community Services         https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=teo4pbqgHGs&t=
October 10, 2017 Tuesday 6:30pm-7:30pm  Hamilton-Madison House     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-VueweOUems

Program:
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: Divertimento in D-major, K.136
Yui Kitamura: a new composition
Leo Soeda: a new composition
Edvard Grieg: Holberg Suite, op.40
 

Budget
Personnel cost $5500 ($100 per service x 5 services x 11 players) (3 rehearsals + 2 concerts = 5 services.)
Composition $250x 2pieces =$500
Misc. $400
Subtotal $6400

Fiscal Sponsor Overhead (7% of subtotal) $448
IndieGoGo Processing Fee (5% flat fee + 3% bank transaction fee + 30cents per transaction) approx. $552

Total: $7400

 

Help keeping New York musicians in New York!
So many of New York musicians are working all over the place, out of necessity, from upstate New York, New Jersey, California, Florida, even to foreign countries. Your support will help keeping fine musicians home, and ensure our fine live music experiences will continue to be accessible and affordable to members of our own community. It will also help bringing greater satisfaction to our music making process, guaranteeing more rehearsal hours.

 

Lucidity Chamberistas is fiscally sponsored by Multicultural Sonic Evolution, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization recognized by IRS as exempt. Your contributions will be distributed to us through Multicultural Sonic Evolution and be tax deductible. Your support will be much appreciated!

story:
My Story

Hi!  I'm Lindy Crandall.  Thanks for checking out my new project. I am a singer songwriter from San Diego, California.  I am also a Massage Therapist and Cosmetologist.  I've been singing, writing and performing almost my entire life.  I wrote my first song on the piano when I was ten, but I was writing melodies and lyrics well before that - using the top of the stairs in my childhood home as my stage.  Music truly feels like my purpose in life.

The project I’m about to start explores finding healing through the acceptance and the appreciation of life.  The album is dedicated to my late friend Rachel, who although struggled with diabetes for a lot of her life, never lost her vibrancy and love for the world.   When she died it was her lingering light and spirit that inspired me to write my songs Desert Rose and Frozen, and to value the time I was fortunate to have had with her.  With this album Desert Rose I share what knowing Rachel has taught me, in the hopes that you can get to know a little bit of her too.

The songs are meant not only to share Rachel’s love of life, but also to show people that it's okay to embrace pain in order to heal.  Growing up I always knew I was different from the rest of my family.  I was sensitive and emotional, whereas my parents and sister were stoic and analytical.  I loved doing anything creative and writing songs helped me to find and accept myself at a young age.  As I got older, I realized that there are a lot of other people like me, but that society seems to view sensitivity as a weakness.  As an artist I want to highlight the power sensitive people can harness when they find the courage to be themselves - the gift which music has given me.  

I’m so grateful for knowing Rachel;  I hope you will help me share the gift of her spirit with my songs.

My goal is to raise $10,000 that will go towards recording the album, any musicians I have to hire, album art, promotion, and distribution.  Any and all funding will go into the album.  If I'm able to raise the entire $10,000 I expect to release 6 to 7 songs.  Less money will mean less songs and more money will mean more songs.  I’m really excited to be able to offer some unique perks because of my background in the spa industry.  With your help I can reach more people who have gone through similar struggles by getting my music out into the world.   Thank you so much for checking out my new project and for your support.

story:
My Story

Hello, I am vaporwave artist/designer bo-[ r e a l ]. Over the past three years I've been working on and releasing albums under different names and monikers, while supporting the communities and artists that follow the vaporwave genre. I was just as elusive as the genre itself, with only a few close contacts that know about all of my different projects. Today, my current musical project is bo-[ r e a l ] and just recently released my highly anticipated sophomore full-length album WINDOWS VISTA SOCIAL CLUB. My debut album, [ R e a l i t y ] 現実歪曲 LP which was released earlier in the year was very well received and adored by the community for it's unique soundscape, mixing vaporwave and mallsoft to achieve a surreal, immersive sound. When I began working on WVSC, I wanted to take the sound that I had invented for Reality and attach a personal story to it.  The biggest theme to the album for myself personally has to be digital anxiety and the effects of the Internet on our personal relationships. It plays with the listener to really surround them in the emotional state that inspired the album.


Tragedy Strikes

At the end of February, 2016 my production laptop (along with other recording gear) was stolen at a metro station, and after spending hours trying to work with the proper authorities I was basically told to give up and let my gear go. I instantaneously lost over 5 albums worth of unreleased songs, and hundreds of vaporwave art. All I have left is what is available for download on Bandcamp. I lost unreleased tracks, working files, miscellaneous mixdowns and even files for my previous vaporwave projects. Someone out there has everything and I have no way of finding them. 

What We Need & What You Get

Before my gear was stolen, I was preparing to re-release WINDOWS VISTA SOCIAL CLUB with Negative Plus Records (vaporwave label based in California). The new version would include remastered versions of the songs on the Bandcamp release, as well as 4 extra tracks (including a remix by San Antonio DJ Pagan Gold). We were planning a limited cassette tape run, with possibility of a vinyl release in the near future. 

I am currently trying to raise at least $2,500, with additional goals up to $5,500. Here's the breakdown:

Initial Goal: $2,500

$1000 - Replacing Stolen Gear:

I lost a laptop, an external hard drive, an audio interface, and a mini midi keyboard. This covers a basic laptop/audio interface, to give me back the ability to produce music.

$250 - Studio Time:

I know that most vaporwave artists don't require studio time, but for WVSC I brought in two Bossa Nova guitarists, as well as a theremin player to get the sound I wanted. This covers studio time and hiring studio musicians to get an authentic and unique sound.

$1000 - Printing Cassettes & Merchandise:

We'll be producing cassette tapes, as well as specially designed t-shirts only available from this campaign, as well as 7" x 7" art prints.

$250 - Shipping:

With fans all around the globe, I want to ensure that the album gets into each of their hands. Whether they're in the UK or Argentina, this covers any and all shipping costs.

Additional Goals:

$3,500 - Different cassette colours!

This will allow us to get WVSC printed in different colour cassette tapes. Grab one in your favourite colour, or collect them all!

$4,000 - [ R e a l i t y ] 現実歪曲 LP Cassette Release:

If we reach this goal, we will produce a cassette release for my first album. A copy will be included with each cassette order/pledge for WVSC.

$5,500 - WVSC Premium Art Book

A 16-page high-quality, glossy art book that features all of the art and designs I've created for WVSC. It features lyrics, behind-the-scenes looks, as well as me explaining my inspiration process for the tracks on WVSC.


Anyone who donates anything will be sent a link where they can download my first album, [ R e a l i t y ] 現実歪曲 LP, for free. Other perks could include advanced copies of the album, specially designed Bo-[ r e a l ] t-shirts that can only be received by donating here, autographed cassette tapes, or even guaranteed free copies of everything I release from now until the end of eternity.

If I don't reach my goal of $2,500, the money you donate will still be put towards the album's release. It is very important for me to replace my stolen gear, so that is high on my priority list and it will be something you can point to and say "I helped make that happen." But if I miraculously surpass my goal, then that's giving WINDOWS VISTA SOCIAL CLUB more chance of being a successful album.

Any perks you order will be shipped a couple weeks after the campaign ends.


The Impact

Vaporwave is still a relatively new genre, born out of the Internet in the 2010s. Click here to watch Vaporwave: A Brief History. I have been actively supporting it since came to fruition, and is something that you can literally watch as it evolves. There's already countless sub-genres branching off vaporwave, as well as an entire art form. If you support this album, you're not just supporting vaporwave music, you're supporting one of (if not the first) art movements born out of the Internet age. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And thank you for any contribution, however big or small, you have made to helping vaporwave.
story_txt:
My Story 
Hello, I am vaporwave artist/designer bo-[ r e a l ]. Over the past three years I've been working on and releasing albums under different names and monikers, while supporting the communities and artists that follow the vaporwave genre. I was just as elusive as the genre itself, with only a few close contacts that know about all of my different projects. Today, my current musical project is bo-[ r e a l ] and just recently released my highly anticipated sophomore full-length album WINDOWS VISTA SOCIAL CLUB. My debut album, [ R e a l i t y ] 現実歪曲 LP which was released earlier in the year was very well received and adored by the community for it's unique soundscape, mixing vaporwave and mallsoft to achieve a surreal, immersive sound. When I began working on WVSC, I wanted to take the sound that I had invented for Reality and attach a personal story to it.  The biggest theme to the album for myself personally has to be digital anxiety and the effects of the Internet on our personal relationships. It plays with the listener to really surround them in the emotional state that inspired the album. Tragedy StrikesAt the end of February, 2016 my production laptop (along with other recording gear) was stolen at a metro station, and after spending hours trying to work with the proper authorities I was basically told to give up and let my gear go. I instantaneously lost over 5 albums worth of unreleased songs, and hundreds of vaporwave art. All I have left is what is available for download on Bandcamp. I lost unreleased tracks, working files, miscellaneous mixdowns and even files for my previous vaporwave projects. Someone out there has everything and I have no way of finding them.   What We Need & What You Get Before my gear was stolen, I was preparing to re-release WINDOWS VISTA SOCIAL CLUB with Negative Plus Records (vaporwave label based in California). The new version would include remastered versions of the songs on the Bandcamp release, as well as 4 extra tracks (including a remix by San Antonio DJ Pagan Gold). Additional Goals:
$3,500 - Different cassette colours!
This will allow us to get WVSC printed in different colour cassette tapes. Grab one in your favourite colour, or collect them all!

story:
**NOTE: SCROLL DOWN TO SEE ALL THE AMAZING PERKS YOU CAN PURCHASE ALONG WITH YOUR COPY OF THE NEW ALBUM!**

MEET NATHAN BELT & THE BUCKLES

Do you like the sounds of 50's and 60's rock n' roll, rockabilly and country music? Do prefer listening to legends like Roy Orbison, Johnny Cash, Buddy Holly, Willie Nelson or Elvis Presley? Or do you prefer more current artists who echo the sounds of old such as J.D. McPherson, Chris Isaak and Sturgill Simpson? If you agree and enjoy the artists that we mentioned, how would you like to support a band doing exactly that and recording it in the same studio where several of those artists above have recorded? We are Nathan Belt & The Buckles and we're proud to meet you. We share the same passion for REAL, blood, sweat and tears music as it was made in the past and we hope to accomplish this new project with your help. 

Long story short: We are scheduled to create our very first all original record with Nashville producer Bryan Simpson (The Whistles And The Bells, Cadillac Sky) at the legendary Sound Emporium Studios in Nashville, TN. It is a long awaited venture and a very expensive one. We can't do it without you! (See descriptions and photos of rewards you'll receive below!)

This is where we are.  

We are a band from Nashville, TN that includes musicians with a wide range of experience, both on-stage and in the studio. Our sound is an authentic mix of 50s and 60s Pop, Rock N Roll, Rockabilly and Traditional Country, with influences that include Elvis Presley, Roy Orbison, Johnny Cash, Buddy Holly, The Beatles, Chris Isaak and Brian Setzer, just to name a few. The Buckles were founded in August of 2013 with our first show performed at The World Famous Nashville Palace followed by a live album release in April 2014 that was recorded at that same venue. Since then, we’ve worked diligently to become one of Nashville’s most in demand live shows on Broadway, as well as performing across Tennessee, Kentucky, Arkansas and the great state of Texas. This is our livelihood and our full-time jobs. It’s what keeps the lights on at home. I know I can speak for the others when I also say it’s our childhood dream. 

After 2 years of working to develop our sound, style and unique live show, we feel that now is the time to create our first official, all original, studio album. 

WATCH NATHAN BELT & THE BUCKLES ON YOUTUBE!

HEAR OUR CURRENT LIVE ALBUM NOW, AVAILABLE ON ITUNES!

  

The cards have fallen into place. 

It genuinely feels like all the elements have come together by the grace of God and we’re now on the verge of something very special. After the success of his most recent solo project, “The Whistles And The Bells”, my long-time friend, Bryan Simpson, asked if I knew just exactly where I'm heading with this group and encouraged me to do everything I can to take it to the next level. “Seize The Day!”, he said. Now after very long days and many hours of writing new material while diving deep into what I wanted to say with this project, we finally came face to face with the obstacle we’d been avoiding; the inevitable question of, 'So how are you going to pay for this endeavor?’. The time has finally come to make a decision. After deliberating with my management, wife and family, we’ve decided this is our best path to success. Our goals, ambitions, and big ideas can be attained on our current trajectory, especially with you guys behind us. It’s YOU that we have chosen to partner with and help to take us to the next level. 

It leaves us, and you. A direct path.

Through our team of mentors and our completely amazing fan base, we have graciously sustained ourselves by keeping all of the proceeds from anything having to do with our band. 

We now humbly ask you to pledge, pre-order, donate, hire us to come play a show, or whatever you feel like doing, to keep it that way. 

(Sound Emporium studios, est. 1969)

 

We cannot create this record without you. 

Our goal of $13,000 covers the cost of recording, the producer fee, mixing, mastering, printing and Indiegogo's fee. The essentials.  

We do hope to be able to stretch past this goal, and have a solid budget to promote, and market the record (Press, videos, radio promotions, advertising, and so much more), but first things first:

We have to raise at least our goal to even take the finished project out of the studio. 

If you back our project: 

•You will receive 'backer only' updates from the studio as recording is happening! 

•You will be the first to hear the record streaming once it is finished. 

•We will love you greatly and feel very warm and fuzzy inside.

Thank you so much for reading this, and considering. 

If you have any questions at all, please email us directly at nathanbeltmusic@live.com or through Indiegogo. We are very open to your thoughts, ideas, and concerns!

Thank you in advance for all you do and your continued support! 

~Nathan Belt & The Buckles


CHECK OUT OUR FEATURED $25 PERK! 

OTHER PERKS INCLUDE:

story:
Elementree Livity Project is recording a new album, and we need YOUR help!

ELP has always been on a mission. A mission to bring the message of Livity to the masses, to spread positive vibes; to advocate a message of peace, harmony & acceptance for all people. And we do this through positive-vibes, reggae rock music.

“Combining the best of multiple genres into a cohesive, catchy and memorable sound is not a simple thing to do. Yet, this Cincinnati-based, multi-talented quintet does just that. Fuse “old school” Rock-n-Roll with Jam & Roots and masterfully layer it over a solid Reggae base and you have the distinct sound of Elementree Livity Project. Whether in a room at the back of a coffee house or an auditorium for thousands, ELP brings people together. When the band clicks on all cylinders, it’s noticeable.” – Michael Clare, mikecimages.

For our upcoming full-length studio debut, ELP has some lofty goals. Put simply we want to release the BEST reggae rock record of 2016/2017 and tour to support the effort. We want our debut LP to carry our message, be musically well representative of who we are and to reach as many friendly ears as possible, We are aggressively striving for this album to be the best it can be, to really move our fans and to make an impact in the music industry.

And so we’ve partnered with the one and only Michael G. of Easy Star Records to help us do just that. We have an opportunity to record with one of the most successful reggae record producers in recent history.

Michael has written, produced, arranged and played on many of Easy Star’s releases, and has worked with some of the biggest names in reggae including Matisyahu, Steel Pulse, Rebelution, Third World, Luciano, Sugar Minott, Toots & the Maytals, Sister Carol, The Meditations, Ranking Joe, Frankie Paul, Morgan Heritage, Israel Vibration, Horace Andy, Sister Nancy, and Half Pint. He also produced Zion Crossroads for acclaimed blues artist Corey Harris, and the self-titled Hatikva 6 for Israel’s leading reggae band.  In 2011, Michael did a dub version of top-selling U.S. reggae band Rebelution’s entire album Peace of Mind. He has done remixes for diverse artists such as Yoko Ono, Umphrey’s McGee, and Tommy T of Gogol Bordello. (Taken from http://www.michaelgoldwasser.com/BIO.aspx)

Obviously, we would prefer to raise all of the funds on our own, but find ourselves in a little bit of a Catch-22 as the album will help us tour and raise the funds, but we need the album first.

Our dreams are now within reach, but the road has its tolls. It's gonna take some significant expense to get where we are going. And with YOUR help, we know that we can get there. Thank you for your interest. Bless up! #elp513 #supportlocalmusic #onelove

Why are we asking for $15,000?

We are actually only asking for less than half of what we need to take this project from dream to reality. We are committing $35,000 of our money, but need another $15K to do this thing right. Why so much money?:

  • As you can imagine, working with a top producer costs a little bit more than using the guy who has a recording studio in his basement.
  • $5K+ for studio rental
  • $5K+ for mixing studio
  • $3K to travel to New York to record for 12 days.
  • $3K-5K for equipment rental needs, guest artists, and travel, room and board for producer - both in Cincinnati and in New York.
  • $10K for distribution and publicity to make sure all the work we put into the album actually gets heard.
  • Bonus: If we surpass goal, $5K for touring and merch expenses to tour on our first album and bring Livity to the masses on a national scale.
  • Regardless o the outcome of this campaign, we are determined and confident that we will make this project happen at any cost, but we would really use your help to make this happen.

How will this impact us?

Honestly, this is a life-changing moment for us. We are committed to making the best album possible and turning our dreams of being a full-time professionally touring  band. You can help be a big part in changing five guys' (and their families) lives forever. We truly believe in the positive message of Livity and feel like this will help us get the message to the masses.

    Risks & Challenges

    Again, we are committed to making this happen, but the risk is that if unsuccessful, it will take us a little longer to get our positive message out to the world. Other obstacles certainly include additional costs that are unforeseen at the time. Regardless, we are driven to make this dream a reality and feel confident in the path we have chosen.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We certainly appreciate your consideration and absolutely realize that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us reach our goal:

    • Whether you donate or not, we would love your help in spreading the word about this campaign and help us promote our message to anyone who may be willing to help.
    • Any help in sharing this in your social networks, or emailing other people you think may be interested is greatly appreciated and will never be forgotten.

story:
The English version can be found below

Version française​

Echange.me est l'application qui vous permet d'échanger des biens et des services en un temps record grâce à la Mise en ligne rapide d'annonce et grâce à la Recherche active instantanée. 

Vous pouvez aussi échanger partout dans le monde grâce à la Messagerie qui traduit les langues étrangères en temps réel ; et grâce au Switch, plus besoin de porte monnaie, votre téléphone remplace vos moyens de paiement.

Avec Echange.me, vous créez votre réseau de confiance et vos groupes d'intérêt commun pour partager vos passions. Et enfin le club VIP Echange.me vous permettra d'accéder à la multipropriété et de réaliser une partie de vos rêves. 

En 3 mots : simple, rapide, efficace !

Echange.me is the application that allows you to exchange goods and services,  in no time,  thanks to the quick online posting and the instant active search.
Switch seamlessly across the world ... thanks to the automatic translation; and thanks to the Switch, your phone replaces your wallet.
With Echange.me, you create your own trusted network group to share your passions.
As for the VIP club,  it offers access to multiownership to realize your dreams.
In 3 words : simple, fast and effective !
​
​
​

story:
ShoutHouse 2015-16

What's in store? 

This coming year will be our most ambitious; we will be performing live throughout NYC, recording new music, filming our first music video, and beginning exciting new collaborations with hip-hop, jazz, and visual artists who will bring our sound to a new level. In the summer of 2015, we launched two competitions: Our first call-for-scores for composers, and our first call-for-tracks for jazz/pop/hip-hop artists. The selected composers will have their pieces performed in one of our fall concerts, and the selected solo artists will have their track arranged to perform as a soloist with the group. ShoutHouse can't wait to hit the ground running this year with music that will challenge listeners (and our performers) to rethink genre and aesthetics, while bringing together diverse artistic voices in the process. 

We have four primary concerts lined up for the coming season. Mark your calendars for the following dates: October 15, 2015, December 11, 2015, March 10, 2016 and June 1, 2016.  By donating today at a level of $50 or more, you will receive free admission to any two of these concerts.


Why support?

By supporting ShoutHouse's work this year, you will be showing your commitment to thoughtful, powerful music that knows no boundaries. At ShoutHouse, we believe that music is a dialogue. Each genre is like a different language, though, and there are few opportunities for classical, jazz, and hip-hop artists to communicate in a meaningful musical way. Over the past two years, through trial and error, we have worked to develop a sound that synthesizes these influences without sacrificing their integrity. Through a combination of improvised and notated music, spoken word and sung poetry, we are creating something unique, important, and worth supporting.

The costs associated with concert production, rehearsal time and space, recording and video production for a group of this size are substantial. We can use all the help we can get! Whether it be $5, $25, $100 or $100,000,000, any contribution will go a long way towards allowing us to continue doing what we love to do: building, through music, an artistic community that celebrates cultural difference by refusing to be inhibited by it.  

We hope you'll join this community by pledging your support, coming to shows, and engaging with, questioning, and spreading the message of our group. Help us keep the creative energy of our city alive and stronger than ever!


What We Need & What You Get

ShoutHouse is a band, sort of. But really we are a small orchestra, with 15-18 members. For the last two years, we have been funded largely by out-of-pocket spending.  However, as our vision has expanded and our mission has grown, our need for funding has likewise increased. In 2015-16, we are applying for a variety of public and private arts grants (including fiscal support from the Fractured Atlas organization) which will hopefully support us in the coming years. In order to fund this season, however, we need the support of our audience.

The $8,000 we are hoping to raise will go entirely towards the production of our first two concerts in the Fall. Expenses associated with these concerts include $2,000 for venue rental, $1,000 for rehearsal space, $500 for equipment rental and cartage, and $4,500 for artist fees.

See those perks over the right side of your screen? These are our special way of thanking you for your invaluable support. Want to a signed copy of our album? Just $25! Want the album PLUS free admission to any two concerts this season? THAT CAN HAPPEN for only $50! We will doodle you a personal thank you card, read and record your music, or perform a private concert just for YOU!


Other Ways You Can Help

Any size gift will go a long way! But, in addition to giving, we hope you'll spread the word by sharing this campaign, and our music, on the world wide web and across the wide world. None of this can happen without you and without your support. Thank you so much!

Love,

ShoutHouse

story:
Hello! 

My name is Anthony Rispo. So far I've enjoyed a wonderful career as a musician, playing everything from classical organ to rock music; from composing/songwriting to improvisation! But nothing has filled me with greater joy than working on my new project, #MusicForTomorrow. 

The #MusicForTomorrow 'campaign' is to fund the full production (video and audio) of several songs that I have written which are based on the stories and experiences of others. 

The #MusicForTomorrow 'movement' is meant to provide great music with a unique message of hope by using people's stories and life experiences. But the impetus behind the term came from a desire within: a desire to finally leave behind the things of the past that pained me and controlled me. Through songwriting, I learned to objectify my experiences and to repave and redirect my way of thinking. I never thought that, through songwriting, I would feel as free as I do now! Because I   had known since I was about 15 years old that I would be a professional musician, I didn't want to just play music for my own enjoyment. I knew I wanted to profoundly affect the lives of others in some way and make a change for the better by reaching out to people. It took the pain of my own demons and trials for me to understand my truth and purpose; that is, to help make the lives of others a little brighter, and to promote a better and more fulfilling tomorrow by sharing others' stories through song. #MusicForTomorrow is a community effort to bring people together and to strengthen our human connection. By sharing our stories and experiences with one another- most meaningfully through the expression of music- we enhance our empathy for, and our understanding of, each other. And thus we become closer as people. Music is one of the best depictions of the human condition, it portrays every emotion and feeling we manifest, and can sometimes tell our stories much better than we can alone. That being said, #MusicForTomorrow will solicit from individuals or groups of people stories to form the heart of future songs intended to uplift and foster hope for those in most need of it. 

If you'd like to learn more about how your story or experiences can become a song, or part of a song, please visit http://www.anthonyrispo.com/storiestosongs/

How You Will Help Make a Difference?  
Your contribution to #MusicForTomorrow will allow the above mentioned goals to be fulfilled. A quality finished product is artwork, and I believe art is one of the best ways to touch the soul. By donating to this project you will be part of the artistic process. 
 
What We Need & What You Get
  • In order for #MusicForTomorrow to be successful, we need to raise $32,000.00. That includes cost of production, which is $1,100 MAX for audio production per song, $600 for video, musicians fees, venue fees, travel costs, and advertisement. 
  • If the goal isn't reached, the funds will still be used for the production of as many songs possible! Any contribution counts and can be a pathway to more opportunities for the growth of this initiative. 


Risks & Challenges

  • Obstacles are inevitable, but they shouldn't inevitably dictate unsuccessful outcomes.  I believe that following our dreams and goals is paramount to our well-being, and being able to overcome such risks and challenges only proves one's ability and drive to forge ahead towards one's dreams. My dream is to begin the process of healing through the power of music. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Anther way you can help is by sharing information regarding #MusicForTomorrow with your network on social media or other means, including email! 
To share this information on FaceBook or Twitter please use this model: 

example: “Please show your support for (tag) Anthony Rispo’s (my music page)- or @anthony_rispo (Twitter)- campaign, #MusicForTomorrow. (insert personal reason why ‘you’ support the campaign).To find out more and to donate, visit indigogo.com/mft !" 

To qualify for the $5.00 perk: 

  • 10 shares, on different days, on either twitter and/or FaceBook until the end of the campaign. 

To qualify for the $25.00 perk: 

  • 5 shares, on different days, on twitter and/or Facebook and post one fb video promoting #MusicForTomorrow with a personal message, until the end of the campaign.

story:
"Happily Neverafter" US Tour Campaign

On tour in support of their new release "Happily Neverafter" on Famous Records Global/ Pavement / Sony Red, be a part of the "Evil Across America" US Tour Campaign as MURDER FM criss cross the US on the REVOLVER Magazine "South for the Win-Tour" in November and with (HED)PE & ALIEN ANT FARM in December.

VIP Perks for those that join the Evil Campaign

 ONLY 10 Days to help join the evil and be a part of the "Evil Across America" US Tour campaign and help it be the best in can be! Receive fan perks such as Pre-Show "Private Acoustic Performances" for you and your friends on any of the "Evil Across America" US Tourdates, Autographed T-Shirts, Dinner with the band, Guitar lessons with Vocalist/Guitarist Norman Matthew, a private photo shoot by Guitarist Matt X3r0 & X3r0 Class Photography, Autographed Drumsticks from Jason "Shakes" West" or even a Skype call with bassist J6!

If the band isn't coming to your town, you can still donate to the campaign and help bring the evil to YOUR city!

Other Ways You Can Help

Finances aren't the only way to help. Spreading the word via social media, emails, texts, phone calls to friends and creating awareness in any way possible is amazingly helpful to the success of the band. We have made it this far thanks to YOU and every time Murder FM wins, YOU win, because in the end, it's all about the blood, sweat & tears we leave onstage and the impact we can make on peoples live, one at a time. Rock isn't dead! \m/

story:
Our Story

Fair Weather unofficially started playing together simply because we were three friends who enjoyed each other's company and music-making. We met while attending Columbia Teachers College together (and we're graduating soon!), and we played our first show together when I (Sarah) recorded an acoustic EP (you can listen to it here) and asked my friends Tim and Yan to play with me at my EP release show last May. That EP was called Fair Weather, and we officially started playing together with that name  since August 2015. 

We sprang from the little musings of one voice and one guitar and grew into a full band sound with indie-folk-rock-pop-soul influences. We added two more friends (a drummer and keyboardist) to our band, and we've been furiously writing and performing at venues all over New York City, including the Bowery Electric, The Delancey, Pianos, and Rockwood Music Hall. (Check out our live videos in the Gallery!) Our music has been compared to Poliça, Radiohead, Chvrches, and Feist, but we like to think of our songs as a collision of five friends who come from different places with different tastes and perspectives. We are thankful for the support and encouragement of our friends, of accidental fans, of passersby, and of other artists. There is nothing like singing, playing, and dancing with friends - both in the band and the audience. 

However, as much as we love performing, we believe that artists were meant to create. We've come to the part of our journey where we want to create something that endures beyond the shows and the stage. Our goal is to record our first studio EP and to release it in late winter/early spring! 


What We Need - And What You Get!

We have secured studio time in upstate New York in February, but we are still in need of funding to make this EP happen. 

You can help make it possible!

Our goal is to raise $5,000. This amount would cover studio recording time and transportation costs for band members and their instruments. 

Any amount is much appreciated, but here are some perks!

$15 - digital download of the EP

$25 - pre-released digital download of the EP

$50 - handmade postcard with lyrics of one of our songs (calligraphied and mailed to you by Sarah) + above perks

$75 - T-shirt + above perks

$150 - choose a song for us to cover at a future show + above perks

$300 - invitation to our private listening party in NYC + above perks

$500 - co-write a song with the band + above perks


Your Impact

Your contribution, whatever the amount, will help us make something permanent, reach a wider audience, and add momentum to our journey as a band. We have come a long way in the short four months that we've been playing, and we have faith that with the help of friends, there are greater things in store for us! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give, you can still help! You can share our campaign with friends on facebook, instagram, twitter, and other social media. 

Thank you!

Your love and support mean the world to us.

story:
(Top photo by Monica Frisell)

In April of 2014, I decided to bring both my music and poetry together for the first time in the studio. I realized just how much they overlapped. Now I have a record that I want to share with you: American Thicket. It comprises the best of my first 6 years of successful writing, fusing it with the sounds I've been developing at the piano, in groups, and on the road. The resulting music, played by Mat Maneri, Thomas Morgan, Flin van Hemmen and myself, is gruff, urgent, subtle and effusive. I hope you will listen.

Let me in turn introduce this project to you in the hopes that you will not only see what an effort these musicians have made, but share in this experience which has so deeply informed my artistic life for the past two years.


(You can hear the opening track from the record American Thicket - HERE.)

(Photo by Monica Frisell)


I need funding to complete this record. The album is finished, literally; fully recorded, mixed and mastered - right now I just need enough to cover the manufacturing costs of a short run of physical CDs so that I can bring this music home to you. Now that you've heard about the music we make as a collective ensemble, here's a little bit about each musician in the band.  If you haven't yet, I hope you will give this music a listen so you can truly hear what this project is about.  

Personnel:
Eliot Cardinaux - piano, compositions, poetry, spoken word
Mat Maneri - viola
Thomas Morgan - upright bass
Flin van Hemmen - drums, percussion

Mat Maneri is a violist and violinist whose early musical exploits with his father - saxophonist, pianist, clarinetist and composer Joe Maneri (an ECM recording artist and professor of microtonal music at New England Conservatory, now deceased) - have led him into a highly prolific career as a working improviser, with musicians as distinct and renowned as Paul Motian, Cecil Taylor, Matthew Shipp, and Joe Morris.

Thomas Morgan as a bassist has worked intimately with master musicians such as Bill Frisell, Paul Motian, Masabumi Kikuchi, David Binney, Craig Taborn, and Tyshawn Sorey. His sense of melody and space can bring even the most complex music to life with a deeply felt simplicity evocative of an image of someone a great many years wiser than he. 

Flin van Hemmen is a drummer/percussionist who has worked as an improviser on the New York scene with consistency over the past ten years. He has been featured in bands led by one of New York's most highly coveted voices, tenor and soprano saxophonist Tony Malaby, as well as in Norwegian top-call New York bassist Eivind Opsvik's band, Overseas, and has developed projects with countless other highly skilled musical craftsmen in New York and abroad, always bringing something gentle yet audaciously honest to the table. 


(You can hear the opening track from the record - American Thicket - HERE.)

(Photo by Peter Ganushkin - Ibeam, Brooklyn, 2015)

 

Eliot Cardinaux has worked in the free-music and avant-garde world as a pianist, poet, composer, and improviser for over 10 years. After leaving the Manhattan School of Music in 2006, he was hired in bands led by alto saxophonists Pete Robbins and David Binney, and worked out of New York as a freelance musician. His piano sound is characterized by a light-handed touch and tone. His attention to detail in his work is exhibited in the editing process he has developed for his poetry, much like his process for composing, or mixing an album in the studio. His love and study of many musics as well as poetries, but specifically those which innovate, has helped him grow both lyrically and imagistically in his writing and his music. He has worked in bands led by such highly revered musical figures as violist Mat Maneri, conduction inventor and composer Butch Morris, Danish multi-instrumentalist Kresten Osgood, guitarist Ryan Blotnick, and drummer/composer/pianist/trombonist Tyshawn Sorey. In addition, he has been published as a poet in Caliban, Big Big Wednesday, and Boston Hassle (where he served as poetry editor last summer). Within his busy working life as a freelance musician and poet, he is currently attaining a degree from the New England Conservatory of Music in Contemporary Improvisation.


(You can hear the opening track from the record American Thicket - HERE.)

(Photo by Per Vissing - Copenhagen Jazz Festival, 2015)


Why I need your help

Two years ago, when the idea for this project came to me, I had just secured two grants from the Western Massachusetts Training Consortium to fund a record. All of that money went directly to production costs and to paying the musicians a fair wage for their work. Since then I've hit a road block. I need funding to complete this project. All money will go towards printing CDs and organizing release concerts so I can bring this music home to you, our audience.

The perks

By donating, you can receive perks that will be mailed to your doorstep, like a copy of the album in CD form; a poetry chapbook that contains all of the poems on the album; and some of the more special perks which include a private lesson with me in either poetry, music, or both; a private solo concert; a workshop; and even a home-cooked dinner with my partner and me in Jamaica Plain, Massachusetts where you can meet friends of the band and enjoy a private listening. Be sure to check out the list for special offers.

The main thing is that you have a choice. Listen. Donate what you can. If you can't donate now, then spread the word.  Share this link with someone on Facebook, email it to a friend or family member, or simply tell someone that you'd be interested in supporting this project. Let them know that it's happening. That's all. Your help goes a long way. 

Thanks. I hope that with your help I can make this music as much of a reality for you and so many others as it is for me. I wish you faith, hope and perseverance in the New Year.

- Eliot Cardinaux


(You can hear the opening track from the record American Thicket - HERE.)
