Thomas Morgan - upright bass
Flin van Hemmen - drums, percussion


Mat Maneri is a violist and violinist whose early musical exploits with his father - saxophonist, pianist, clarinetist and composer Joe Maneri (an ECM recording artist and professor of microtonal music at New England Conservatory, now deceased) - have led him into a highly prolific career as a working improviser, with musicians as distinct and renowned as Paul Motian, Cecil Taylor, Matthew Shipp, and Joe Morris.



Thomas Morgan as a bassist has worked intimately with master musicians such as Bill Frisell, Paul Motian, Masabumi Kikuchi, David Binney, Craig Taborn, and Tyshawn Sorey. His sense of melody and space can bring even the most complex music to life with a deeply felt simplicity evocative of an image of someone a great many years wiser than he. 





Flin van Hemmen is a drummer/percussionist who has worked as an improviser on the New York scene with consistency over the past ten years. He has been featured in bands led by one of New York's most highly coveted voices, tenor and soprano saxophonist Tony Malaby, as well as in Norwegian top-call New York bassist Eivind Opsvik's band, Overseas, and has developed projects with countless other highly skilled musical craftsmen in New York and abroad, always bringing something gentle yet audaciously honest to the table. 

(You can hear the opening track from the record - American Thicket - HERE.)

(Photo by Peter Ganushkin - Ibeam, Brooklyn, 2015)

 
Eliot Cardinaux has worked in the free-music and avant-garde world as a pianist, poet, composer, and improviser for over 10 years. After leaving the Manhattan School of Music in 2006, he was hired in bands led by alto saxophonists Pete Robbins and David Binney, and worked out of New York as a freelance musician. His piano sound is characterized by a light-handed touch and tone. His attention to detail in his work is exhibited in the editing process he has developed for his poetry, much like his process for composing, or mixing an album in the studio. His love and study of many musics as well as poetries, but specifically those which innovate, has helped him grow both lyrically and imagistically in his writing and his music. He has worked in bands led by such highly revered musical figures as violist Mat Maneri, conduction inventor and composer Butch Morris, Danish multi-instrumentalist Kresten Osgood, guitarist Ryan Blotnick, and drummer/composer/pianist/trombonist Tyshawn Sorey. In addition, he has been published as a poet in Caliban, Big Big Wednesday, and Boston Hassle (where he served as poetry editor last summer). Within his busy working life as a freelance musician and poet, he is currently attaining a degree from the New England Conservatory of Music in Contemporary Improvisation.

(You can hear the opening track from the record American Thicket - HERE.)

(Photo by Per Vissing - Copenhagen Jazz Festival, 2015)

Why I need your help
Two years ago, when the idea for this project came to me, I had just secured two grants from the Western Massachusetts Training Consortium to fund a record. All of that money went directly to production costs and to paying the musicians a fair wage for their work. Since then I've hit a road block. I need funding to complete this project. All money will go towards printing CDs and organizing release concerts so I can bring this music home to you, our audience.
The perks
By donating, you can receive perks that will be mailed to your doorstep, like a copy of the album in CD form; a poetry chapbook that contains all of the poems on the album; and some of the more special perks which include a private lesson with me in either poetry, music, or both; a private solo concert; a workshop; and even a home-cooked dinner with my partner and me in Jamaica Plain, Massachusetts where you can meet friends of the band and enjoy a private listening. Be sure to check out the list for special offers.
The main thing is that you have a choice. Listen. Donate what you can. If you can't donate now, then spread the word.  Share this link with someone on Facebook, email it to a friend or family member, or simply tell someone that you'd be interested in supporting this project. Let them know that it's happening. That's all. Your help goes a long way. 
Thanks. I hope that with your help I can make this music as much of a reality for you and so many others as it is for me. I wish you faith, hope and perseverance in the New Year.
- Eliot Cardinaux

(You can hear the opening track from the record American Thicket - HERE.)

story:
Our debut album "When You Drink, I Drink. When You Sink. I Sink" launched earlier this year. We've supported it with two tours since and many of the awesome people we met really wanted it on Vinyl instead of CD. So, here we are with the opportunity to make that happen (and hopefully work on new things) with your involvement!

If you've never heard of us:

  • We are a band based in Los Angeles with Latin roots that play music influenced by East Los Punk, Latin Folk music, and more. It's been dubbed Fringe-Punk.
  • Our first goal is to bring our album to vinyl for the fans who want it but we would like to make MORE awesome stuff with your involvement!

Sounds cool to you? Then please read on! :3

As much as we would love to fund the Vinyl ourselves we have a few reasons for using IndieGoGo as a platform.

  • First off, upon asking each other for a loan, the response ended up being:
  • If we had the funds, it would still be difficult to reach out to everyone we met on tour directly. Using INDIEGOGO creates an easy way for us to share this with our fans, the venues we've played, and friends who can help us reach all the . It's also a great way to get shipping info for anyone who wants our album or other goodies!

Now for the fun part! If we are successful here is what we'll be creating, and furthermore what we hope to achieve together! 

$2,800 - Casual Mode - At this level we can get a standard 12" vinyl LP with a basic printed jacket. It will make us 250 Vinyls.


$3,400 - Hero Mode - Our secondary goal is to upgrade to durable 180 gram vinyls and a sweet gate-fold jacket with interior art featuring the names of all of you beautiful people who helped make this a reality.



All levels include the cost of good packaging materials to make sure we've done all we can to get them to you safely. Interior art update coming soon!

Each tier includes whats listed in the perks and may unlock future bonuses with your involvement in a successful campaign! In addition to the vinyl and our existing music we are sooner or later headed into the studio to record a new single.

We are uploading some rare audio, preview tracks, and are hoping to make some other goodies that only our backers can access!("Big Tip" includes this tier)

Immediately download our Album & EP in your choice of format from Bandcamp and get the new single for free when it is released! ("Just The Vinyl, Please" includes this tier)

You'll get the commemorative poster along with the signed Vinyl. If we do well you can expect more goodies like a full version of our upcoming game.

A merchandise package including all of our music is on the way as well as the signed vinyl! Bonuses include a character in our upcoming games, early access, and more. 

It's an early-bird special for the first few backers - You get one of our test copies of the Vinyl album before the official release! You shall also receive all of our existing merchandise. We'll also make a point to tour where you want us in 2016!

Unlocks everything forever! Additionally we'll come play a private show for you, or get you backstage and to hang out with us for dinner, if you don't want us tearing up your living room. ("Brah" Includes this tier")
 

Yeah! What would an IndieGoGo campaign be without stretch goals! Lets see...we have quite a few ideas. Some of the things we plan to do:

  • Commemorative Campaign Merchandise (unlocked for Level 2 backers)
  • A new EP release (unlocked at Levels 1 and up, CD's unlocked at Level 3)
  • A new video directed by Youtube and Newgrounds star SexuaLobster
  • A video game (access unlocked at Level 1, Early Access at "Girl Friar")
  • A national tour (Choose where at Level 3 and up!)

We'll unveil more detailed information and cost levels for each as soon as we hit our minimum goal!

Have ideas for stretch goals? We didn't call this "FORWARD TOGETHER!" for no good reason. Please feel free to let us know what you would like out of your support!

We face some pretty big risks in this campaign, even though it is a small minimum - we've invested considerable time and a fair deal of monies in getting this going. Aside from that potentially being wasted, issues that could crop up include:

  • Production delays: Vinyl manufacturers are overburdened and lead times vary anywhere between 4 weeks to pretty much a whole year. We've been quoted at 20 weeks total but this can change dramatically by the time the funds are raised. There isn't much we can do about this, but we will communicate any thing we hear to our backers ASAP!
  • Unexpected Costs or emergencies: Although we have budgeted conservatively, something can always go wrong. Maybe our packaging materials will be ironically damaged when shipped to us, or our run of Vinyls is lost in a storm! These issues fall on us to deal with to the best of our ability and will result in a lot of extra work and money.
  • Damaged Vinyls: Although we have planned to purchase all the shipping items we need to safely send the vinyls as secure as possible, they are fragile items and if mishandled or not secured properly en route may damage the vinyl itself or the jacket. We are prepared for a 15% return rate in the case of this and will send another.

  • Not Making our goal: If we don't make the minimum but we made enough to at least fulfill our total Vinyl orders if we get a cheaper manufacturer, or cut back on printing materials, etc. we will but it to a vote for our backers: Raise the rest of the funds (more time waiting) or fulfill the vinyl orders as is with a lower quality product.

    If we don't make enough to fulfill the vinyl orders the money will most likely go toward creating the single or next EP, and if so we'll create a backer exclusive edition with bonus tracks for your ears only.

    Either way, if something goes wrong we will figure out options and put it to a backer vote!

    Got a better idea for resolving an issue? Please let us know! After all, the support is coming from YOUR dollar and we want to make sure everything works out in the end!

Any support is extremely appreciated, even if you don't purchase a Vinyl. We try our best to support the disenfranchised (it is called FRINGE punk after all) by participating at community events throughout the year. On our upcoming tours we are planning to play at community and youth centers all over the country and at all-ages spaces.

For the kids!



It's cool! We know how it goes. If you would like to still help us please use the Indiegogo sharing tools to tell the world!

Better yet, show your friends this page yourself, or call them up and tell them. Post us in your music sharing groups, etc. We will appreciate you sharing this page greatly. Let us know if you do! We would love to return the favor or otherwise get you something.

Thanks for reading all the way to the bottom! We hope you decide to help us make these vinyls (and other goodies) a reality. After all,  there is no fry without you!

story:
About Pierre Anthony

Pierre Anthony is a Detroit-based singer/rapper/songwriter who is looking to create his first official album.

Music has always been an important part of my life. I writes songs that show my ideas, my life and the challenges of finding self-assurance. 

Your contributions will cover the producer's fees, recording, mixing, mastering and other associated costs.

To do it right, production cost(record, mix and master) are going to be expensive and then additional funds are needed to pay for promotional costs...not to mention additional money for the goodies (t-shirtrs, photo's, etc). I've set a goal of $10,000 in order to offset these costs. If more than $10,000 is raised than the excess money will be used to cover these costs fully and plan a tour that will have me somewhere near your town.

What We Need & What You Get

I've drafted a plan to empower me and you and make this album epic.  I want to raise a minimum of $10,000 to release a full-length album.  This will cover all recording, mixing, master and of course, the amazing perks I have come up with.  I'll be using every dollar raised for:

  • Album Production: Recording, mixing and mastering.
  • Manufacturing: Pressing and packaging of physical CDs to be sold at concerts, online, physical retailers and shipinternationally.
  • Promotional Materials: Printed media, posters, photography, digital campaigns and advertising.
  • Videos: Create 1 amazing video to support the album.

I know I have a very supportive fans out there.  It is possible that I will surpass this goal so I want to offer incentives for my fans to continue to give beyond the $10,000 goal.  Here is the plan:

  • $10,000 - Everything above
  • $15,000 - Film an additional video, press album to vinyl and add a tour date.
  • $20,000 - Additional tour date and additional money for marketing and distribution.

The Impact

It is hard to express how much this project would change my life.

Music has this incredible ability to heal people and unite people, to express feelings that help us feel connected in fundamental human ways.  Over the past several years on my own, I've collaborated with amazing artists, and did background vocals for various artists. I've had the opportunity to rock out at the 2015 Concert of Colors, Campus Martius, WALK Fashion Show- Detroit, 2015 River Days and a host of other events.  I've been blessed t be named the 2012 Internet Broadcasting Association Performance Artist of the year and 2013 Detroit Black Music Awards R&B Male Vocalist of the Year.

I want to go further and with your help I can.

For those of you who don't know me, please check out my videos on YouTube (www.youtube.com/pierreanthony313) and after listening come back and contribute.  I guarantee that it will be worth your time.  

Risks & Challenges

Pinning down exact costs related to recording and promotion can sometimes e a challenge, given the many variles at play.  I am well aware of this but my first and foremost task is to deliver a quality record, no matter the associated costs.  Your donations will help offset the scosts I will have to assume to get that high-quality product in your hands.

Your contributions will help to cover these costs...in return you get some great rewards! Check out the Perk section!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that there are some of you who just don't have extra money to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't hel:

  • Spread the word anbout my efforts and get others that you know excited about supporting y dream. There are some great share tools here on Indegogo.
  • Continue to share your positive energy.

If you are ready to mak a contribution, you can just click the big pink "Contribute Now" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and I'm so, so, very grateful for the support.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my campaign page.  I really can't wit to share my music with you.

story:
Help Us Release Our New Album

It's been almost four years since the release of Seeking Seven's The Surface EP.  This new album is long overdue but for good reason:

  • No record labels, no big name producers...  Just Seeking Seven.  We decided to record this album on our own.  Because of the incredibly high bar set with The Surface EP, we've taken our time to make sure we bring you something that has no corners cut.  
  • Let's face it...  the industry has changed and music just doesn't sell anymore and we realize that.  Bands far and wide known and unknown are facing the same issues.  It's up to you... the fans to keep new original music alive.  Support not just Seeking Seven... but all music as a whole.  If you like it... pay for it... it's how they bring more to you!
  • We're not asking for a lot... just an album preorder!  Our promise to you is the best album we can bring you!

To be released on January 26th 2015 the new album entitle Chaos Before The Fall will be released!  Get yours early... and in doing so it's you our fans who made this happen!  Thank you for your support!  You keep our dreams alive!

All We're Asking For is Pre Orders!

Simple as it says:

  • Pre order the album get it a week before release date.
  • We're not asking for a dime more than what we're selling the album for, but if you do wish to donate more... we have just a few perks for you.  
  • The money in our goal is for pressing the album, digital distribution, and to provide the perks we're offering.  If we don't reach our goal... no worries, we will all just work overtime to make sure we give you what we've promised on time.  Anything we make over our goal will go right back to you in forms of perks.  The more you give... the more you get.

And that's all there is to it.  Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!  Rob, Jake, Jerm, and Dakota

story: !

Who is 2341?

We are Danielle, Edward and Nicole Brown; daughters and son of Marilyn and Garrett Brown - a family of gospel and jazz musicians and singers.

Over the years, collectively we have recorded and toured with many artist like: Stevie Wonder, George Duke, Karen Briggs, Kim Burrell, Usher, Jazz in P!nk, Fred Hammond and Lexi Allen just to name a few.

About this album:

Our Mom, Marilyn Brown, has always wanted us to record an album together. When she retired this spring, the gift we decided to give her was that album she has always wanted us to release. On May 14, 2016 we had an retirement concert celebration in her honor in which we hired the best live music record company to record us and some of the best vocalists, performing the original songs, based on topics and Scriptures that Mom requested.

What is this campaign for?

We've been able to cover a good portion of the costs of recording of this project so far and when you are recording with quality in mind, costs up add rapidly! Your pre- order purchase will go towards the following costs:
  1. Studio Time: Seven songs are already done and if we meet our goal we will record more songs in studio.
  2.  Travel Cost: Since we're spread across the states; Dallas,  Los Angeles and and Sacramento, travel costs add up fast.
  3. Mixing & Mastering: This step ensures you'll  have a great listening experience across all listening platforms.
  4. CD and DVD pressing and promotion
  5. Shipping Cost
  6. Indiegogo Fees



OTHER WAYS TO HELP US REACH OUR GOAL
  • Let your friends know about our IndieGoGo Campaign by sharing with your Facebook friends. There are social media share buttons here on this page. Share, Share, Share. :)

    •

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

If we don't reach the goal of $15,000 we will create the highest quality product within the budget of what is raised through your pre-orders. We will work hard to get them shipped to you on time, but as you know, there’s always the possibility that things go a little slower than expected, with a smaller budget. We promise to do our best, and we’ll keep you in the loop with updates.

We are SO grateful for your support.

Thank you in advance and God Bless.
Danielle
Edward
Nicole

On May 14, 2016 we had an retirement concert celebration in her honor in which we hired the best live music record company to  record us and some of the best vocalists, performing the original songs, based on topics and Scriptures that Mom requested.



What is this campaign for?
 
We've been able to cover a good portion of the costs of recording of this project so far and when you are recording with quality in mind,
costs up add rapidly! Your pre- order purchase will go towards the following costs:

Studio Time: Seven songs are already done and if we meet our goal we will record more songs in studio.

 Travel Cost: Since we're spread across the states; Dallas,  Los Angeles and and Sacramento, travel costs add up fast.

Mixing
     & Mastering: This step ensures you'll  have a great
     listening experience across all listening platforms.
CD
     and DVD pressing and promotion
Shipping Cost
Indiegogo Fees





OTHER WAYS TO HELP US REACH OUR GOAL Let your friends know about our IndieGoGo Campaign by sharing with your Facebook friends. There are social media share
buttons here on this page. Share, Share, Share. :)







RISKS AND CHALLENGES
If we don't reach the goal of $15,000 we will create the highest quality product within the budget of what is raised through your pre-orders. We will work hard to get them shipped to you 
on time, but as you know, there’s always the possibility that things go a
 little slower than expected, with a smaller budget. We promise to 
do our best, and we’ll keep you in the loop with updates.
We are SO grateful for your support.
Thank you in advance and God Bless.DanielleEdwardNicole

story:
Hello hello! 

I am Emma van Heyn, on the brink of releasing my debut album, Asylum. I am a 21-year-old singer-songwriter from Cape Town, South Africa. I have been working on this music for quite some time – writing songs, self-producing them and recording them. I would really like to ensure that I can get these songs out there with full exposure and in the best possible quality. This is why I would love your help!


Debut Album - Asylum

I am incredibly excited about this product. It is a 15 track album made up of all-original content. I have already recorded this album, working with an extremely talented engineer, Uys Visser at Uys Visser Productions in the beautiful town of Franschhoek. If all goes well, I will be releasing the album by the end of August 2016.

There are a few costs that I will need to cover for its release:

  • Engineering Costs
  • Studio Time
  • Mastering Costs
  • Photographer – Publicity Shots & Album Cover
  • Dress Design
  • Album Design
  • Album Printing
  • Album Promotion
  • Publicity
  • Live Album Launch
  • Musicians

I conceptualise, direct and edit my own music videos. The more songs I release, the costlier these music videos become as a collective.

These costs include:

  • Venue Hire
  • Costume Design
  • Equipment Hire
  • Technical Team

And the magic number I need is… $7000! Now, that sounds like a lot of money. But! I can assure you that every bit of your donation will not go to waste.

Let me introduce myself

I am a little lady with big hair, but more importantly, I take song writing very seriously because I take the issues I write about very seriously. My songs come from a place of personal justice and situational passion. Every song has a different theme that I think will relate to many of you. Some of the themes include love, betrayal, political corruption, abuse and female exploitation.

I will be SO thankful for your help! I am currently finishing up my degree in Drama at Stellenbosch University. I live off eggs on crackers so I can pay my musicians and pay off my father who has been helping me out with my musical demands. Am I complaining? No way! In fact, I absolutely love it. I love it because I know this album will reap the benefits if it is released properly. Your donation will help me incredibly and my appreciation for this is beyond the realms of appreciation.

How else can you help?

Share and spread the word! Thank you for taking the time to see what this album is about. I can guarantee you this will not disappoint!

story:
About the Project

J.D. Stone and the Last Days is a music project that lives within the pages of fiction as much as in the mundane world that we all know. Stone appears in my novel The Tennessee Highway Death Chant (Featherproof 2016), and has been writing songs for many years. The songs on The Strip Teen Dream Journey represent his most mature work as a songwriter. 

The album is based on a book I'm writing also called The Strip Teen Dream Journey, which tells the story of a veteran of the Vietnam War who, after taking an injection of a mystical drug called ‘gravity’, wanders into a strip club, where he falls in love with a beautiful dancer. The novel recounts the veteran’s journey toward the stage. It is a journey in which a filmic past, a hallucinatory present and a barren future all intermingle in waves of psychedelic sensation.

 

About the People

This campaign is to help us record in a professional studio on 2” tape and release an LP on vinyl. The musicians involved are: Cassandra Jenkins, Mat Petronelli and Celeste Carballo (Ritual Humor), with whom I used to play in a band called Sister Carrie and the Love Choir; the composer and pianist Henrik Ajax from Germany, who's got a great feel for honky tonk piano; a friend of mine from way back, Matt Adams, from the L.A. band The Blank Tapes, and Sam Owens (Celestial Shore). We also have a professional pedal steel player coming in to play on a few tracks. Everyone is enthusiastic about getting together again for this recording session at Figure 8.

 

About the Campaign

We already have the studio booked and some initial funds secured, and we wanted to open up the opportunity to our friends and community to support the project. Some of the costs involved include: studio ($1600), engineer ($1000), pedal steel player ($300), piano tuning ($150), tape ($100), mastering ($500).

We are trying to keep things simple so we can focus on the music. Your advanced purchases of the album will ensure that it is the best it can be.  And for extra support, there will be special hand-bound songbooks available, acknowledgments of our gratitude, as well as real (i.e. not digital) photos and 16mm film stills.

If we do not reach our entire goal, the project will go forward. Unlike a novel, which exists in the same form it is created, a song is not fully realized until it has been recorded. The time has come to record these songs for the Strip Teen Dream Journey.

 

About the Future

Once The Strip Teen Dream Journey  is completed, I will focus next on finishing the novel on which the music is based. I have also been composing songs for my next music project, a two-volume album based on the sacred tarot. Having the Strip Teen album finished will provide tremendous momentum to forge ahead.

story:
What's the story?

 I remember being a young girl, who loved singing, and was constantly being moved by music. I knew from a young age that I wanted to use music to change things. I knew I was meant for it, but I didn't know what it would look like to step into it. As I've developed in God and in who I know I am, I've realized, there's no set way of going about it. The dreams I have, the destiny I am stewarding, it's all from Him. And He knows what it looks like. I've realized all He wants is our 'yes'. I have wanted to share my music for a long time, but it wasn't until recently that I really felt God say 'it's time'. I am beyond excited to get started, and to run full-force into this. 

The music I will share with you is inspired by a huge mix of different moments. Moments where I've been worshipping in my incredible community and capturing the journey we've been on together. And moments when it's just me and God, where Him and I are in our own little world of intimacy that makes my heart come alive. 

What We Need 

I am so full of excitement when I think of the process of this album, and even though it can be intimidating, I know God's got this. I am not in this alone!  I have so many incredible people who have known me, seen my journey, seen me grow, and who I am so PUMPED to welcome on board in this project. Friends who are great at their craft, and have incredible hearts for worship. We have the passion and the heart, what we need next is support. 

Our goal is to raise $10,000, which will cover the cost of the process from beginning to end. Here's what the process looks like:

  • Pre-production (My talented, longtime friend Stephen Heidinga is producing this album, and there is no one I trust more to do an incredible job.)
  • Hiring passionate professionals for the extra goodness
  • Studio recording
  • Mixing (music, not pizza dough)
  • Mastering and finalizing
  • Album promotion
  • ALBUM RELEASE (W0000000)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course any support is valued beyond measure. Whatever you can give financially, it will all go to the same place, and to the same dream coming true. Here are a few other ways that you can be involved in a practical way:

  • PRAYER. I know this project is backed up by our incredible Heavenly Father, and we want this process to go as smoothly as possible. Pray for us! Pray for inspiration, provision, fun, and pray that this album can reach people with the Father's love.
  • SPREAD THE WORD! All it takes is the click of a button for this project to be shared all over the world. Even if you're afraid of looking like that crazy person that shares the same thing everyday, from the bottom of my heart, I thank you, and you can take comfort knowing that I will be that other crazy person right alongside you. 

My heart is for this album to create a safe place for people to connect with their Father. My prayer is that every part of this process from beginning to end, would glorify God, and who He is. 

Thank you for partnering with me, believing in me, and staying tuned as I jump out of the boat into this adventure. 

In love and excitement, 
Talia D'Orazio

story:
Who we are 

Tulula! has been stomping around Rip Van Winkle’s dreamland since the mid-ougts.  The Acid-Cowboy quintet of Jason Broome, Rob Norris, Chris Bradley, Daniel Weintraub and Marianne Tasick come off like a mosh pit at a gypsy carnival followed by a séance with the 27 club. Between them, these five veterans of underground music have toured the world, recorded over twenty-five albums and eaten like princes with paupers. Tulula! is sure to whisk you one dance away from the happy farm.

Jason Broome (guitars/vocals/piano/mandolin)
Daniel Weintraub (guitars/vocals/keys/mandolin/percussion)
Marianne Tasick (violin/vocals/piano/avocado shaker)
Chris Bradley (drums/vocals/percussion/accordion/glockenspiel)
Rob Norris (bass/vocals/spiritual guidance)  

What We Need 

We need $500 for mastering our new record and $1000 to duplicate the artwork and the physical CD.  We performed, recorded, engineered, and produced all of the music ourselves.  Now we just need to "master" it  -the last step of the process- and the art of consolidating and normalizing the tones, volumes, and put the final aesthetic icing on the musical cake. 

We hope to make a few hundred copies and your contribution will reap the benefitted and glossy widget!  

If we manage to surpass our goal of $1500, extra monies will aid our next record, fund Tulula! T-shirts, and assist possible relocation to Mexico after November.  

The Impact

We have created a unique, intense and diverse collection of music.  Most of it is original and much of it is collaborative.  Ultimately we write and play music just because.  But, a big part of that because is to move and connect with people, and in turn, be moved and connected.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We can always use help with promotion.  Just telling your friends will be a big help, and if you can't donate wampum, please share on Facebook and Twitter by clicking the icons at the top of the page.  

But, most of all, listen, dance, and emote.  Love and music.  Tulula

story:
Short Summary

 

My name is David Davis and I am a saxophonist and producer out of Connecticut. I have been a full-time independent artist for 30 years. It has been almost ten years since my last release. This hiatus has given me the opportunity to focus on other things in life; for instance, creating a family. My journey in this life thus far has made me see how life is truly fascinating! I really do not take for granted my gift that the creator gave me to share with all that I can. I have 40 days to raise the funds to complete my next ground-breaking recording project. The goal is to have it ready for you within 90 days. I have always wanted to figure out more ways to connect with you- the fans, and find ways to make it a different and unique experience. I believe this is it!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The goal of this project is to create a team that can and will make this project an international success. From mixing and mastering engineers, PR, Radio Promotions, Marketing and sales, to having some of the greatest musicians around as part of the recording. It’s going to take capital (and lots of favors) to make this work. Fortunately I have been working on the project for some time now and I am about 90% done with the recording portion. I have broken the process down in stages.

1.  The first stage is to complete the recording and mix and master the project. – @ $10,000

       a.  Secure cameo musicians to record on the CD- there are a few more songs that I’d like to feature a vocalist or musician(s).

       b.  Mix and Master the recordings for post production- This is a part of the production process that is very important and want to make sure we use an industry engineer that is stellar at their craft, to help breathe life into the already great sounding songs.

2.  The next stage will be to manufacture the project. - @ $3,000

       a.  Using Discmakers to manufacture the CD- Photoshoot, graphic design, CD packaging, etc.

       b.  CD and digital format

3.  The last stage is for Marketing and Sales for the project.- @ $15,000

       a.  Securing a Public Relations firm or person- To take the project to the next level as far as visibility in magazines, television and social media.

       b.  Securing a Radio Promoter for a campaign- To get the music to radio stations to be in regular rotation.

       c.  Social Media Push-

 

The total budget is $28,000 to complete the project and begin the marketing strategy. Money that is raised without reaching the goal will go towards the completion of the recording and manufacturing. Once having the recording in hand and ready for the public, I would continue to raise money for the rest of the stages to be met.

 

Take a look at all the great rewards listed for your contributions. Imagine having a song at the end of the CD that mentions your name or someone else’s you’d like to submit. Or a custom-made song for you to use as a voicemail message (or answering machine for those of you who still use them). You can even work with a few people or a corporation for me come do a live private performance at a venue (charge your friends and family at the door if you’d like). And even more awesome, you can choose to contribute to be able to have yourself or someone else actually sing or play an instrument on the CD. 

The Impact

 

I have successfully completed and distributed 8 past recordings independently. However, I need to take it to the next level and focus on doing more festival shows and live performances with this next project. You contributing to this campaign will help me to assemble the right team of people needed to do what they are more experienced at doing than me. I believe I have something very unique to share with the world. I would be honored to be able to say that I couldn’t have done it without YOU.

Risks & Challenges

 

The challenge of getting the tasks done has most of the time been about not having the money. Now that I have a viable product, right contacts and detailed strategy, all that is left is capital and limited time. It will be a challenge pushing it to be completed in less than 90 days. That isn’t a lot of time but it is still very doable, especially if the capital is not an issue. 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Other ways you can help in addition to contributing is to get the word out to everyone you know. Reach out to all the churches, promoters, organizations and groups that enjoy my music and ask that they spread the word as well. Sharing this information is very easy by using the Indiegogo share tools within this site. Also, if you had any leads to individuals I do not know of that may be interested in contributing, please message me their info as well.

story:
Meet the Team!
Claire Bryant- Backing Vocals
Hudson Bausman- Drums
Scott Bell- Trumpet
Jake Blumberg- Keys
Eva Cassel-Backing Vocals
Kofi Donkor- Lead Vocals/ Rhythm guitar
Brian Lottermann- Bass
​Kevon Scott- Tenor Sax
Dom Tenaglia- Lead guitar
James Mellett- Producer
Jacob McCaslin- Engineer

Our Story

What started as a musical bond that formed while attending Berklee College of Music manifested itself into a deep connection to the ideals of Ubuntu. Amazingly enough, we were drawn to each other through our differences, both musical and cultural. This diversity inspired us to create a sound that is genre-bending, energetic, and socially-conscious. All this we hope to embody in our upcoming release: The Beautiful Ones EP. In order to realize our goal, we need some help with production costs. 

 

Our Goal- $2,900

Studio Time- $1,200
The EP is going to be recorded at Perfection Studios/The Record Company in Boston, MA. Both of these facilities are some of the most renowned recording spaces in Boston with top of the line gear. We'll be doing two 6 hour tracking sessions and six 4 hour overdub sessions. Remember we are a 9 piece band so although studio time can seem steep, we want to ensure our product is of the best quality, for you! 

Engineering/ Mixing- $1580
The studios in Boston require us to bring our own engineer to all the sessions we do. We are fortunate enough to have Jacob McCaslin and James Mellett, engineer and mixer respectively. They both work extremely hard to make our music sound incredible and they deserve to be compensated. Even still, they both accept rates are much lower than the industry standard because they are devoted to getting our music heard. This cost also includes sending our mixes to a professional mastering engineer to offer a fresh perspective on the tracks and to fine tune any problem spots. 

Indiegogo Fees-$135
Indiegogo charges 5% off the top for providing a platform to host this campaign. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Whenever musicians go into the studio, there are often delays that impede on the records progression. The Beautiful Ones EP's release is pegged for late- December but ultimately, the real goal is to get our music to you ASAP without compromising the quality of our product. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are more ways that you can help our campaign aside donation. Sharing this page with friends and family is a fantastic way to bring awareness to the project and spread the philosophy of Ubuntu around the world!

story:
Misty Blues' next original recording project will be a mixture of musing and saucy creations. 

Misty Blues: Band founder and lead singer, Gina Coleman, entered the music scene in the early 90’s as the lead singer of the folk/rock group Cole-Connection. It wasn’t until 1999 when she played a gospel singer in the Williamstown Theatre Festival production of A Raisin In The Sun that she was steered down the path of blues. The lead actor in the production, Rubin Santiago-Hudson, told Coleman that he felt her voice was well suited to sing classic blues. This sentiment was echoed by actor/singer, Mandy Patinkin, who sought her out after seeing the opening performance of the production. After actress Gwyneth Paltrow commented on her performance, Coleman knew a musical shift was imminent. Guitarist Jason Webster and bassist Bill Patriquin from Cole-Connection were on board and thus began Misty Blues. With a deficit of blues music in the Berkshires at the time, they felt the musical change would be well received. Misty Blues pays homage to the older blues made popular by the bold and brassy women of its time, while still paying respect to classic male artists of the 20’s, 30’s and 40’s. The band hasn’t completely abandoned their musical roots; they frequently perform classic rock and folk tunes infused with a healthy dose of the blues. Over the years, Misty Blues has produced three albums, Electric Juke Joint features classic blues renditions, Roadhouse Revival is a danceable twist on traditional gospel music, and Between The Stacks their completely original album with Charles Neville on sax. The core members are Gina Coleman, Jason Webster, Bill Patriquin, Jeff Dudziak, Benny Kohn and Rob Tatten. The band has been fortunate enough to perform with some great musicians in the Berkshires and beyond including Charles Neville, of the legendary Neville Brothers, Aaron Dean, Matt Berger, Dave Vittone and  Dan Teichert.

story:
We are the band Elsiane, a collaboration between singer-composer-producer Elsieanne Caplette and drummer Stephane Sotto formed in Montreal in the year 2000. We were once signed under 2 major labels and launched our first album Hybrid in 2007.

We toured across the U.S and Canada playing such major Festivals as the Montreal International Jazz Festival, the Toronto International Film Festival, Osheaga, M for Montreal and performed with Cirque Du Soleil.

In 2010 we were forced to part ways from our labels since they were influencing us to change our musical style and our sound. In 2012 we released our second album Mechanics of Emotion independently. 

 

Since January 2014 we have been working on this new ambitious production and we are planning the release of our third album entitled Death of the Artist for April 2017, as well as planning a tour in Europe and the US.

What We Need

Now that we are finalizing the album, we are calling out to all of you and to all our fans to include you in the process. With your help, we will be able to move forward and take the next steps to complete this album. The funds that we are trying to raise will cover:

  • The mixing and mastering of the album
  • Production and studio costs 
  • Video production for the single(s)
  • PR promo, online marketing campaign and album artwork. 

What You Get

In return for your involvement and contribution you will be able to get these great perks:

 

Soft Skull Cover (Roy-Prieur 2015-16)

Photo transfer and hand engraving on aluminum

20 inches x 20 inches

 

 

Jagged Edge Cover, Inside Album Art (Roy-Prieur 2015-16)

Photo transfer and hand engraving on aluminum

20 inches x 20 inches

 

Unstable Skull  (Jerome Prieur 2016)

Hand engraved resin and mixed media (paper and steel)

17 inches wide x 15 inches wide x 13 inches tall

 

 

Original pencil sketch for the main cover of Mechanics of Emotions (unframed) (Jerome Prieur 2011). Pencil on paper. 24 inches x 20 inches

  Original letters for Mechanics of emotions (Jerome Prieur 2011)

Handwritten Lyrics

Elsiane's personal microphone and Kaoss Pad

Studio Experience with Elsiane and more....

 

The Impact

We invite you to jump on board with us and be part of this new album!

This new album tells the story of all the passages we went through as artists from the beginning until now. It touches upon the death and rebirth of an artist and how the music industry has been responsible for killing talented artists or in other words, forcing or convincing them to conform to the mainstream. Death of the Artist represents the side effects of what we went through being signed to a major label. 

Death of the Artist  is testament to fact that we are still standing and striving to make the best art we possibly can, on our terms. Our fans always give us the courage to continue this journey and play a big role on this album. They are officially part of this record with the song “The Motive", where we invited a group of fans in the studio to sing with us and to record their voices for the chorus of the song.

We want this album to create an awakening and that it will be a strong source of inspiration for other artists to stay true to themselves and create inspiring art.

Risks & Challenges

Producing this new album has been a big challenge and we have been investing since 2014 and confronting the expenses of the recording and production to ensure an album of high quality. One of the challenges we will face is the timing of the album release and our estimated delivery dates. We want you all to know that we are working with an extremely talented team to ensure that every reward is delivered. Of course, we will keep you posted if anything changes or is delayed along the way!

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can’t do a monetary contribution, we appreciate your help by sharing our campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms in order to make this campaign a success!!

We would like to thank in advance each and everyone of our fans that have been following us and asking us to continue making music. Thanks to you we are still here and thanks to your contribution we will be able to make this album a reality.

story:
Distat Terra is the first international festival of early, classic and contemporary music created in the north of Patagonia, in Argentina. Realized in the cities of Choele Choel and Luis Beltrán.

The project's goals are: 

1) To provide the population of our area the possibility of enjoy and develop the early, classic and contemporary music.
2) To promote the cultural tourism in our area.
3) The performance of repertoire pieces and the creation of new pieces by giving commissions to young composers.
4) The realization of workshops for young performers, conductors and composers. Given by renowned guest professors.

The second edition of Distat Terra will be held between Dec 9th to 20th of 2016, and will hosts musicians from Denmark, USA, Italy, Austria, Poland, Japan and Argentina. The program of this edition will include: twelve concerts, several conferences, plus three workshops for composers and conductors.

This project is vital also for the development of a strong cultural exchange in the region, through work, in ideal conditions, with artists from around the world.

Distat Terra is done with great effort and thanks to the work of many artists. Your collaboration will help us a lot and will have a important impact on our activities. Thanks in advance for your help!

story:
Hallo, wir sind Impact 36, eine Melodic Death Metal Band aus Neunkirchen/Saar in Deutschland. Nach einer selbst produzierten Demo CD 2014 und einer digitalen EP 2015 haben wir beschlossen, das Studio zu entern, um unser erstes komplettes Album "Omnipresence" aufzunehmen. Um dies finanziell auf die Beine stellen zu können, haben wir uns für diese Crowdfunding Kampagne entschieden.

Hello, we are Impact 36, a melodic death metal band from Germany. After releasing a self-produced demo in 2014 and a digital EP in 2015 we entered the studio to record our first full length album "Omnipresence". In order to make this possible financially, we chose to start this crowdfunding campaign.

 

 

01 - Infections
02 - New Mind Geometry
03 - Empire Recreation
04 - Heliosphere
05 - Scaling Reality
06 - The Tides
07 - Undertow
08 - A Paradox Of Conflicts
09 - Paralysis
10 - Shattered Lens (exklusiver CD Bonus Track / CD only bonus track)

Downloads

9€ - 320kbps mp3
12€ - 16bit FLAC (CD Qualität / CD quality)
15€ - 24bit FLAC (Studio Qualität / studio quality)

CD/Bundles

- signiert von der gesamten Band / signed by the band
- exklusiver Bonus Track "Shattered Lens" / exclusive bonus track "Shattered Lens"
- Sticker
- 320kbps mp3 Download

15€ - signierte CD / signed CD
20€ - Demo Bundle inkl. "Impact 36" Demo CD
25€ - T-Shirt Bundle inkl. "Gears" T-Shirt
35€ - USB Bundle inkl. USB Stick

Der USB Stick enthält / USB stick contains

- "Impact 36" Demo (mp3, 16bit FLAC, 24bit FLAC)
- "Shift Revolution" EP (mp3, 16bit FLAC, 24bit FLAC)
- "Omnipresence" (mp3, 16bit FLAC, 24bit FLAC)
- Fotos / photos

 

Fortschritt / Progress

Das Album ist mittlerweile fertig gemastert und das restliche Artwork in Vorbereitung. Ein Promo-Video ist ebenfalls in Planung, welches durch die Kampagne finanziert werden soll.

Der Zielbetrag wird folgende Kosten decken:

300€ - Gebühren (IGG,PP,CC)
2200€ - Studio/Artwork/Perk Produktion
500€ - Promo Video

 

The album master has already been completed and the remaining artwork is being prepared. The campaign will also fund a promo video.

The money raised will be used to cover the following:

300€ - fees (IGG,PP,CC)
2200€ - studio/artwork/perk production
500€ - promo video

story:
We are Brothers of North, we have been an independent rock and roll band for about three years now, out of southern Ontario, Canada. In that three years, we have made good progress. We have received airplay on radio, played some big events & festivals, and been nominated for awards.

We are in the midst of recording our first full length (11 track) studio album and we hope this campaign will enable us to complete recording and production. We have been working extremely hard on this record for over two years now, and the songs are near and dear to our hearts. Your contributions mean the world to us, and all we want is to share these songs with the world, in hopes that they will mean as much to you as they do to us.

We are about halfway through the recording process, and we are contributing as much as possible on our own, but specifically, we need funding to cover the back half of recording time, gear rentals, tech fees, mixing/ mastering, but also the ability to produce a small run of CDs and t-shirts to help keep our future sustainable.

We are offering tons of PERKS! you could get a copy of the album before anyone else, Joe's Guitar that was used on our debut EP, or even get your own beautiful voice ON THE RECORD!

Falling short of our crowdfunding goal would be a major setback for us, however it will not stop us from finishing this project. We are committed to doing everything we can to reach our goal and to fulfill our promises to you. The perks you get for contributing will be honoured regardless of the outcome of this campaign.

We fully understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially... Spreading the word by SHARING this video on social media, e-mailing friends and family, and even word of mouth could be just as helpful!


This campaign video was produced by True Play Productions. Please visit their website to see all the great work they do!

story:
Short Summary

  • Lou Lanza is a native Philadelphian who thrives on the cultural and musical heritage of that city.  Lou has music in his genes - an opera singer grandfather, a classical violinist father, and a pianist/organist & vocalist mother.  His jazz influence came from another of his relatives, Vince Trombetta, a saxophonist & arranger who served as musical director of The Mike Douglas Show.  Lou’s music teachers include Carlo Menotti, Jimmy Bruno, Michael Leonard, and Larry McKenna. His live performances in Philadelphia, New York, London, Los Angeles, & Las Vegas, to mention a few, have earned him the admiration of many industry professionals, colleagues, and fans.  Lou’s recordings include: the road not taken, corner pocket, Shadows and Echoes, opening Doors: A Jazz Tribute to The Doors, and an intimate portrait in blue.  He was named the top male jazz vocalist of 2004 in the reader’s poll of Rio de Janeiro’s Tribuna da Imprensa for the album opening Doors.Lou is considered to be among the top 500 jazz vocalists of all time by noted jazz critic, historian, and author Scott Yanow and is listed as such in his book The Jazz Singers.  Several years ago featured the premiere of the original jazz opera, The Real Book of Gig, for which Lou penned the lyrics and libretto with composer Tony Gairo.  Jazz journalist Alex Henderson wrote in his review that “The November 2011 presentation of ‘The Real Book of Gig’ was a creative success for Lanza.”  Lou is currently working on several projects for release, most notably Scenes From An Italian, ajazz reworking of songs by Billy Joel.  He is also working on some sacred works as well as setting William Shakespeare's sonnets and poetry to music. In addition to his performing, teaching, and writing, Lou is a part of the Inspired Emotions Division at Brandywine Valley Talent.  It specializes in booking jazz, classical, world, and acoustic music.  Lou is a member of the music faculty at DeSales University for musical theatre vocal studies.  Lou is very appreciative to his family, friends, and most especially to his wife, Kelly, who shares his “crazy” life.

  • The Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra, founded in the late 1960's by employees of RCA's Astro-Electronics satellite division in East Windsor, NJ, has continuously entertained audiences with an ever-evolving mix of music up through the present day. Originally created as a place for amateur musicians to play and have fun, the Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra has grown to become one of the Northeast region’s premier musical attractions.

    Today, the Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra delivers audiences a fresh mix of sounds comprised of classic big band jazz, popular standards, modern hits, favorites from the Great American Songbook, and the hottest rock, R&B, and pop hits in a distinctly unique and modern style.

    The 20+ member band is comprised of some of the top instrumentalists and vocalists in the region (PA/NJ), whose members have performed with Wynton Marsalis, Peter Nero, Stevie Wonder, Fleetwood Mac, Burt Bacharach, Lew Soloff, Bill Watrous, Clark Terry, Hubert Laws, Doc Severinson, Arturo Sandoval, Stanley Clarke, Bobby Rydell, Al Martino, Stan Kenton, as well as many others.

    The Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra is definitely "Not Your Grandparents' Big Band."

  • We are teaming up to celebrate the music of one of the most influential entertainers of the 20th century through his music that never seems to find a generation gap.  The concert will take place in the theater at Gwynedd Mercy Academy High School on December 9th, 2015 at 8 PM.  Lou Lanza said that "since the time I was old enough to remember, Frank Sinatra was a reality as I grew up.  His music provided a soundtrack to many important moments in my life.  Before I found jazz and started finding my own voice, he was there to point a way."
  • By contributing, you will ensure that all of the musicians and technicians taking part in this concert will be paid a fair wage for their time, talents, and efforts as well as offsetting the costs of the theater rental.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $3,000 to make this a night that we can not only be proud of musically, but that we can feel that we were compensated for talents and energies in making this once in a lifetime concert a reality.
  • If you contribute either $15 OR $10 (Senior Citizen/Student), you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015. 
  • For $25 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 plus a personalized CD of Lou's. 
  • For $35 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015, a personalized CD of Lou's along with an autographed poster of the concert.
  • For $50 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 and a medium sized duffle bag with the band logo on it.
  • For $75 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 and access to the soundcheck.
  • For $100 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 as well as access to one of our rehearsals.
  • For $250 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 as well a private one hour concert in your home within an hour's driving distance with Lou singing and playing piano for you.
  • For $500 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 as well as a one hour concert within an hour's driving distance with Lou and another musician from the band.
  • If we do not reach the full goal, the money raised will still go towards the concert's real costs and expenses.  It will hopefully guarantee to some degree that we are able to make sing for our supper and go home with something in the till as well. 
  • Theater rental, sound & light technicians will cost about $800.  We will carry 18 musicians plus one vocalist that evening and we will receive the remainder of the $2,200 after indiegogo takes their cut.  That comes to about $110-$115 for not only the concert that evening, but also for the two rehearsals specifically geared towards this concert.  We are not asking for much as this is more a labor of love than anything else.  If we end up making more, it will still be spread evenly among the musicians and technicians after the up front costs are taken care of.

Risks & Challenges

  • The risk for us as musicians is that we raise no funds, draw very few people to the concert (this is not a restaurant, club, traditional concert venue), AND still owe the up front costs and take a real bath.  That is why we are making this a team effort as well as thinking outside the box.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you cannot contribute or come, PLEASE get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary  Lou Lanza is a native Philadelphian who thrives on the cultural and musical heritage of that city.  Lou has music in his genes - an opera singer grandfather, a classical violinist father, and a pianist/organist & vocalist mother.  His jazz influence came from another of his relatives, Vince Trombetta, a saxophonist & arranger who served as musical director of The Mike Douglas Show.  Lou’s music teachers include Carlo Menotti, Jimmy Bruno, Michael Leonard, and Larry McKenna. His live performances in Philadelphia, New York, London, Los Angeles, & Las Vegas, to mention a few, have earned him the admiration of many industry professionals, colleagues, and fans.  Lou’s recordings include: the road not taken, corner pocket, Shadows and Echoes, opening Doors: A Jazz Tribute to The Doors, and an intimate portrait in blue.  He was named the top male jazz vocalist of 2004 in the reader’s poll of Rio de Janeiro’s Tribuna da Imprensa for the album opening Doors.Lou is considered to be among the top 500 jazz vocalists of all time by noted jazz critic, historian, and author Scott Yanow and is listed as such in his book The Jazz Singers.  Several years ago featured the premiere of the original jazz opera, The Real Book of Gig, for which Lou penned the lyrics and libretto with composer Tony Gairo.  Jazz journalist Alex Henderson wrote in his review that “The November 2011 presentation of ‘The Real Book of Gig’ was a creative success for Lanza.”  Lou is currently working on several projects for release, most notably Scenes From An Italian, ajazz reworking of songs by Billy Joel.  He is also working on some sacred works as well as setting William Shakespeare's sonnets and poetry to music. In addition to his performing, teaching, and writing, Lou is a part of the Inspired Emotions Division at Brandywine Valley Talent.  It specializes in booking jazz, classical, world, and acoustic music.  Lou is a member of the music faculty at DeSales University for musical theatre vocal studies.  Lou is very appreciative to his family, friends, and most especially to his wife, Kelly, who shares his “crazy” life.

The
 Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra, founded in the late 1960's by employees of
 RCA's Astro-Electronics satellite division in East Windsor, NJ, has 
continuously entertained audiences with an ever-evolving mix of music up
 through the present day. Originally created as a place for amateur 
musicians to play and have fun, the Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra has 
grown to become one of the Northeast region’s premier musical 
attractions.
Today,
 the Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra delivers audiences a fresh mix of 
sounds comprised of classic big band jazz, popular standards, modern 
hits, favorites from the Great American Songbook, and the hottest rock, 
R&B, and pop hits in a distinctly unique and modern style.
The
 20+ member band is comprised of some of the top instrumentalists and 
vocalists in the region (PA/NJ), whose members have performed with Wynton Marsalis, Peter Nero, Stevie Wonder, Fleetwood Mac, Burt Bacharach, Lew Soloff, Bill Watrous, Clark Terry, Hubert Laws, Doc Severinson, Arturo Sandoval, Stanley Clarke, Bobby Rydell, Al Martino, Stan Kenton, as well as many others.
The Monday Blues Jazz Orchestra is definitely "Not Your Grandparents' Big Band."


 We are teaming up to celebrate the music of one of the most influential entertainers of the 20th century through his music that never seems to find a generation gap.  The concert will take place in the theater at Gwynedd Mercy Academy High School on December 9th, 2015 at 8 PM.  Lou Lanza said that "since the time I was old enough to remember, Frank Sinatra was a reality as I grew up.  His music provided a soundtrack to many important moments in my life.  Before I found jazz and started finding my own voice, he was there to point a way."
By contributing, you will ensure that all of the musicians and technicians taking part in this concert will be paid a fair wage for their time, talents, and efforts as well as offsetting the costs of the theater rental.


  What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  We need $3,000 to make this a night that we can not only be proud of musically, but that we can feel that we were compensated for talents and energies in making this once in a lifetime concert a reality.
 If you contribute either $15 OR $10 (Senior Citizen/Student), you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015.  

For $25 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 plus a personalized CD of Lou's.  

For $35 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015, a personalized CD of Lou's along with an autographed poster of the concert.
For $50 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 and a medium sized duffle bag with the band logo on it.
For $75 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 and access to the soundcheck.
For $100 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 as well as access to one of our rehearsals.
For $250 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 as well a private one hour concert in your home within an hour's driving distance with Lou singing and playing piano for you.
For $500 you will receive a ticket to the concert at 8 PM on December 9th, 2015 as well as a one hour concert within an hour's driving distance with Lou and another musician from the band. If we do not reach the full goal, the money raised will still go towards the concert's real costs and expenses.  It will hopefully guarantee to some degree that we are able to make sing for our supper and go home with something in the till as well.  

Theater rental, sound & light technicians will cost about $800.  We will carry 18 musicians plus one vocalist that evening and we will receive the remainder of the $2,200 after indiegogo takes their cut.  That comes to about $110-$115 for not only the concert that evening, but also for the two rehearsals specifically geared towards this concert.  We are not asking for much as this is more a labor of love than anything else.  If we end up making more, it will still be spread evenly among the musicians and technicians after the up front costs are taken care of.
    Risks & Challenges

The risk for us as musicians is that we raise no funds, draw very few people to the concert (this is not a restaurant, club, traditional concert venue), AND still owe the up front costs and take a real bath.  That is why we are making this a team effort as well as thinking outside the box.
    Other Ways You Can Help  Even if you cannot contribute or come, PLEASE get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My name is Amanda Cogan.

I am an acoustic singer songwriter from San Diego. I have been playing music for the past five years in many of the major music venues in San Diego and have hosted an open mic for the past three years. I love this city and everything it offers, but I am ready to explore some new ones! 

At the end of this month, I am embarking on my first solo tour and I can not wait! My dear and extremely talented friend Kimo Shim will be accompanying me adding his killer percussion to my sound. We will be playing shows from LA to Seattle, sharing the stage with some amazing local acts in each city. I will also be RECORDING a mini EP in Portland! This is an opportunity for me to share my music with new fans in new cities, to learn and grow as a musician and build a network between artists. 

The journey leading up to this adventure has already been inspiring and by contributing you will be helping this dream become reality!  I see this tour as the first major step toward advancing my music career as a solo artist. I can not express enough how much your support means to me and inspires me to continue living my dream. 

Needs: 
I am asking for $2200 to cover the costs of this tour. 

First: Travel Expenses - We will be driving the first part of the way up to San Jose which requires gas ($100). Then we will be flying to Portland ($200) in order to make it to our show on time (and save Kimo's van from dying). From there we will be taking a train to Seattle (to see the sights and save some $; $80). From Seattle we fly back to San Jose ($200) and drive back to San Diego ($100). "Phew!" 

Second: That EP I mentioned. My talented friend Timothy Karplus will be recording 2-3 tracks at 8 Ball Studio in Portland! Which means you can take a little part of me home and be serenaded to every night! It is $250/ track to record ($750). 

Third: Room/board, eating ....etc.

Fourth: Merchandise costs, T-shirts and CDs, perks, IndieGoGo fees. 

PERKS FOR CONTRIBUTING!
You get to choose how much you contribute based on your comfort level. 
No matter what amount of money you can contribute there will be special rewards or "perks" you will receive. Anything from a copy of the new EP to exclusive T-shirts and/or a private show in your home! Ultimately, anything helps and you will receive my undying gratitude. 

Extra money?
Any amount over my funding goal will be put toward extending my EP...MORE SONGS!

Impact:
This tour means the world to me and combines all of my greatest passions; playing music, listening to music and building lasting relationships. I am also hoping to create new fans, push myself out of my comfort zone and exceed expectations. I want to face my fears of rejection and insecurity as a solo artist and grow as a songwriter and guitarist. In each city I want to spread some San Diego love and help build a network of musicians along the coast. Thank you for being a part of this great adventure and dream. 

Risks:
I am asking major venues to trust me to create a killer lineup and bring out a crowd of people in cities I have never been to. This is scary and exhilarating at the same time. I have been a booker in San Diego for the past two years and really enjoy putting together a show. Booking this tour has happened in a very natural and serendipitous way. I was able to build shows around friends I met at open mics, touring artists I played with, and new artists I was referred to. For the shows in Portland and Seattle, my fellow artists are playing for the first time in awhile and/or are reuniting with old bandmates just for our shows... SO EXCITING! I believe the risk will definitely be worth the reward. 

The Shows:
SD: 11/19 - Lestats "Live Album recording" @ 9pm. (Pre-tour show) 
LA: 11/29 - The Fox & Hounds "Songwriter Sundays" w/ Magenta Harley @ 9pm
San Jose: 11/30-12/3 - Kimo's hometown; digging into his roots 
Portland, OR: 
12/4- Mississippi Pizza "Girls Rock" w/ Gabby Holt & Stephanie Scelza @ 6pm
12/8 - Alberta St. Pub "Night of Acoustic Soul" w/ Honey Divers & Stephanie Scelza @ 9pm
Seattle, WA:
12/9 - The Royal Room "Reunion Show" w/ The Duo & Poon @7pm
12/10 - The Rendezvous "Raw & Emotional" w/ Kye Alfred Hillig & Cloud Person @9pm

More ways to help:
Even if money is not something you can give, there are other ways to help. You can share this link on your FB page, instagram, twitter...etc. Maybe even tell a few friends verbally about it! You can also post positive comments on my page and "Like" my music page: https://www.facebook.com/amandacoganmusic. Or if you have contacts in any of these cities who have a place to stay and/or want to see some great live music, please let me know! amanda.cogan@gmail.com.
Supporting me in any way is huge! You rock and I love you all!

You rock and I love you all!

story:
Lay it down

This is it friends.
All or nothing! 

I will record my next album, as long as there are people who want it. My fundraising goal is the minimum I need to record the album and break even. Help me hit that  target and continue onward! To the West, to the East, to the Farrrr East!

I have been practicing fearlessness with my new songs and poems. My new music will comfort your tired soul and get groovy with your inner dancing star. I'm going back to my roots! The song styles include: 90s rnb/pop influenced patriarchy takedowns, sing-along folk anthems, sit-back-and-chill guitar songs - you'll love it.

I've been writing, performing, organizing, promoting - hustling nonstop as a full-time artist since spring 2013. I am completely independent - no manager, no booking agent, no label - It's all me. Putting up this pre-order has been a grand achievement! 

You all know that I care deeply about building community through art. I have given a lot of myself. I need your support in return.


Fund Breakdown

The money will go to studio time and pressing the records. Super.

The Impact

Rhetorical questions to make my point: 

  • How are we going to build an awesome local independent music scene if listeners never buy the art?
  • Who else will be the rad asian womxn soul-folk spoken word artist from K-flippin-W to be the next national sensation?
  • If I give up on my art career, who will run the poetry slam?!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this with your friends who need my music in their life
  • Write a nice comment, or be my friend in real time
  • Buy my previous albums and poetry books here: janicelee.bandcamp.com
  • Follow me on the internet. Each like and follow is a micro-encouragement which actually really helps with my self esteem and artist legitimacy!
Thank you. I believe in me! And you can too!

story:
The Straight Scoop

I am Hope Riot and I have been performing in and around El Paso, Texas, since 2010. Over the last year I recorded my first full-length album at the world-renowned Sonic Ranch Studios, produced by the incomparable David Garza, along with his gang of talent and vision.  It's truly amazing and I want you to hear it! I want everyone to hear it, and I need your help. It's due for release this November, but there are still some things that we need to do to get it where it needs to be for proper release and promotion... and of course, those things take money!

Last year I went on a successful West Coast tour, performing with The Division Men.  Next month I’ll be opening shows for the Moving Units as the tour Texas.  The road to becoming a professional performer is long and hard, and I’ve started my journey, and I’m not giving up.  Come with me.

Before we go any further, take a few minutes to listen to some tracks from my new, unreleased album, Lacuna, here:  http://soundcloud.com/hoperiot


(Hope Riot & David Garza at Sonic Ranch, 2014)

Here's what I've done:

Write, Record, Mix & Master 10 amazing tracks at Sonic Ranch Studios

Here's what I still need to do:

Album Artwork, Physical CDs & Vinyl, Merchandise, Promo Tour Support

A  lot of hard work is done. The album is complete, except for the manufacturing. It needs to be physically manifested and supported. The music industry has changed a lot in the internet age, and although it's easier than ever to put a record out, most artists aren't making a living through record store album sales. Lie shows are how artists make money today. Of course that's not a huge problem or surprise, because forging a relationship with fans is as important as the art itself. But since I have no label support, I have to start small and you can help! I've come up with a fairly inclusive, bare bones budget to help launch this album and with it my career. I need your help.

(view from back of Stuido A, Sonic Ranch)

Hope, where exactly are you taking my money?

Good question! I am more than ever attached to my hard-earned dollars, so I totally get it! If you decide to put your money in my hands, I promise to take very good care of it. Here's exactly what it's going to:

$350 - Publishing & Licensing

$500 - Album Artwork and Graphic Design

$1300 - CD's (1000)

$1500 - Vinyl (500)

$2250 - T-Shirts (500)

$200 - Buttons (400) & Stickers (4000)

$2800 - Tour Van (rental & gas)

STRETCH GOALS

$10,000: new MacBook Pro (mine just died as of 10/23!)

(Hope Riot 'Chariot' t-shirt design)

I know there's even more to consider than this, but I’ll handle the details, if you can help me with the rest of it!

Oh, and you know what else? Some of your dollars are going to come right back to you, but they'll look a little different! That's how crowdfunding works. With your contribution, you'll be sure to at least get some of the merchandise that I'm making or one of the other exclusive 'perks' that I've got listed.

I’ll always remember you as one of the people who helped me get started.  

Please take a look and see what's doable.  You'll be supporting some real, homegrown El Paso music, while helping me get a little bit closer to those big, crazy dreams of mine...

LISTEN to a few tracks off of 'Lacuna'
http://soundcloud.com/hoperiot

story:
Hello. My name is Deanna Rachelle the purpose of the completion of this music video is to raise awareness for a solution to most of the worlds problems today. Problems like war, poverty, politics, our financial system.  I'd like to create a music video to help promote The Venus Project.

The Venus Project proposes a system in which automation and technology would be intelligently integrated into an overall holistic socioeconomic design where the primary function would be to maximize the quality of life rather than profit.

My goal is to raise awareness through entertainment. To help raise funds for the development of a music video that depictings life in a Resource-based Economy, as introduced by The Venus Project. This film would be designed to reach the general public throughout the world to introduce an exciting, sustainable new social direction, depicting a vision of what our future can be if we intelligently apply science and technology with environmental and human concern, a future where was, poverty and hunger could be but a distant memory.

I am doing this because I believe that by putting God/Love/The Planet/Humanity first is the  best way to live. Also, doing what you were created to do, believing in yourself, embracing circles of Influence, using common sense, using our time wisely, self-evaluating, applying what we learn, mastering health & fitness, challenging ourselves and never giving up.

Please help me to get the word out about this solution to our problems for our and future generations.

I currently need:

A white king's chair

A black king's chair

A gold king's chair

royal septers

a shield

Anything you can give will be appreciated
