My goal is to raise awareness through entertainment. To help raise funds for the development of a music video that depictings life in a Resource-based Economy, as introduced by The Venus Project. This film would be designed to reach the general public throughout the world to introduce an exciting, sustainable new social direction, depicting a vision of what our future can be if we intelligently apply science and technology with environmental and human concern, a future where was, poverty and hunger could be but a distant memory. 
I am doing this because I believe that by putting God/Love/The Planet/Humanity first is the  best way to live. Also, doing what you were created to do, believing in yourself, embracing circles of Influence, using common sense, using our time wisely, self-evaluating, applying what we learn, mastering health & fitness, challenging ourselves and never giving up. 
Please help me to get the word out about this solution to our problems for our and future generations.
I currently need:
A white king's chair
A black king's chair
A gold king's chair
royal septers
a shield
Anything you can give will be appreciated

story:
Día 36

¿Cuán lejos irías para alcanzar tus sueños?

¿Alguna vez te sentiste fuera de lugar?

¿Alguna vez sentiste que estabas viviendo una vida que no era la tuya?

¿Cuántas veces te llamaron soñador?

 

Mi madre cuenta que cuando mi hermano era tan solo un bebe y se acercaba a un enchufe, ella  a fin de protegerlo le decía “No”. Entonces, le golpeaba suavemente su mano y mi hermano se retiraba.

 

En mi caso, mi madre cuenta  que cuando yo me acercaba gateando al enchufe, ella también me  decía “No” en un tono fuerte y autoritario y me golpeaba suavemente la mano. Sin embargo, a diferencia de mi hermano, yo volvía una y otra vez hacia el enchufe desoyendo la orden de mi madre y soportando el golpe. Finalmente, mi madre me tomaba en sus brazos y me llevaba a otra habitación para alejarme del enchufe ya que yo no dejaba de intentarlo.

 

Algunas personas han dicho que nací sin instinto de conservación. Esta afirmación suele ser la preferida de las personas que tratan de entender como soy capaz de abandonarlo todo para ir detrás de mi sueño.

 

 

¿Cómo ha sido mi vida en los últimos años?

 

En esencia, he tratado de luchar por mis sueños:

Le envié mi disco al CEO de Warner Music Group - Edgar Bronfman Junior

 

Vendí todo lo que poseía, excepto mi guitarra y mi computador y me mude a Irlanda para intentar conseguir un record deal.

 

Estando en Irlanda le pedí trabajo a U2 para aprender todo sobre el negocio de la música

 

36 Days To Work For U2

36 Days To Work For U2 - 1era. Parte

https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=3&v=XHOCendJ-qk

36 Days To Work For U2 - 2da. Parte
 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Ar0_F_K0YE
 
36 Days To Work For U2 - 3era. Parte
 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pCIAxNjedSE
 

Sin embargo, a pesar de todo, NO LO LOGRÉ.

 

Volví a mi país, Uruguay, con mis sueños rotos y absolutamente quebrado tanto emocional como económicamente.

 

Me tomo 5 años recuperarme, y de hecho, siendo sincero aún sigo trabajando en amabas.

 

Muy probablemente muchas personas pensarían que después de todo lo que pase, ya tendría que haber aprendido mi lección, y ya en este punto, lo más probable es que hubiera aceptado mi realidad, abandonado mis sueños, y simplemente hecho lo que la mayoría hace: buscar un trabajo de 8 horas.

 

Pero resulta que nunca fui como la mayoría.

 

Seis años después de mi primer intento, volví a pedirle trabajo a U2; y  esta vez me dirigí a  Bono:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6i13mkUG2SA

Aún no he tenido respuesta.

 

Los que realmente me conocen a fondo, saben que jamás voy a parar hasta alcanzar mi sueño. Que jamás voy a desistir y que después de todo lo que he vivido, estoy más decido que nunca a grabar mi disco “Day 36”.

 

Es cierto…

Aun no soy conocido.

Aun no estoy en la radio.

Aun no toco en estadios.

 

Por lo cual he decidido comenzar con lo más importante con lo que cuenta un músico:

 

Con mi público.

 

Ustedes son mi primer público.

Ustedes son mis primeras raíces.

Ustedes son las primeras plumas.

 

Los necesito a USTEDES, mi público, para hacer cada vez más fuerte mi voz.

 

Hoy… ahora… en este mismo momento, ustedes pueden contribuir y ser parte de esta historia única en el mundo.

 

Hoy te pido a ti que me ayudes a grabar mi primer disco: Day 36. Te invito y te pido que seas parte de mi primer público.

 

¿Para qué necesito tu contribución?

 

Con tu contribución estarás apoyando la creación, grabación, filmación y publicación de mi Disco Day 36

 

Day 36 - Mi Disco

 

Day 36 es un disco, es una forma de vida y una forma de sentir.

Day 36 es una utopía y una realidad.

Day 36 es esa línea en el horizonte que nunca se alcanza pero que nos mantiene caminando.

Day 36 es mi disco, mi futura mujer, mis futuros hijos, mis amigos y mi música.

Day 36 es la última pieza que necesito para rearmare

 

Músicos:

 

Voz: Federico Revello (Uruguay)

Piano: Kostas (Grecia)

Cello: BlackyBass (Singapur)

Guitarra: Roberto Diana (Italia)

Bajo:  Ten Volt (USA)

Batería: Nico (Francia)

 

Estudio de Grabación: Mastodonte Studios

Estudio de Edición y Mezcla: Stone

 

Lista de Canciones:

 

1 - Two Steps Behind 

2 - Can´t Get Her Out Of My Head

3 - Out Of Control

4 - Camden Street

5 - Into Dust

6 - Happiness

7  - Promise

8 - Stealing Time

9 - Blood Bank

10  - Your Ink

11 - Wait For Me

12 - She Takes The Day Off

13 - Reverse Engeniering

14 - Can You Hear Me Bono

15 - Song For Someone

17 -  Mine

18 - Day 36 

 

Costos:

 

Costos Disco Day 36

 

Costos Creación y Grabación

 

Composición y Grabación Instrumentos: 1200

Grabación Voz: 300

Mezcla y Pos Producción: 1000

 

Licencia y Publicación:

 

Licencias mecánicas: 600

Publishing: 100

 

Arte del Disco:

Diseño Disco: 100

 

Producción:

 

 Cds, DVDS, Remeras, Clases de Canto, Shows: 300

 

 

Riesgos y Desafíos:

 

“No tienes que ser grande para empezar, pero debes empezar para ser GRANDE”.

 

El riesgo más grande sería no ser quien soy…

Vivir una vida que no es la mía…

¡Y eso no va a pasar!

 

Soy músico y emprendedor y estoy determinado a que mi disco DAY 36 este a la venta en Amazon, en Youtube, Suene en Spotify, etc, etc  para Mayo de 2017, y esto será posible si también puedo contar con tu ayuda.

 

Desde ya agradezco que me quieras ayudar y que creas en mi proyecto!

Contribuye ahora!

story:
---->If you live in Nashville (US) or Lyon (France), and will see me, Send me a message and you will have no cost on delivery. 

----> Si Vous vivez à Nashville (us) ou Lyon (FR), et allez me voir en concert ou me croiser, optez pour une livraison en main propre dans les contribution secrète! je peux vous envoyer le lien. Version Française en bas.

English

First, I would like to thank you being on my page, taking time to read and maybe help me with my project.

For people who doesn't know me, here is my resume. I'm jesska, 24 years old Folk/rock/country songwriter from France. I play guitar, harmonica and write my songs most in english and some in french. I moved in Nashville for my music one year ago. (busy year WOW)

 I do gigs since my 18, and went at the conservatory (Lyon), did 2 formations with Greg Zlap (harmonist), the Voice castings, nouvelle stars, and will be at the news on french tv program beginning of april. 

Bob Dylan, Elvis Presley, are my big influences.

This Disc, I dream of, and can't wait to dream it in life.

So why this disc is important? Simply because music is my passion and I don't want to give up. (Only people who keeps going, will never be disappointed and say "i could do".)

This disc is a challenge, and would help me to grow and reach more easier radios, castings, etc. Actually, an artist has to do everything himself : music, recording, marketing, promotion, etc and without good material, it's really hard to succeed.

 

without your help,nothing would happen. you are such important part ; )

More details

 My goal is 6000$ for all the processus :

Recording, mixage, distribution, graphisme, etc.... I spoke with the studio, and they told me around this price for 10/12 songs.

If we are up the goal, I will do a clip, promotion, and more songs on the record.

If we don't reach the goal :

If we reach the half of 6000, I would do a EP.

For people who contributed, I will find the way to do, but in more time.

Your help is more than a word

It's not hard to describe. You are the most important in this goal. All depend on you, and if this works, I would be thankful at a point I can't describe. You have the power to give me a chance with, and I will confess, It's little bit stressful =D It's like, when you share a video, and you wait for the first reactions. 

Other way to help

Nothing easier. If you are not able to help me about financing, you can still help me with sharing! I will be very thankful!

Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, instagram, and other.

Subscribe to my YouTube channel. 

Follow me on social medias

https://www.facebook.com/musicofjesska/?ref=bookmarks

 
 
 

Français :

 

Premièrement, je tiens à te remercier d'être sur ma page, de prendre le temps de me lire, et peut être contribuer à cet important projet.

Pour résumer, si tu ne me connais pas, je suis Jesska, une artiste française Folk/rock/country qui chante et écrit en anglais et un peu en Français. Je joue de la guitare, Harmonica, et chante. J'ai déménagé à Nashville, il y a un an pour ma musique ( Une année chargée WOW).

Je fais des concerts depuis mes 18 ans et ai fait le conservatoire de musique actuelle de Lyon, 2 stages d'harmonica avec Greg zlap , Les castings à Paris de "the voice", de Nouvelle star, et vais bientôt être sur france 2 en avril.

Mes plus grosses influences sont : Bob Dylan et Elvis Presley. (d'où le nom de mon futur album)

Ce CD, j'en rêve, Et je suis super impatiente de l'enregistrer.

Donc pourquoi ce projet est-il important? Simplement car la musique est ma passion et je ne veux pas laisser tomber. Pour avancer dans ce milieu, enregistrer un disque parfaitement fini est majeur et peut avoir une influence énorme pour ce qui est des démarchages radios, et castings.. (actuellement, c'est à l'artiste de faire toutes les démarches et montrer qu'il peut faire quelque chose).

Ce projet est énorme, car l'endroit que j'ai trouver pourrait influencer pas mal de choses. Si les Nashville cats vous dit quelque chose, c'est en lien!

Mais sans ton aide, ce projet pourrait peut être ne jamais avoir lieu ; )

 

Détails

 Mon but dans ce projet est d'atteindre les 6000$, ce qui l'équivalent à 5624€, ce qui inclut :

enregistrement, mixage,reproduction , graphisme, etc....

J'en ai parlé avec les personnes du studios, et ces prix ont été validé pour entre 10 - 12 musiques.

Ce projet est flexible, ce qui veut dire que si nous atteignons plus de 5624€, d'autres choses sont à prévoir, comme un clip, promotion et d'autres titres inédits!

Si le but n'est pas atteint :

Si malheureusement ce but n'est pas atteint, et si on arrive au minimum à la moitié, un Ep sera fait.  

Pour ceux qui auront payé pour une contrepartie, j'honorerai cette contribution en plus de temps.

Ton aide est plus que primordiale!

C'est pas difficile à décrire. Tu es le plus important dans cette campagne. Tout dépends de toi. Si cela réussi, je n'aurai pas de mot assez grand pour te remercier (bien sur que j'aurais des mots, mais ce ne sera pas suffisant X).

Tu as le pouvoir de me faire avancer, et je vais t'avouer, que pour une première campagne internet, je suis un peu stressée ; ) C'est un peu la sensation du partage d'une vidéo sur youtube. 

 Aide moi autrement

Rien de plus facile, si tu n'as pas les finances, tu peux toujours partager et en parler autour de toi :

Partage sur Facebook, Twitter, instagram, discussion, et autres.

Abonne toi à ma chaîne YouTube. 

Suis moi sur les réseaux social 

https://www.facebook.com/musicofjesska/?ref=bookmarks

story:
As Benedictine monks, we follow the ancient Rule of St. Benedict, meaning our lives are dedicated to prayer and work.  The joyful and beautiful celebration of the liturgy is at the heart of our mission, as it has been from our earliest days in Chicago a generation ago.

We sing traditional Gregorian chant in the Mass and Divine Office every day, and once a month we celebrate Solemn Vespers with our choral group, Schola Laudis, to incorporate masterworks of Renaissance polyphony.  Because we want to share the beauty of the Catholic liturgical tradition, we are asking for your help to raise $4,500 to complete our recording project.

The music for Mass for the Solemnity of the Ascension of Our Lord has already been recorded and includes a full setting of the Mass.  The mastering is almost done:  the project is in the final stage, but we need your help to raise $4,500 for the production costs.  This is the one last hurdle to clear before we can release the album!

All funds raised will go toward production costs.  As a monastic community, we live in poverty and take no salaries, supporting ourselves by our work and through the generosity of benefactors such as yourselves.  The funds will be used entirely for outside costs including manufacturing  the CD, producing the CD case, printing the liner notes, and setting up digital distribution.

No amount is too small—we are grateful for any help you can offer!

Although we live under the discipline of the cloister, our monastery is located in the shadow of downtown Chicago and we know that many people in our midst are beset by alienation and spiritual poverty.  Too often the city can be a modern “desert” whose inhabitants search for greater meaning and community.  The beauty of the Catholic liturgy addresses these needs.

We know the transformative power of beautiful traditional liturgy!

The celebration of the Mass and Divine Office is the central activity of our life, from which and around which everything else in our day receives its structure and meaning. We want to share that with you through this recording.

By helping us to complete Mass for the Solemnity of the Ascension of Our Lord, you will also be supporting our goal in founding Schola Laudis, which is to enrich the liturgical life of the Archdiocese of Chicago and to introduce more people to the beauty of the Catholic liturgical tradition.

The main challenge we face is meeting our target release date: the Solemnity of the Ascension Our Lord is fast approaching.  Although the music is timeless, it is our hope to share this album during the appropriate liturgical season this year!

If you are unable to offer a monetary donation, you can still help us! 

Please like and share this campaign with your family and friends on social media—don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools —and share it with others who love the liturgy and believe in its transformative power.  And please help us spread the word by any other means possible:  please direct those without social media to our website: http://chicagomonk.org/schola-laudis/. Word of mouth helps too!

We are grateful for every effort!
story_txt:
As Benedictine monks, we follow the ancient Rule of St. Benedict, meaning our lives are dedicated to prayer and work.  The joyful and beautiful celebration of the liturgy is at the heart of our mission, as it has been from our earliest days in Chicago a generation ago.
We sing traditional Gregorian chant in the Mass and Divine Office every day, and once a month we celebrate Solemn Vespers with our choral group, Schola Laudis, to incorporate masterworks of Renaissance polyphony.  Because we want to share the beauty of the Catholic liturgical tradition, we are asking for your help to raise $4,500 to complete our recording project.
The music for Mass for the Solemnity of the Ascension of Our Lord has already been recorded and includes a full setting of the Mass.  The mastering is almost done:  the project is in the final stage, but we need your help to raise $4,500 for the production costs.  This is the one last hurdle to clear before we can release the album!
All funds raised will go toward production costs.  As a monastic community, we live in poverty and take no salaries, supporting ourselves by our work and through the generosity of benefactors such as yourselves.  The funds will be used entirely for outside costs including manufacturing  the CD, producing the CD case, printing the liner notes, and setting up digital distribution.
No amount is too small—we are grateful for any help you can offer!
Although we live under the discipline of the cloister, our monastery is located in the shadow of downtown Chicago and we know that many people in our midst are beset by alienation and spiritual poverty.  Too often the city can be a modern “desert” whose inhabitants search for greater meaning and community.  The beauty of the Catholic liturgy addresses these needs.
We know the transformative power of beautiful traditional liturgy!
The celebration of the Mass and Divine Office is the central activity of our life, from which and around which everything else in our day receives its structure and meaning. We want to share that with you through this recording.
By helping us to complete Mass for the Solemnity of the Ascension of Our Lord, you will also be supporting our goal in founding Schola Laudis, which is to enrich the liturgical life of the Archdiocese of Chicago and to introduce more people to the beauty of the Catholic liturgical tradition.
The main challenge we face is meeting our target release date: the Solemnity of the Ascension Our Lord is fast approaching.  Although the music is timeless, it is our hope to share this album during the appropriate liturgical season this year!
If you are unable to offer a monetary donation, you can still help us! 
Please like and share this campaign with your family and friends on social media—don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools —and share it with others who love the liturgy and believe in its transformative power.  And please help us spread the word by any other means possible:  please direct those without social media to our website: http://chicagomonk.org/schola-laudis/. Word of mouth helps too!
We are grateful for every effort!

story:
So, I'll Keep This Short...

I'm Loona Dae, singer/songwriter and producer. Originally from St. Louis, MO, I now reside in Chicago, IL. After two years of constant growth in production, songwriting and finding myself creatively, I'm finally ready to put out a body of work I can honestly call my own. 

You may know me from being apart of an all-female group called The Highness Collective, formerly known as SHE. We had a good run for about 5 years. It was great working with a team that pushed me to be smarter, creative and knowledgeable. We released two successful EP's together. That era has ended and we decided to part our ways and found it important to rediscover ourselves individually. 

In the last two years of being with the group, I picked up producing; invested in equipment and software and taught myself how to produce my own music. Quirky, curious, and open-minded to the way my mind and ears flow, I found my creative self. Fearless. It's time to share this growth, my project, my baby, with the masses.

This is my true offering to the world. To not only be heard, but to help. Music heals. The world needs healing and I need your help in doing so. It is important to me to have all my ducks in a row when presenting my solo, debut body of work. This alone will legitimize my brand making it more accessible, professional, appealing and true to who I am. With only myself funding my project, and only so much time to work and split my attention between music and a day job, I have much work to do on the side of branding and post-production for this EP. I deserve the best. My supporters deserve the best, most polished version of my original art, ideas and performance.

This campaign will help fund publishing/digital distribution, website design, graphic design, merchandise (patches, shirts, stickers and pins), and visuals/videos (2).
 
My project is set to release March 17th. I have good faith that my friends, family, and supporters will help make my visions a reality. 
 
Peace & Light

story:
Who is Jess Weimer?

Life is short—why not pursue your dreams? That’s what this Kansas-born, music-making, pizza loving, people-person kind of gal believes! My background ranges from a bluegrass-fiddle band, to musical theater, to orchestra, to singing in the shower and/or studio. 

I took the yellow brick road to this beautiful city of LA to create music that people are inspired by and can relate to. You’re helping me create a positive impact on this world through the art of music, which is my version of magic.


What We Need & What You Get

What is the funding for and where is it going? Let me tell you:

  • Studio recording time
  • Musicians for EP
  • Production of EP 
  • Mixing and Mastering of EP
  • Equipment for filming music video
  • Food on set (i.e. craft services and meals for cast and crew)
  • Cost of locations for filming music video
  • Props for music video
  • Costumes for music video

What do you get, aside from being a part of this amazing musical journey? Really awesome perks, that’s what! Be sure to check out the full list of perks outlined to the right under “Select a Perk”. They include things like dedicated covers of love songs, a big “thank you” on social media, tours of the studio, your very own at-home concert, and many more. 

The Dream

There’s nothing I want more in life than to create music that has a positive impact on the world. Your contribution not only makes the EP and the music video possible, but you’re helping a dream become a reality. In turn, I want to be able to share my happiness and success with as many people as I can.


What I've Already Done


I’m so proud and fortunate that we’ve already created the fantastic music video that you see above. My single, “Telltale Signs”, has also been sticking around in the top 5 on both regional and local indie charts on ReverbNation, and on the top 20 globally. Hype Magazine was awesome enough to give me a shout out, and I’ve been featured in the online magazine, Faith, Glam, and Coffee. 

This is just the beginning. Now, it’s time to really hit the ground running with more music and see where it takes us! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute financially? You can still help!

Just by spreading the word of the campaign and my music, you’re making a contribution. You can use Indiegogo’s sharing tools, like/share/follow on social media, download the single, stream my music on Spotify, or simply loop in your friends and family to what I’m doing. Any and every contribution is so greatly appreciated.

story:
Philippi Music project (PMP) is a social project started in 2014 when Sibusiso Nyamakazi, a 24 year old writer, MC and musician involved in several social upliftment projects in and around his community of Philippi met with students in social innovation from the University of Cape Town.

We were stuck by the energy and the creativity of young artists in the townships, but dismayed by the inexistence of structure to record it and promote it.

From this need, Philippi Music Project was born with a simple an efficient vision: to harvest and develop the creativity of local musicians, to offer them a platform where they can learn, produce and exchange, and eventually connect this platform with the Cape Town Music ecosystem in order to bridge the gap between Cape Town's wealthy centre and its townships.


OUR STORY


Part 1 : the music contest

First we wanted to know more about these artists from the townships. In 2014, we decided to organize a music contest. Our goal was to produce a compilation of these amazing musicians from the townships, and to record it professionally.

But we wanted to do more than just just making an album, we wanted to provide skills using music as a language to get young artists involved in the process of creating, managing and marketing a music product.

Here is an interview of PMP on Cape Town TV in November 2014, when we were promoting the music contest.


We received more than 100 submissions in one month and our contest received a great media cover (TV, radio, shows), confirming the appetite for such a project.

The promotion song of the music contest - Reclaiming the Bass

We gathered a jury of professionals from the music industry in Cape Town such as producers and label managers. In December 2014, these professionals selected ten artists to be part of the compilation, named Reclaiming the Bass.

Here is a short selection of artists featuring on the Reclaiming the Bass compilation


Part 2 : the studio

At the beginning of 2015, we had already come up with this incredible compilation, ready to be recorded in a studio in Cape Town. This fueled our spirits to record this compilation in the townships and build a professional studio in Philippi, for the long-term benefit of many aspiring artists and not just for this compilation. We wanted to create a sustainable social impact instead of a once-off album.

So again, we actively went to meet the artists from the townships participating in all the events, jam sessions and workshops in order to get to know them better, understand the way they work, what they need and what they lack. 

PMP target specificities


In February 2016, we found a location for the recording studio, a 12 meter long container located in a secured business hub called Philippi Village

The PMP studio location

We worked with a music studio designer and engineer to develop the plan of the studio and the budget for soundproofing the container and investment costs for professional and adapted studio gear


The plan of the Philippi Music Project Studio


Part 3 : the social business

But more than just a studio, we want to build a platform that connects Cape Town 's music industry and creates meaningful interactions between musicians, record labels, streaming platforms, venues, media and so much more.

Workshops, conferences, concerts, recording sessions will make this place a classroom to express creativity, connect people and learn from Music:


The PMP services

Through our platform and our services, we will impact the townships sustainably by empowering musicians and bridging the gap between Cape Town and its townships


The PMP yearly impact


Part 4 : You

Today, in April 2016

·  we have seriously talented artists from the townships who want to use decent resources and learn through our platform

·  we have a beautiful and secure location in a business hub situated at the heart of the townships of Cape Town

·  we have developed a sustainable and social impacting venture

·  we have built a network of technical and academic partners to facilitate workshops and link our platform to the music industry

·  all we need to start and make this happen is your support.

If you believe music has the power to bridge a social gap, to create exchange, to empower people and to learn, then our project is yours


OUR NEED IN FUNDING


We need $18,000 to invest in all the professional gear needed for the studio (computer - mixer - mics - softwares - monitors - soundcards - cabling - furnitures...) and soundproof the container with basic materials such as firedoors, acoustic foan, drywall, neoprene...

What is the money for ?

If you are interested about having more detailed information about our business model and the investment budget, please feel free to contact us at philippimusicproject@gmail.com


OUR PARTNERS

We have built a strong ecosystem of players to add value to our platform, offer more services to our artist and empower them

Playing For Change Foundation is running a network of music schools around the world to create positive change through music & arts education. In South Africa, the Foundation has partnered with the Philippi Music Project to have a bigger impact.

The SAB Foundation has selected Philippi Music Project as an awardee for their Social Innovation Award organized in May 2016


The Bertha Centre for Social Innovation & Entrepreneurship has supported the project since its beginning in 2014, as a social innovation capable to impact the lives of many

Britecap will be one of our various technical partners, helping our artists in promoting their music to find gigs and other jobs in the music and entertainment industry, thanks to the mobile app they have developed

JOIN US if you think your organization can add value to the pipeline, contact us at philippimusicproject@gmail.com


THE TEAM


Sibusiso Nyamakazi is a 24 year old writer, MC and Musician involved in several social upliftment projects in and around his community, Philippi. He studied Management at CPUT and is a facilitator of social and youth development workshops. He runs a social conscious poetry movement called "social poetics" using poetry as a tool to facilitate healthy dialogues in society.


Baptiste Guillemet is a French entrepreneur, music producer and festival organizer. He has worked for 2 years as a business consultant in cultural industries in Paris. He has a Master degree of Science in Management from the ESSEC Business School and studied entrepreneurship and social innovation at the UCT Graduate School of Business in Cape Town.

Short Summary

Long story short! We are very very hard workers and sometimes the unexpected happens! We have been bringing you amazing music for 2 years now and we have come to a Grinding Halt! 2 of our MAIN pieces of equipment need repairs ASAP! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $500, it is going straight to Keyboard and PA Repairs $300 for the keyboard and $200 for the PA!
  • We have a ton of merch we can send anyone who donates! (Shirts, CD's, Posters, Photos, Buttons, Stickers, Cards, Drumsticks, Kaoss Pad, Hat, Cymbal, Drums Heads and possibly more!
  • If we do not meet entire goal all funds still go to the repairs!

The Impact

  • Helps us continue to make music that will inspire people.
  • Our overall goal  is to change the world more than anyone could ever imagine!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't contribute if you could share this it would mean the world to us!
  • Thank you all! We appreciate you so much! You are our everything! <3

story:
Hello!

We are (Women's) Chamber Choir Sireen from Estonia and we're currently recording our first album "Terra Incognita". With your help we want to bring it to new audiences!

Who is Sireen?

Sireen (Estonian for Siren) comes from Estonia, a small country in Northern Europe, known for its long choral traditions and world-class choirs. It is also the birthplace of many great composers such as Arvo Pärt, Veljo Tormis, Tõnu Kõrvits and many more who have written some absolutely incredible choir music.

Sireen is a relatively new phenomenon in the Estonian choral scene. We are a group of 20 women, who came together five years ago under the lead of young conductors Tiiu Sinipalu and Ülle Tuisk with the aim to bring some fresh air to the music scene - by singing original music from new and talented Estonian composers and cooperating with local and international musicians from other genres.  

In five years we have brought choral music to new audiences by giving joint performances with punk bands and electronic music groups during Tallinn Music Week, one of Europe's leading music festivals. And we have brought music to all corners of Estonia - concert halls, rocky beaches, warehouses, museums and churches.

This autumn for our fifth birthday we want to bring new Estonian choral music to wider audience, and to you. For this we are working on our debut album "Terra Incognita".

What kind of album is "Terra Incognita"?

Our very first album will be as diverse and limitless as we aim to be in the way we make music. Possibilities of choral music are endless and "Terra Incognita" will take you on a journey to these unknown lands. 

The album will have fresh original pieces from young and promising Estonian composers Sander Pehk and Maria Kõrvits, hauntingly beautiful music from acclaimed Estonian composers Tõnu Kõrvits, Lembit Veevo and choir classics from Eric Whitacre, Igor Stravinski, Knut Nystedt and more. The album will have altogether 19 tracks, including a special bonus track from our cooperation with Estonian electronic music duo Algorütmid. 

The quality of music and professional sound always remain a priority for us, that is why the album will be recorded and edited by true master Tanel Klesment, who has also worked on the albums of artists such as pianist Kristjan Randalu, renowned Estonian Philharmonic Chamber Choir, Estonian National Symphony Orchestra etc.

Why we need your support and what you get in return?

With our own funds we have already started the recording process in a lovely Estonian church that has just great acoustics! But we still need support to cover most of the production costs: the recording and mastering of 19 tracks, fees of instrumentalists (for recording pieces by Maria Kõrvits and Eric Whitacre), producing the album (design, booklet, printing the CDs etc). 

To cover these costs we aim to raise 3500$; and we know that together we can make it happen!

Since until now our main audience has been from Estonia, we are simultaneously raising money in a local crowdfunding platform Hooandja. These funds are meant to cover the expenses of album release concerts and partly also the album -  supporters will receive our album in return. 

Therefore, even if we don't manage to raise the expected sum here, one way or another, we would find a way to finish the project and send all our Indiegogo supporters the promised perks! 

In return for your contribution we take you on a journey to quality Estonian choral music - either through a digital tracks or a CD. There are also some special perks, about which you can read on the right side. 

The impact

Your contribution will help us bring quality Estonian choral music to new audiences. And we hope that this could be the beginning of something great - maybe we will soon have the possibility of holding our release concerts also abroad and sing to you live. 

We highly appreciate any support. It would mean the world to us if you could spread the word about us and this project.  

In case of any questions get in touch with us at kammernaiskoor@gmail.com or on our FB page Kammernaiskoor Sireen.

With love,
Sirens

The album will have fresh original pieces from young and promising Estonian composers Sander Pehk and Maria Kõrvits, hauntingly beautiful music from acclaimed Estonian composers Tõnu Kõrvits, Lembit Veevo and choir classics from Eric Whitacre, Igor Stravinski, Knut Nystedt and more. The album will have altogether 19 tracks, including a special bonus track from our cooperation with Estonian electronic music duo Algorütmid. 
The quality of music and professional sound always remain a priority for us, that is why the album will be recorded and edited by true master Tanel Klesment, who has also worked on the albums of artists such as pianist Kristjan Randalu, renowned Estonian Philharmonic Chamber Choir, Estonian National Symphony Orchestra etc.Why we need your support and what you get in return?With our own funds we have already started the recording process in a lovely Estonian church that has just great acoustics! But we still need support to cover most of the production costs: the recording and mastering of 19 tracks, fees of instrumentalists (for recording pieces by Maria Kõrvits and Eric Whitacre), producing the album (design, booklet, printing the CDs etc). 
To cover these costs we aim to raise 3500$; and we know that together we can make it happen!Since until now our main audience has been from Estonia, we are simultaneously raising money in a local crowdfunding platform Hooandja. These funds are meant to cover the expenses of album release concerts and partly also the album -  supporters will receive our album in return. 

Therefore, even if we don't manage to raise the expected sum here, one way or another, we would find a way to finish the project and send all our Indiegogo supporters the promised perks! 

In return for your contribution we take you on a journey to quality Estonian choral music - either through a digital tracks or a CD. There are also some special perks, about which you can read on the right side. 
The impact
Your contribution will help us bring quality Estonian choral music to new audiences. And we hope that this could be the beginning of something great - maybe we will soon have the possibility of holding our release concerts also abroad and sing to you live. 
We highly appreciate any support. It would mean the world to us if you could spread the word about us and this project.  In case of any questions get in touch with us at kammernaiskoor@gmail.com or on our FB page Kammernaiskoor Sireen.With love,Sirens

story:
If needed Ukrainian translation is below. ????-????? ???????? ???????? ??????????? ?????.

Hey Guys,

I'm Mark and I'm glad that you have decided to stop by at my page.

I'm so excited to share with you this project of creating a successful YouTube music channel.

For those of you who don't know me I already have a channel.  https://www.youtube.com/user/Marikone88/featured

A brief summary about me: I'm from Ukraine and I have been playing guitar for 14 years. Music has always been a big part of my life, however, at a certain time it was very difficult to make a living playing music so I had to keep it as a hobby while doing other jobs. The other jobs that I was doing were great, but my passion for music was even greater so after 7 years of working as a recruiter I decided to quit and follow my passion that started when I was 14 years old. 

I saved up some money to sustain myself financially and I am dedicating all of my time and efforts to develop a successful YouTube channel. This includes hours of daily practice and composing plus recording of video material and building an online guitar course.

My goal is to create a successful YouTube channel where anyone who wants to learn how to play guitar at their best would be able to receive invaluable information for FREE.  

The guitar course which I'm planning to release is different from others since I not only talk about efficient guitar practice, but also how to take care of your body while playing guitar which is extremely important if you want to play long term! Also I talk about how to break negative emotional and psychological patterns that were instilled in many of us and which often lead us to believe that we're not good enough or just don't have the music in us and as a result we tend to give up. I personally gave up on guitar several times, but I still found the will, desire and motivation to keep on playing and achieving results. So can YOU if music is your passion!

In addition, I already have a cover section of other artists on my channel as well as I'm planning to create my own original album that will be available for everyone.

My ultimate goal is to create a successful YouTube channel that will help others and support me financially. Obviously, to create a successful YouTube Channel takes time, dedication and money. There are costs involved in production of videos, marketing, recording, software, hardware, instruments and gear.

That is why I'm asking for your support that will help me stay focused on my dream 100% of the time while producing high-quality musical content for you guys.

I've already tried music as a hobby while working at other jobs. Whereas, I did achieve some level of success in music it is far beyond from the success I envision which would help thousands if not millions of people to learn how to play the instrument efficiently and far more importantly not to give up on their dream!

If what I just told you resonates with you then click on the link you see on your screen and support my project with the amount that you feel is reasonable.

In addition, I would like to ask you to please share this video within your network (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.) to make this project visible.

I'm really passionate about this project and I hope you feel the same

Thank you for your support. See you guys later :)

story:
Short Summary

Hi. I'm Morgan Harrington. I am an opera singer and graduate of Indiana University Jacobs School of Music.  Singing and performance have been passions of mine for as long as I can remember and I have been actively studying my craft at various Young Artist Programs around the world and honing these skills through local performances throughout the San Francisco Bay Area. I'm currently at the beginning of my professional career and I am writing to ask for your help.


What I Need and the Impact of Your Support

Through highly competitive national auditions, I was invited to attend OperaWorks’ 2016 Advanced Artist Summer Program in Los Angeles. This nationally acclaimed program’s holistic, one-of-a-kind performance and business training gives 21st century performers the skills to thrive in the music industry, make meaningful contributions to our communities, and to imbue performances with visceral power and vibrancy. 

OperaWorks is the crucial next stage in my career path development. In order to participate in this outstanding opportunity, I am writing to ask for your help. The program costs (including tuition, housing and travel) are approximately $4,900. I would be so grateful for any contribution you could make towards my expenses – lose change in jars or renegade coins from under the sofa will be just as valuable as $5, $10, $25, $50, even $100, or the amount of your choice. 


*Ways to Support

Come to beautiful, historic Sonoma and enjoy Arias for OperaWorks: A BeneFête Concert on Sunday, May 22, 2016 with Morgan Harrington, soprano and the delightful pianist, Yvonne Wormer, at the Sonoma United Methodist Church, 109 Patten St, Sonoma, CA 95476. The performance begins at 2pm (doors open at 1:30pm) and the suggested donation is $25. It would be a treat to see you in person and to share some wonderful music with you!

If you cannot attend the concert, but would still like to support my endeavors, you can make a contribution through this Indiegogo campaign. To say thank you, I have some wonderful perks, which you can peruse in the column to your right. 

Or, you can make a tax-deductible donation directly to OperaWorks (all other options are NOT tax-deductible) in several ways:

  • Online at http://www.operaworks.org/support-us/donate - be sure to write in the "special instructions to seller" box that you are dedicating your gift in the name of Morgan Harrington. 
  • Or, donate by phone at 818.898.9597 and let them know you'd like to support Morgan Harrington's participation in the 2016 Advanced Artist Program by making a gift to OperaWorks. 
They will send me a list of donors so I may personally thank you for your generosity! 

*Please note: all contributions are non-refundable and all donations to OperaWorks must be received by June 26, 2016. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't come to the benefit concert or make a contribution, please help me reach my goal by spreading the word and letting me know you're listening.


Thank you so much for your support, encouragement and generosity. It means so much to me. I am happy to have you as part of my performance journey.

Warmest wishes,

Morgan

story:
Creating the Universe

 

 

As you may know, I started a new darkjazz project 'The Thing With Five Eyes' after the split of The Kilimanjaro Darkjazz Ensemble in 2012/13. The creative journey for me was still unfinished and i found the need to continue this magical and mystical path. 

What we are funding is the first in a series of videoclips / short films which will be expanding this universe musically and visually. A goal which we have had since starting this project and a creative urge to create something passionate and timeless, something we can pour my heart into, and hopefully be inspiring to others.

Video productions are expensive, unfortunately, and even for just getting the basics covered we have had to create this platform to help fund this concept. 

So, hopefully we can get you excited to support us in starting the creation of this new universe!

The clip will be filmed by award winning Dutch filmer Andres Fouché. Well known for his amazing clips for De Staat (Torre Florim) and Dope DOD.

'Glory' The Thing With Five Eyes. Debut release.

 

The Priestess

 

In an unknown time and civilisation a nomad woman experiences the magical and mystical ritual of creation.
This is the synopsis to our story. It will be the first part in the series of this tale. In an unknown era on our planet, we show the female, the priestess, the life-giver performing lost rituals of mysticism and magic. Oneness with the earth, the fertility, the soul and what connects us and gives life. The occult, light / dark, eroticism and the mystic.
The rest of the story remains a mystery of course... and will unfold in time to come!

 

Atoms & Protons

 

The bits and pieces needed to finance this project. Breaking it down as to be completely transparent so you can see exactly what is needed and where the money for the production is going to :

 

Cameraman, Editing, Post-Production

Actors

 

Production / Light / Make Up Crew 

 

Clothing, Accessories, Make-up

 

Film Rental Material (Lighting, dry ice machine, generator, etc)  

 

Travel costs (Bus rental, petrol, insurance, toll)

Sleeping Arrangements 

Food / Drink 

Total Costs  €5000

We will be investing €2500 out of our own reserves and looking to reach raising funds for €2500 of the remaining costs. We have chosen to use the Flexible Funding option which will make the project go through even if the goal isn't reached, we will improve on the budget or raise the remaining via other means. But, one thing is sure, this project is GO!

We plan to shoot mid August 2016 and have the film/clip finished in the fall of 2016. The clip will be part of forthcoming debut album release. Completing the audio and visual concept of the album.

If we manage to raise more than needed, the extra will either go towards extra costs for the shoot, like extra accessories, lighting, etc or it will be placed as a reserve for the second shoot of the project. And if we raise even more, it will go towards the extras for the debut album : mastering, artwork, photoshoot, etc.

We've tried to be as creative as possible with the perks, but also straight forward by not going to much overboard, especially concerning perks with shipping costs, because i would prefer you don't lose a chunk of money towards shipping costs which would be better if they would go directly to help this project.
There's some great perks in there, and anything you decide to fund will be amazing!
 
The Impact

 

What we are planning to do with this project is to create a new dimension of creative magic by going the extra mile to make this audiovisual project stand out from the vast majority of stuff out there. 

Mysticism and the occult have always been a big inspiration to this and my previous projects, after extensive research into all kinds of subjects ranging from pre-history, ancient cultures, sacred geometry, ancient symbolism, goddess worship, polytheism, the occult, shamanism, etc, etc... We have done months of research to create a concept which is timeless, but also is backed up with occurrences and facts which have become lost to many as they have been put away into the shadows. 

People who love my previous work and magical worlds like The Kilimanjaro Darkjazz Ensemble 'Here Be Dragons' or The Mount Fuji Doomjazz Corporations 'Succubus' this will be an even deeper dive into unknown mystical territories. And i hope you have the faith to support and fund this project to push it to a new level creatively.

    Risks & Challenges

    There are no risks or challenges. We as a team have decided that this project must be done. However long, the dedication and passion is limitless and relentless.

    IT SHALL BE DONE.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't manage to fund financially that's fine, you can also help by sharing this project to friends through social media to get the word around. That would be of help too!  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank you for taking the time to read this through and hopefully being part of the project!

    Feel free to download this 1 hour piece of The Thing With Five Eyes music, as an introduction to the world we are creating!

    'Kosmos' The Thing With Five Eyes

What we are planning to do with this project is to create a new dimension of creative magic by going the extra mile to make this audiovisual project stand out from the vast majority of stuff out there. 
Mysticism and the occult have always been a big inspiration to this and my previous projects, after extensive research into all kinds of subjects ranging from pre-history, ancient cultures, sacred geometry, ancient symbolism, goddess worship, polytheism, the occult, shamanism, etc, etc... We have done months of research to create a concept which is timeless, but also is backed up with occurrences and facts which have become lost to many as they have been put away into the shadows. 
People who love my previous work and magical worlds like The Kilimanjaro Darkjazz Ensemble 'Here Be Dragons' or The Mount Fuji Doomjazz Corporations 'Succubus' this will be an even deeper dive into unknown mystical territories. And i hope you have the faith to support and fund this project to push it to a new level creatively.


Risks & Challenges
There are no risks or challenges. We as a team have decided that this project must be done. However long, the dedication and passion is limitless and relentless.
IT SHALL BE DONE.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't manage to fund financially that's fine, you can also help by sharing this project to friends through social media to get the word around. That would be of help too!  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thank you for taking the time to read this through and hopefully being part of the project!
Feel free to download this 1 hour piece of The Thing With Five Eyes music, as an introduction to the world we are creating!
'Kosmos' The Thing With Five Eyes

story:
Tiny Bird has been playing music together for close to 7 years (and longer!) We started jamming and busking together in the streets of downtown Flagstaff and have been developing our sound ever since. This is our first real studio release with an engineer and producer that ISN'T one of the band members.

We want to fairly pay our friends for helping us produce this album and make us what we are. The demands and commitments of life have left us with a lack of funds to do this properly. The "off-season" for performing and getting payed to play is approaching now with winter, so we have decided to give crowdfunding a go.

By helping us, you are also helping the DIY scene of Flagstaff and Flagstaff music scene as a whole. Our collaborators within and related to The Hive have worked long and hard to develop new creative projects that challenge the artists and promoters of our town. 

 

We will use the $3,500 we raise to pay our producer and engineer David Strackany for tracking and mixing our album. We will be paying another person out of Portland for mastering. Any leftover money will go to paying our friends and collaborators who help us on music videos and any costs related to hitting the road in 2017.

Share with your friends! Welcome our work into your experience. We are excited to play for you and share with you what we have developed.

story:
Festival Summary

The Spontaneous Combustion New Music Festival was born from my passion for contemporary classical music, and the incredibly talented and dedicated musicians who perform it. My goals for the festival:

1) to help bring innovative artists and programming to the west coast to help further their career and share their gift with new audiences

2) to reach new audiences and cultivate an awareness and appreciation for this art form

3) to contribute towards the community of like-minded individuals who are passionate about contemporary classical music.

Spontaneous Combustion is a unique model for a new music festival. Most festivals are located in one city. The 7 featured artists will perform in 10 cities: Seattle, Portland, Eugene, Sacramento, San Jose, San Francisco, Ojai, Palm Springs, San Diego and Los Angeles. (Cities subject to change)

In other words, each artist has a 10 city tour, while each city hosts 7 concerts!

Along the way, the artists will have many opportunities to give master classes at nearby universities and community music programs.

The festival is schedule for Jan / Feb 2018.

These are the currently confirmed performers for the festival:

Ashley Bathgate, Cello

American cellist Ashley Bathgate has been described as an “eloquent new music interpreter”(New York Times) and “a glorious cellist”(The Washington Post) who combines “bittersweet lyricism along with ferocious chops”(New York Magazine). Her “impish ferocity”, “rich tone” and “imaginative phrasing” (New York Times) have made her one of the most sought after performers of her time.
----------------------

Hotel Elefant, Chamber Ensemble

“One of New Yorkʼs fastest rising new-music outfits.” --Time Out New York
----------------------

Quince, Vocal Quartet

"...a group sure to play a big role in reconceiving vocal composition in 21st century music."-- Jeremiah Cawley, The Box is Empty
----------------------

Orlando Cela, Flute

----------------------

The City of Tomorrow, Wind Quintet

"..extraordinary sense of ensemble, not just in terms of rhythmic precision but in tone color, balance, gesture, and sensitivity.” --New Music Box
----------------------

Sandbox Percussion Quartet

"Revitalizing the world of contemporary music" --The Washington Post
----------------------
 

ABOUT ME

My name is Scott Anthony Shell, and I am the founder of the Spontaneous Combustion New Music Festival. As an aspiring composer, I have a strong passion for the art music of the past 100 years. I see and hear so many amazing performers sharing their gifts of interpreting this most amazing music, and am often saddened by how little recognition they get in our current society. I am passionate about finding new ways of cultivating an appreciation for the art form, since most people don't have the time to invest in delving into it.

If you are interested in learning more about me, I refer you to my composer web site www.ScottAnthonyShell.com

The basics: Originally from Chicago; life long musician; attended Interlochen one summer studying classical guitar, jazz improv, music theory and piano tuning; B.M. composition degree from DePaul; didn't go to grad school; owned and operated an indie rock record label in Chicago; released 5 albums with my garage rock band Cats and Jammers as singer/songwriter/guitarist; taught myself to become fluent in Spanish; spent a year in Peru / Ecuador including 3 months in the Amazon; currently live in Sedona Arizona; interested in moving to a larger city soon, and possibly going to grad school to continue studying composition in more depth; practicing piano about 3 hours a day with the hopes of becoming good enough to perform down the road.

How Your Funding Will Help

If I could fund this festival myself out-of-pocket, believe me, I would. Since I am not independently wealthy, I am trying to raise start-up funds in a variety of ways, one of them being this Indie Go-Go campaign.

Eventually, I am hoping to be able to raise enough funds through advertising, ticket sales, and grants to cover expenses. But most of those funds won't be available until closer to the festival dates. Before I can move forward with the festival, I need to pay for certain things, mainly:

Liability insurance for venues that don't have it,

Rental deposits for some of the venues,

Performance fee deposits (some of the performers require this not only as an act of good faith on my part, but to secure them for the festival)

Start up expenses and other related business expenses. This includes design work, bank account fees, web hosting - smaller fees that add up.

I have already paid out-of-pocket for the business start up expenses.

SUPPORTING THIS CAUSE

I realize that many of you do not live on the west coast, and will not be able to attend these concerts. But maybe you will support the cause because you are passionate like I am about new music and you want to help it succeed. Whatever your reason, thanks for your support!

Most of these types of campaigns have tangible perks that can be offered. Since this campaign is raising seed capital, there is little I can offer or guarantee as a perk other than thank yous in the programs and tickets to the festival. These tickets can be transferred so in case you can't attend personally, you can designate them to a friend who may be interested.

If you purchase a single ticket, 3-day festival pass, or 7-day festival pass as a perk, you can select the dates and locations closer to the actual concert dates (again late January / early February 2018).

If you own a business, or know somebody who does, you can receive reduced-rate advertising as a perk. Regional ads are for just one city (whichever you choose) while national ads will be displayed in all 10 city programs (for a total of 70 concerts!)

Choose from 1/4 page, 1/2 page and full page ads, which are full color. Your logo will also be displayed on our website as a corporate donor.

YOUR SUPPORT WILL...

--Help these amazing musicians to share their craft and reach new audiences

--Bring these talented musicians to the west coast (in the winter!) to 10 different communities

--Help foster an appreciation for the art music of our time

--Help bring recognition to many amazing up-and-coming composers as well as masters of our time

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you are unable to make a donation at this time. Don't worry - but please share this campaign with anyone you think would be interested.

Also,

The festival will need corporate sponsors, both large and small. If you know of anybody who would benefit, please share this campaign. Tax-deductible donations are also a possibility. Spontaneous Combustion is being sponsored by Fractured Atlas. Visit scnmf.org for more details.

The festival will need volunteers in each city. Also looking for folks in those cities who would like to earn a commission by selling advertising to local businesses.

story:
Hello, I'm Bri

I'm an ordinary girl with an extraordinary dream. My dream is to make music that will change the world. The donations from this campaign will go towards the release of my first album titled Beautiful Catastrophe. The songs are already written, now all I need is your help to get them out there! Join me on this exciting journey and let's change the world together. 

What I Need & What You Get

The campaign goal is to raise $1,500 in 60 days. All donations will go directly towards:

  • Recording fees
  • Album design
  • Distribution
  • Promotion/Marketing

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the extra cash to donate? No worries! Spreading the word about this campaign is just as valuable. 

Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this page on different social media platforms.

story:
The music of Herbie Hancock’s exploratory Mwandishi band has captivated our imagination for several years. After exploring new arrangements of its repertoire, Bob wrote You'll Know When You Get There: Herbie Hancock and the Mwandishi Band, published by University of Chicago Press in 2012.

Successful trio and quartet performances fronted by Bob and Chris have led us to an opportunity to record a fresh take on this exciting music with original band members, drummer Jabali Billy Hart and trumpeter Eddie Henderson. The fire created during our initial trio foray with Billy stoked our enthusiasm even further.

We have raised a portion of the funds needed to navigate our course through the production of a quality recording. What remains is $4,500, the final third of the $12,000 budget. Our success at grant and crowd funding portions of recent recordings, including the highly regarded Something Quiet (with Joe Giardullo, on FMR Records) and Bob's Tropelets (Ictus Records) gives us confidence that this is possible. Those projects were special, but this one is a unique opportunity. It can provide a means for two Mwandishi band members to revisit aspects of their musical legacy, and for Bob and Chris to record with two of the most remarkable and distinctive musicians.

You can help by making a financial contribution, and also by helping us get the word out about our campaign - don't forget to use the Indiegogo "share" tools! Your partnership as a supporter can help us craft what promises to be a wonderful recording.

story:
GOAL

Andy Lopez's death was a horrible shock.  An unimaginable pain to even consider the loss of a child.  Like many of you I was filled with anger and saddness.  I was compelled to do something about it.  But I didn't know Andy and I struggled to find a way to help.  Eventually, I stumbled upon a picture online of Andy playing a trumpet.  I immeadately knew this was the connection.  This was a small way to try make something positive that would enrich the community and help us never forget what happened. This event has two goals: 

  1. Remind us all to keep what happened in our thoughts and continue to work towards peaceful solutions.  
  2. Honor Andy by giving to something that he loved.  

DONATE

*All Donations, including signed albums, were made directly to this benefit.  Please support these people, companies and artists whenever possible!

All proceeds will go directly to the music program at Lawrence Cook School where Andy attended. The donation will be made in Andy's name.  You can help us reach our goal several ways:

  • Purchase a ticket and attend the event
  • Purchase one of our donation items
  • Make a donation directly to the cause
  • Any combination of the above

All donations are through our sponsor KWTF Radio 501(c) #45-5041405 charitable organization.  Your support is tax-deductible 

MUSIC  

April 4th at ARLENE FRANCIS CENTER - SANTA ROSA, CA

  • Alex Mass - of The Black Angels
  • BC Fitzpatrick - Solo performance
  • Darwin - with band
  • Silent Pictures - Neugaze from Stanford
  • Survival Guide - Indie Electronic
  • Ashley Allred - Ethereal Acoustic
* Tickets are also available at The Last Record Store in Santa Rosa, Ca.  (cash only)

INSPIRATION"However, over time, even the deepest outrage tends to subside and many tire of going to rallies and taking part in protest marches. No one wishes for this, but human nature and time being what they are, this just happens.

I say, before this occurs, before coalitions and committees start to disband, I am hoping that they evolve into constructive organizing. People would have to be willing to do the consistent hard work involved in order to organize events, such as concerts, scholarships and other events which would create lasting monuments and programs in the memory of Andy Lopez."      -Elbert ‘Big Man’ Howard

THE PERFORMERS

Alex Maas (of The Black Angels)

BC Fitzpatrick

Darwin (featuring Henry Nagle, Anthony Vaccaro and Jamie Voss)

Silent Pictures (from Stanford)

Survival Guide

Ashley Allred


King 601 Trumpet (retail value of $1159) donated by Stanroy Music Center.  This beautiful instrument will go directly to the school's music program.

Selmer CL200 clarinet (retail value of $399) donated by Loud and Clear Music.  This will, logically, go directly to the school's music program.


6 weekend passes to Levitation festival in Austin, TX.  Valued at $165 each

5 tracks professionally mastered by Tommy Dietrick at Skylab Studios.  $250 value

Fig. 4 (pre-GBV) LP signed by Tobin Sprout.  Only 300 pressed!  $175

Dominic East Music - All signed.  $45

GBV 'Motivational Jumpsuit' LP signed by Tobin Sprout $40

Operation Ivy 'Energy' LP signed by Jesse Michaels.  $40

Built to Spill 'Strange' promo 7" signed by Doug Martsch.  $40

Signed Violent Femmes vintage t-shirt!  Solo CDs by Victor DeLorenzo

David Bazan w/ Passenger String Quartet LP signed by David Bazan.  $35

Built to Spill 'Conventional Wisdom' 7" signed by Doug Martsch.  $20

'Antietam' 7" signed by Tobin Sprout.  $20

Lagunitas will be serving their fantastic beer at the event.  All proceeds from the sales will go towards the benefit!  Dog Gone!

2 Hour Massage and Hot Stone Treatment with Anthony Vaccaro.  $145 value. 

Santa Rosa Community Acupuncture has donated 4 sessions.  $75 value.

Proud to be pouring next to Lagunitas, State Park Brewery is donating 10 gallons of award winning IPA home brew to the benefit with 100% of the proceeds going to the cause!  www.stateparkbrewery.com

Last Record Store T-Shirt.  You pick size and color!  $20

Donated by Stacey Sher and Kerry Brown.  This is an official promo poster for the 'Garden State' film on which Stacey served as Executive Producer.  $45


Sherzer & Associates is a proud sponsor of this event.

Social Imprints has donated printing for this event.

Bistro 29 is a delicious sponsor of this event.

story:
My Story

My name is Shanti Chapman.  I am a Christian/Gospel Music Artist.   I have a strong passion to see the many songs that God has blessed me to write over the years come to life.       

                                                                     Listen here:

                                            Now is the Season - by Shanti Chapman

I had the privilege to connect with Randy Bowen, Editor of Live It Loud Magazine, a few months ago when discussing an advertising opportunity with the magazine.                                                                                                                                                                      

A couple months later, we discussed the opportunity of coming to Nashville to work with him and Grammy Award Winning Producer Tre' Corley on my 2015 project. This was a very timely conversation because I was praying and believing that God   would open the door to connect with the right industry professionals to record my project. 

           

                                                             The Goal 
My goal is to raise the funds necessary to record a full-length album with Randy Bowen and Tre' Corley at Oak Tree Studios with the best of the best musicians, singers, and engineers. 
We agreed upon a budget of $17000 to cover the cost of:

  • Full-Length Album (8-10 songs)
  • Top Notch Producers and Engineers
  • World Class Studio
  • Best of the Best Musicians and Singers
  • Promotional Photo Shoot
  • Administrative Expenses
                            
   The Benefits of the Artist Incurring these Expenses:
  • The Artist Owns the Master Recording
  • Expenses Won't be Recouped Later (Like Many Record Labels Do)
  • The Fans/Supporters can participate in the Artist's Growth and Success

       

The Impact

I truly believe that my purpose is much deeper than music.  It is to inspire people to identify their Godly purpose and motivate them to follow through by faith and action to see that every promise that God has given is manifested in the present reality. It is my hope that my blend of Jazz Harmonies, R&B, and Contemporary Gospel, are refreshing to the ear and soothing to the soul.  My mission statement is “to break down barriers in people’s minds bringing them closer to the presence of God in order to bring restoration, new direction, and motivation”.

Risks and Challenges

The are always risks and challenges that come with a faith project.  However:

  • When God gives a gift it is meant for sharing.
  •  When God gives a vision there is provision.  

I believe many times we do not realize our full-potential because we look at perceived limitations.  However, we must look to our King and know that the potential he has placed within us is only limited by our perceptions.  

                                       

                         Other Ways You Can Help

 Become a sponsor for the World Vision Treasure Program                                     

  • $38/month provide audio bibles to countries that don't read or write.
  • Sponsoring the Treasure Program indirectly supports my project.      
                                           

                                              Treasure Program Sponsorship Form

                   Email the completed form to:  shantichapman@gmail.com

  • Keep me and this project in your prayers.
  • Spread the word.  You can share on Facebook, Twitter, and Google & right from this page.
story_txt:
My Story


My name is Shanti Chapman.  I am a Christian/Gospel Music Artist.   I have a strong passion to see the many songs that God has blessed me to write over the years come to life.       
                                                                     Listen here:
                                            Now is the Season - by Shanti Chapman

I had the privilege to connect with Randy Bowen, Editor of Live It Loud Magazine, a few months ago when discussing an advertising opportunity with the magazine.                                                                                                                                                                      


A couple months later, we discussed the opportunity of coming to Nashville to work with him and Grammy Award Winning Producer Tre' Corley on my 2015 project. This was a very timely conversation because I was praying and believing that God   would open the door to connect with the right industry professionals to record my project. 
           


                                                             The Goal 
My goal is to raise the funds necessary to record a full-length album with Randy Bowen and Tre' Corley at Oak Tree Studios with the best of the best musicians, singers, and engineers. 

We agreed upon a budget of $17000 to cover the cost of:

Full-Length Album (8-10 songs)
Top Notch Producers and Engineers
World Class Studio
Best of the Best Musicians and Singers
Promotional Photo Shoot
Administrative Expenses

story:
Mocha Radio

Mocha Radio is a streaming music channel, based in Auckland, New Zealand. We are a listener supported music channel. Please feel free to visit our facebook page www.facebook.com/MochaRadio and if you are in a position to support our efforts - make a donation. Your financial support helps us stay operational. Thank you.

You can listen to our high quality stream via our Facebook page, iTunes, Apple TV, TuneIn, Aha Radio and on many other top streaming services.

Alternatively, you could download and install our very own Mocha Radio app for your iPhone or Android smartphone.

story:
3 Days Left!!!!
Here's a teaser of songs from my upcoming EP!
Check out the link above !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

To all my Friends, Family, & Fans;
As most of you know, I have been working on my music for the past decade - more behind the scenes writing, pre-production, and small performances than anything.  Well, the time has finally come for me to begin my artistic journey on stage in front of live audiences across the nation and around the world. 

It's not easy to ask for help, so I'll give it my best. 

To everyone who has been there for me as an ear or for mental support when times have been tough, I want to thank you form the bottom of my heart. Over the years so many people have kindly offered, "If you need help, or if there is anything I can do, please let me know".  For the first time I humbly come to you asking for that help in making my dreams a reality! 

It takes a good financial push to get the ball rolling and fortunately, I am already peaking international interest!!!  Currently I am booked on a 3 month tour of the People's Republic of China starting next month! Having the video and single finalized will create more promotional opportunities for future tours and live promotions.

All that's missing is the music and the visual to be released quickly and precisely to better coincide with the opportunities coming through.  As an independent artist, there is the reality of a need for start up funds when it comes to promotion.  Who better to ask for help than you?…the people who have shown support all along! 

This campaign will assist in covering costs for the music video and post production on the music (single as well as other songs on the full length EP). 

If you're interested in more detail on the artistic direction, and for a snippet of the song, check out the video below…or feel free to read on if you're hand is just itching to contribute as soon as possible. (I type as a boyish smile spreads across my face!!) 
More Artistic Detailed Video HERE :

My goal for this campaign is to raise $10,000. The music has already been created...there has been tons of time, energy, blood, sweat, tears and money spent along the way. All that is needed now is some help bringing the project across the finish line and some positive support.  Expediency is key in order to capitalize on the opportunities that are coming my way.  

This campaign will assist in covering the costs listed below:

  • Final Mixing, Mastering, artwork, manufacturing and distributing the project (the singles/EP + start up for mercy - in order to begin funding next project). 
  • 1 professional video and promotional clips / visual material for other songs 
  • Basic PR & marketing, including a new website. (currently in construction) 



    "How else can I help?" you ask….
    I invite you, nay, I challenge you! -- to enthusiastically share this campaign on FB through email, or with friends simply by telling them about it.  For your troubles, you TOTALLY get a double hug next time I see you. 
    Make sure to check out the cool perks listed to the right…………….

    * THE PERKS *  

    (My way of saying thank you)

    - Single Before Release

    - T-Shirt

    - Autographed Picture
    - 3 Prereleased songs 
    - Poster 
    - 6 Song EP Prereleased 
    - Singing Telegram Special Occasion
    - 10 Song Album Unreleased 
    - Meet & Greet 
    - Acoustic Live Show (solo) 
    - Live Show (w/band & dancers) 

    For anyone that doesn't know me, here's a briefing.  I don't come from an artistic family so my path has consisted of a lot of hacking through the jungles of the industry to better educate myself about the business, all while learning as much as I could about the creative process from some of the greatest.  I have been on American Idol, Broadway, on television, and in movies. I have also danced for other extremely established music artists. I have been writing and creating music all along the way, "developing" my own craft and artistic voice.   


    To put things into scope, I have turned down  one major and two independent recording contracts within the past two years.  These offers would have only served 

    their own interests and would have entirely taken advantage of me and everything I've worked so hard for in the past 10 years.


    This music project and video, paired with the touring and performing opportunities already coming my way, will emphasize to any record label interested why they should invest in me. 


    ****************************************************************************

    ****************************************************************************

    If you are unable to contribute at this time, no worry! You can still help in several  other important ways:

    • direct people to my IndieGogo page.
    • share the campaign video on your FB page.
    • email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
    • tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pro's about my project.
    • tell your friends directly - from your lips to their ears - in the ancient ways 

    Any thing you can offer whether financial or word of mouth is extremely appreciated! Thank you! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign. 

    Again.  Thank You.

    Cheers!
