I have also danced for other extremely established music artists. I have been writing and creating music all along the way, "developing" my own craft and artistic voice.   


To put things into scope, I have turned down  one major and two independent recording contracts within the past two years.  These offers would have only served 
their own interests and would have entirely taken advantage of me and everything I've worked so hard for in the past 10 years.

This music project and video, paired with the touring and performing opportunities already coming my way, will emphasize to any record label interested why they should invest in me. 

****************************************************************************






****************************************************************************
If you are unable to contribute at this time, no worry! You can still help in several  other important ways:

direct people to my IndieGogo page.
share the campaign video on your FB page.
email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pro's about my project.
tell your friends directly - from your lips to their ears - in the ancient ways 

Any thing you can offer whether financial or word of mouth is extremely appreciated! Thank you! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign. Again.  Thank You.Cheers!

story:
Hey there everybody,

I have an album of songs and a tour of shows across this fair country and I need your help to make these things realities. I recorded this album a year ago and amongst costs of moving to California I have been unable to foot the bill to press it to vinyl, which was my main goal when embarking on the project. In short, it is my songs, a group of beautiful musicians, and the wild spontaneity of bringing it all together in a studio with a tape machine as our judge. I am proud of this record and want to release it to both share it with the world and be free to move on. 

Now, to make this record a success, there shall be a tour to promote it and to get some new material out there. On this tour, I will be bringing my banjo player, Jenna LoSavio and we will be playing both as a duo, and with various bands depending on the region we are in. 

The beauty of this is that it is all  possible. We just need some support from all you generous beloveds and we can bring you the fresh melodies we have brewing here in Los Angeles! 

Expense rundown:

Record Pressing - $1,638

Gas - $1,000 

Food - $1,000

Lodging - $1,000

Merchandise - $750

Fill in the gaps of unexpected circumstances and we find our goal of $6,000.   Whatever amount you can donate is immensely helpful and deeply appreciated.  

Jenna:

"This project is growing in ideas and sounds. With collaborations from friends on merch and visuals, we are planning on making this tour a sensory experience. I am humbled by your generosity, and ecstatic to perform for you all across the country!" 


Tour schedule as of 6/11/15 (more coming soon)

June 30th - KWSS 93.9 - Phoenix, AZ

June 30th - Yucca Tap Room - Phoenix, AZ

July 5th - Sahara Lounge - Austin, TX

July 21st - 5 Spot - Nashville, TN

Aug 5th - The Flat - Brooklyn, NY w/ Naked Hugs and Moniker

Aug 7th - TBA - Providence, RI

With eternal gratitude, 

Sam Small

Jenna LoSavio

Setting Silver

story:
Amy Malkoff and The Moonshines needs your help!

   
Fans, friends, and family, LISTEN UP! Amy Malkoff & the Moonshines are nearing the end of the recording process and we need your help! As some of you know recording music, mixing and mastering the songs, pressing and distributing the final product is an expensive process that requires a lot of love and hard work! Our band needs to finish this EP in order to supply you with our newest tracks, so we decided to reach out to you guys for a financial push to wrap this up. 

If we raise enough money we will be able to finish our 4 song EP, release it digitally and on CDs, print T-shirts, shoot a low-budget music video and keep on rocking like we are born to do! Your donations will help tremendously; even if it is just a few bucks or something more generous and substantial. ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING WILL HELP US!!!

In return for your generosity (depending on the amount you donate), we will supply you with a digital download of our new EP, T-shirts, stickers, and more, but we have to reach our goal!

Please spread the word and help us complete this process so everyone can enjoy our hard work! We thank all of you in advance for your consideration, your donations, and most importantly your ever-lasting support. We are so thankful for our fans, friends, and family and the ability to create original music, and we hope that you decide to help!

Thank you, we love you, and we cannot wait for everyone to hear our new music!

~ Amy Malkoff & the Moonshines
 

What We Need & What We Will Give Back

  • We need to raise $2,000 to cover mastering, pressing, CD packaging, and printing merchandise. 
  • Even if we do not reach our entire goal, every cent and penny will go straight towards helping us finish this album. This is something that means so much to us, and we couldn't do it with out you guys!!

  • Donate $5 - You will receive FREE download of the whole EP
  • Donate $20 - You will receive FREE download and t-shirt
  • Donate $30 or more - You will receive FREE CD, t-shirt, poster, & download!

Without your help and support, we may not be able to finish and release our music. 

  • We want to give back as a band, and any extra money that is raised beyond our goal will be donated directly to animal shelters of New Jersey. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that times are hard for people financially everywhere. Even if you aren't able to donate, you can still help by spreading the word by sharing and passing this along!
Thank you so much from the bottom of our souls for all of your support. We couldn't do this without you guys. We love you.

story:
About Me

I first attended Le Mans in 2008 and have since attended six Le Mans 24H races. In 2012 I setup instagram.com/24hoursoflemans and have now seen the account grow organically to over 32,000 followers. I am a big motorsport fan with an interest in photography.

My Campaign

To raise enough money to allow me to buy a Paddock Pass at this year's 24 Hours of Le Mans. Without this pass I won't be able to share with my followers any worthwhile photographs as it will not be possible to get close to the action. I have been informed by both the ACO & the FIA that social media is not a recognised form of media, therefore it is not possible for me to obtain accreditation, which would then grant this access for free.

What You Will Help Me Achieve

My contributors will help me both fulfil a passion and also share the experience with the large group of fans.

What I Need & What You Get

I need €500 to purchase a Paddock Pass from the ACO. The minimum amount on here is £500, so any extra money will go towards travel to the venue.

In exchange for sponsorship I am allowing contributors to feature their brand imagery and messages with my audience. This is a unique opportunity to get your brand in front of a large active fanbase and also support amateur motorsport.
If I don't make the full goal will look to try and fund the race with my own money.
I am also looking for race teams & drivers to assist with access to garages at both Silverstone WEC & Le Mans.

The Impact

My project is valuable to contributors as it will allow them to share their brand imagery and messages with an engaged target audience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to potential funding I am also looking for race teams, sponsors, vehicle manufacturers and drivers to assist with access at Silverstone and Le Mans. Also if you think of any sponsors that could benefit from contributing please let them know about my campaign by sharing it with them.

story:
Hello! My name is Taryn Newborne. I'm a singer and I love to dance... Swing dance, that is!
  "Swing dance" is most commonly known as a group of dances that developed with the swing style of jazz music in the 1920s-1950s. The best known of these dances is the LINDY HOP, a popular partner dance that originated in Harlem in 1927 and is still danced today."
   It all began when, after years of dancing in my Lindy Hop local scene, one of the major organizers suggested that I put my own group together for dances and I've been going ever since. Dancing is something my whole family enjoys. My husband, two sons and I have traveled the country attending various Lindy Hop events. So it’s only natural that I’d want to put my two loves together.

Duke Ellington said, “…dancers are not just sitting there watching; they’re having a ball.” I know this is true because even when I’m singing, I want to be out there dancing with them! I love this dance for it's timeless music, rich history, and for the infectious joy that's spread all over the world.

    Every time I play for an event, people always ask me where they can buy my album. Well, at long last, I’m pleased to announce that, with your support, my album entitled Sing, Taryn, Swing!  is finally set to begin production!!!

THE TEAM

    At the helm of this venture are my producer, acclaimed jazz drummer Justin Varnes, my arranger/co-writer, international jazz trombonist Marcus Lewis, and my recording engineer Marlon Patton. My band Taryn Newborne and The Real Deal will consist of some of the most sought after musicians in the world:

Piano... Tyrone Jackson

Bass...Craig Shaw

Drums...Justin Varnes 

Trombone...Wes Funderburk

Trumpet... Melvin Jones

Trumpet...Joe Gransden

Tenor Sax and Clarinet...Jason Passmore

Alto Sax...Brian Hogans

With special guest Ben Bailey and Scott Ulmer


WHERE YOU COME IN

   Your generous support is needed to put together a project of this magnitude. Each and every one of the team members playing a part in bringing Sing, Taryn, Swing!  to life is an extraordinary artist and a consummate professional. They are by far the best in the business, and because, for their time and commitment to such a titanic venture, they deserve to be compensated fairly...  Every cent goes toward securing a top notch sound.

  

   We're working very hard to bring this project to life, but, ultimately, we can't pull the whole thing off without YOUR help. Any amount will make a difference, and if you are able to contribute $25 or more, you have the option of receiving one of the unique and exclusive perks listed on the right! And please stay tuned for updates at every stage of production.

Thank you so, SO much for your time and for considering donating to my cause!!!


Sincerely,

Taryn Newborne
story_txt:
Hello! My name is Taryn Newborne. I'm a singer and I love to dance... Swing dance, that is!  "Swing
dance" is most commonly known as a group of dances that developed with the
swing style of jazz music in the 1920s-1950s. The best known of these dances is
the LINDY HOP, a popular partner
dance that originated in Harlem in 1927
and is still danced today."   It all began when, after years of dancing in my Lindy Hop local scene, one of the major organizers suggested that I put my own group together for dances and I've been going ever since. Dancing is something my whole family enjoys. My husband, two sons and I have
 traveled the country attending various Lindy Hop events. So it’s only 
natural that I’d want to put my two
loves together. 
Duke Ellington said, “…dancers are not just sitting
there watching; they’re having a ball.” I know this is true because even when
I’m singing, I want to be out there dancing with them! I love this dance for it's timeless music, rich history, and for the infectious joy that's spread all over the world. 
    Every time I play for an event, people always ask me where they can buy my album. Well, at long last, I’m pleased to announce that, with your support, my album entitled Sing,
Taryn, Swing!  is finally set to begin production!!! 

THE TEAM

    At the helm of this venture are my producer, acclaimed jazz drummer Justin Varnes, my arranger/co-writer, international jazz trombonist Marcus Lewis, and my recording engineer Marlon Patton. My band Taryn Newborne and The Real Deal will consist of some of the most sought after musicians in the world:
Piano... Tyrone Jackson

Bass...Craig Shaw 

Drums...Justin Varnes 
Trombone...Wes Funderburk

Trumpet... Melvin Jones 

Trumpet...Joe Gransden

Tenor Sax and Clarinet...Jason Passmore

Alto Sax...Brian Hogans
With special guest Ben Bailey and Scott Ulmer

WHERE YOU COME IN
   Your generous support is needed to put together a project of this magnitude. Each and every one of the team members playing a part in bringing Sing, Taryn, Swing!  to life is an extraordinary artist and a consummate professional.  They are by far the best in the business, and because, for their time and commitment to such a titanic venture, they deserve to be compensated fairly...  Every cent goes toward securing a top notch sound.       We're working very hard to bring this project to life, but, ultimately, we can't pull the 
whole thing off without YOUR help. Any amount will make a difference, 
and if you are able to contribute $25 or more, you have the option of 
receiving one of the unique and exclusive perks listed on the right! And please stay tuned for updates at every stage of production. 
Thank you so, SO much for your time and for considering donating to my cause!!!

Sincerely,
Taryn Newborne

story:
We are your Symphony PEI.

Time to Play Your Part!

The Prince Edward Island Symphony has brought quality orchestral music to our province for nearly 50 years.  Four times a year our orchestra brings together sixty or more musicians including professionals, students, music teachers, business people and community members for an exciting 'concert weekend' to rehearse and perform a program of classical music that is appealing to a wide audience.

There's nothing quite like the power, majesty and grace of a live symphony orchestra, and the PEI Symphony is the Island's own. 

Now, we are asking for your support.  The past five years have been a financial struggle for the orchestra.  Increasing expenses, and declining donations and sales are putting the future of our orchestra at risk.  

Please help us keep the music playing.  Our community needs the PEISO, and the PEISO needs you -  more than ever.  

Just as each individual musician plays their part in an orchestra, we are asking YOU to play a part to help secure the future of our great orchestra. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise a minimum of $15,000 to help us reduce our operational debt, to secure the future of the orchestra.   With an annual operating budget of about $170,000 per season, we have been between unable to break even for the past 5 years, and we cannot continue without at least balancing our budget.  

We certainly appreciate the generous support of the Canada Council of the Arts, the Prince Edward Island Department of Tourism and Culture, and the City of Charlottetown, and also to our key sponsors including The Joan & Regis Duffy Foundation, Provincial Credit Union,  Hyndman Insurance, The Confederation Centre for the Arts, The Guardian, the Buzz, the Best Value hotels, Kwik Kopy, R. Birt & Associates, and Harvest Wholesale.  

Even with their support, we need your help.  Unfortunately our concert expenses have been increasing over the last five years while our individual and corporate donations, and yearly subscriptions have all decreased.  In the last two years our individual donations have decreased by 50%.  We need your support to keep the music playing.

As a thank you for supporting our orchestra, we have a fun range of unique perks available, from a handwritten card from a musician,  an opportunity to play, or a sponsorship - there is a way for everyone to play a part!


Our Impact

Our orchestra has a huge impact on our community here in Prince Edward Island, and is itself a music community with a wide variety of individuals who either perform or appreciate quality orchestral music, and the joy of working hard together to create a beautiful live performance.  

As a full symphony orchestra, the PEISO supports our cultural identity in Prince Edward Island and the greater Charlottetown area, at a level that’s commensurate with our status as a province and capital, and the birthplace of Confederation in Canada.  

  • Cultural events such as our concerts engage and attract professionals, businesses and educated audiences to our Island and our economy.
  • Our audiences experience the incredible power and beauty of live orchestral music four times a season.
  • Our $170K annual budget is primarily used to purchase supplies and services right here in PEI, reinvesting in our local economy.
  • Four times per year we book twenty five hotel rooms for a full weekend for our travelling musicians.
  • Every concert attracts off-island tourism.
  • Charlottetown restaurants are busy during each of our four concert weekends.
  • Professional PEI musicians have the opportunity to perform with a full orchestra.
  • Young PEI student musicians have the opportunity to perform with an orchestra, as regular members and/or soloists.
  • Islanders experience talented guest soloists and our guest soloists experience the orchestra and our Island community.
  • Established PEI solo artists and groups have an opportunity to perform with a full live orchestra.
  • Island popular music artists and groups can have their music arranged for orchestra for other engagements outside of PEI.


Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to support our orchestra is to come to as many of our concerts as you can!   Our next concerts are Sunday April 12th, and Sunday October 19th.

Season Tickets are available for purchase - please check www.peisymphony.com for details, or call 902-892-4333.

Our annual 'Serenade to Spring Dinner and Auction', held at the Rodd Charlottetown, is on Saturday June 6.  Music will be provided by the Singing Strings. Tickets are $90 - and you receive a $50 tax receipt. 

Listen, perform, share. Get excited about classical music - and play your part!

story:
Valley of the Moon Suite 30 Day Funding Push

WORLD PREMIERE
APRIL 25 - 7pm
Ojai Community Church
907 El Centro St.
Ojai, CA 93023

VALLEY OF THE MOON SUITE was born from my experience living in the Ojai Valley since 1999. Though I have been composing and producing music for decades I've yet to write a piece that captures the essence of a specific place. In this case, one in which I'm completely enamored by. When the opportunity came to collaborate with the Ojai Youth Symphony and a select group of local professional musicians, I embraced the challenge. The Suite tells the story, through music and image, of the Ojai Valley; it's rich cultural heritage, pristine land, vibrant history and colorful characters. Your contribution will help us produce the World Premiere Concert on April 25, 2015 in Ojai, CA and a concert recording of the event. If enough is raised over and above our goal, it is my intention to use those funds to bring a professional orchestra into a  studio environment and capture a performance.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Thus far we have received $3500 in grants from the Ojai Arts Council, Ventura County Community Foundation, Smith-Hobsen Foundation and individual contributions. Yet this is not nearly enough to bring a project of this magnitude to fruition. With another $8000, through your generous support, we can rest easy that all of our production expenses will be met.
  • So what about these PERKS!!! Well first and foremost... come to the concert. If you want seating up close and personal we offer that too. If you're inspired to contribute more you'll get a recording of, either a download or CD of the concert. To make it even sweeter, the next contribution level includes a bound and signed score of any of the six sections of Valley of the Moon Suite you desire. You can even pledge enough to receive the entire autographed bound score, so you can follow along while you listen.
  • There are also excerpts for you to hear set to some beautiful videos in the gallery section of the campaign.

The Impact

  • The Valley of the Moon project will impact the lives of young musicians and provide an inter-generational and multi-cultural experience for them through collaboration with musical mentors and indigenous elders. The Suite will incorporate a variety of  musical styles and offers a unique opportunity for the talent  in the Ojai Valley to explore new music.
  • Not only does the concert feature the Ojai Youth Symphony, we have also invited Chumash Elder Julie Tumamait-Stenslie to share some traditional songs. Images from local photographers and fine artists will also be projected to accompany the music,  creating a multi-media event that will educate, entertain and inspire.
  • We have a commitment to the role that music education and music appreciation plays in childhood development. There is well proven research that music studies enhance brain function, comprehension and social skills.

  • The Ojai Youth Symphony was founded in 2002 by Andy Radford and Amy Hagen. Both professional musicians, they have dedicated their lives to bringing music into the lives of youth; in the schools and extracurricular programs.

  • Ray Powers holds degrees in voice and post graduate studies in composition. He has worked in many facets of the music industry as a writer, performer, arranger, producer, music educator and consultant. 

Risks & Challenges

It's been a risky endeavor dedicating the last year to writing a 45min. orchestral work and trusting that patrons of the arts and local community members will care enough about new orchestral works and music education to support our efforts in bringing Valley of the Moon Suite to its' home on the concert stage. There is a considerable way to go in raising the funds needed, and though the performance will take place whether we meet our goal with this campaign or not, we would prefer not to incur debt staging this event. My promise to you is we won't give up. We threw our proverbial hat over the fence and booked a concert date of April 25, 2015.  Your help and generosity will ease the concerns more than we can say.
Thank you in advance for helping us make this possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, please, please share this campaign with friends and music lovers.

  • Indiegogo has all sorts of tools to make sharing easy for you. Use them!!
  • Volunteers are needed at the show; ushers, ticket takers, videographer...
  • Listen and spread the word. Take a listen to the virtual orchestra I used on my computer to compose Valley of the Moon Suite.

THANK YOU!!!

story:
WHO WE ARE -

Our names are Apryl Knight, Mark the Harper, and Demaris.  Apryl Knight has a solo act, and the full group is Tulstin Troubadours.  We play music from many times and many lands on WAY too many instruments!  You may have heard us playing music at the Sherwood Forest Faire, the St. Louis Renaissance Festival, Pennsic, Lillies War, GenCon, or the Oklahoma or Texas Renaissance Festivals.

At many of our performances, common questions are “Do you have a dance CD?”, “Do you have an instrumental CD?”, and “Do you have a CD with the hurdy gurdy on it?”  In order to answer “Yes!” to all of these questions, we’re going to record two albums - Apryl Knight’s solo CD of dance tunes called “Dance The Knight Away”, and a CD of our favorite Medieval and Renaissance songs called “A Shortage Of Perfect Rests”.


DANCE THE KNIGHT AWAY -

“Dance The Knight Away” will be equally appealing to dancers and those who just want to listen to good music.  For the dancers, Apryl Knight has done research on preferred tempos and repeat structures, so this CD should make a great addition to your group’s library.

The songs will include -

Horses’ Bransle
Rufty Tufty
Petit Vriens
Amoroso
Toss the Duchess (Official Bransle)
If All the World Were Paper
Chirintana
Danse de Cleves
Pizochara (Pinzochera)
Ly Bens Dystonis
Heart's Ease
Trenchmore   
Gracca Amorosa
Black Almayn
Sellenger's Round
La Gelosia
Cassandre Bransle
Burgundian Bransle

A SHORTAGE OF PERFECT RESTS -

“A Shortage Of Perfect Rests” will not only have Apryl, Mark, and Demaris playing pretty much every instrument they own (and a few that they don’t!), but will also include some of our friends making guest appearances (look for guest artists on both CDs!) We’re recording some of our most requested songs (that are not on “Rennies Of Unusual Sound”), as well as some new songs that we anticipate will become your favorites as well!

The songs will include -

The Wind and the Rain
A l'entrant d'este (Blondel's chanson)
Ja Nuns Hons Pris
Martin Said To His Man
Cantiga 353
Chansonetta Tedesca
Douce Dame Jolie
Tourdion
Ah Robin
Bacche, Bene, Venies
La Mantovana
Nightingale
Como Poden
Kyla Vuotti Uutta Kuuta

WHAT WE NEED -

We want these albums to sound amazing, so we are going to SoundWright Studio to have Tree Leom work some magic on them (and possibly lay down a percussion track or three).  The cost of high-quality studio recording is, well, high! However, we think it’s totally worth it to produce CDs that listeners will enjoy and of which we’ll be proud to have made.  If we exceed our goal, then the extra money will go towards getting the CDs professionally mastered!  

  • $4,000 will get us two fully produced, designed, and manufactured CDs!
  • $5,000 will get us professional mastering for both of the CDs, making them sound even better!


WHAT YOU GET (i.e., The Perks!)

You can view the perks on the right, but here’s some more information -

The $15-$25 and $45 levels are pre-order levels. If you know you are going to want our next album(s), you can pre-order it through the campaign. The CDs will have a full-color picture on the disc, and a single two-sided insert in the front of the case.  We’ll be putting as much information as will fit on the inside of the insert.

The House Concert level will get you a ticket that will let you and a guest see a house concert featuring Apryl Knight or Tulstin Troubadours.  We haven’t set an exact location for the concerts yet, though we have some ideas.  If we end up with a majority of contributors to this level who are all in the same area, we’ll do our best to schedule a house concert in that area.  If you contribute to the House Concert level and the concert ends up being too far away from you, you will get an exclusive invitation to view the concert on Concert Window, which is an awesome online concert platform where you can both see the concert and type your comments and requests directly to us.

As to the Hedgehog Dance Video levels - our mascots, Hedgie and Buttercup, have been itching to make a dance video for quite a while, and will be filming a dance video that will be sent to all of the contributors at these levels.  They will personally thank you at the end of the video if you contribute at the Personalized Video level.

The Dance Book level ($60) is a great perk for SCA musicians or dance group leaders, or for anyone who wants sheet music with new arrangements of dance tunes.  The book will be spiral bound (so it will lay flat), and will have a clear plastic front and back cover.

The $150 level is designed for SCA dance groups who want to have a different version of one of the songs on the “Dance The Knight Away” CD.  If you’re wondering if this level is right for you, contact Apryl Knight to find out the specifics of the song structure of the planned songs.  We can discuss your group’s specific needs.

WHERE THE MONEY GOES


$4,000 will go to Tree Leom to record the two CDs ($2,000 per CD).

What if we get less than anticipated?
We’ll use all of the money received to pay for recording costs, and do the best we can to pay for the remaining amount (which could possibly delay the release of the albums.)

What if we get more than anticipated?
Extra money above the $4,000 will go towards professional mastering of the CDs.  If we get more than we need for recording and mastering, then we can entertain the idea of getting fancier CDs with actual printed multi-page booklets.

WANT TO KEEP TRACK OF OUR PROGRESS?


Regular updates, musings, and random outbursts will be posted on our Facebook Pages -
Apryl Knight's Facebook Page
Tulstin Troubadours' Facebook Page
Hedgie's Facebook Page
Buttercup's Facebook Page

and on Twitter -
@apryl_knight
@t_troubadours


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP -

1) Pledge early! Statistically, successful IndieGoGo campaigns reach a third of their goal within the first 48 hours. Pledging early will help us build the momentum we need to reach our goal!

2) Share, share, share!  Along with pledging, helping us get the word out far and wide is the absolute best way to help us reach our goal. Even if you can't contribute at this time, you are still a huge part of what makes independent music happen when you share the news with your communities! So please share with all whom you think would love this project!

Thank you for supporting us in this endeavor!

our mascots, Hedgie and Buttercup, have been itching to make a dance video for quite a while, and will be filming a dance video that will be sent to all of the contributors at these levels.  They will personally thank you at the end of the video if you contribute at the Personalized Video level.The Dance Book level ($60) is a great perk for SCA musicians or dance group leaders, or for anyone who wants sheet music with new arrangements of dance tunes.  The book will be spiral bound (so it will lay flat), and will have a clear plastic front and back cover.The $150 level is designed for SCA dance groups who want to have a different version of one of the songs on the “Dance The Knight Away” CD.  If you’re wondering if this level is right for you, contact Apryl Knight to find out the specifics of the song structure of the planned songs.  We can discuss your group’s specific needs.WHERE THE MONEY GOES$4,000 will go to Tree Leom to record the two CDs ($2,000 per CD).What if we get less than anticipated?We’ll use all of the money received to pay for recording costs, and do the best we can to pay for the remaining amount (which could possibly delay the release of the albums.)What if we get more than anticipated?Extra money above the $4,000 will go towards professional mastering of the CDs.  If we get more than we need for recording and mastering, then we can entertain the idea of getting fancier CDs with actual printed multi-page booklets.WANT TO KEEP TRACK OF OUR PROGRESS?Regular updates, musings, and random outbursts will be posted on our Facebook Pages -Apryl Knight's Facebook PageTulstin Troubadours' Facebook PageHedgie's Facebook PageButtercup's Facebook Pageand on Twitter - @apryl_knight@t_troubadoursOTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP - 1) Pledge early! Statistically, successful IndieGoGo campaigns reach a third of their goal within the first 48 hours. Pledging early will help us build the momentum we need to reach our goal!2) Share, share, share!  Along with pledging, helping us get the word out far and wide is the absolute best way to help us reach our goal. Even if you can't contribute at this time, you are still a huge part of what makes independent music happen when you share the news with your communities! So please share with all whom you think would love this project! Thank you for supporting us in this endeavor!

story:
Our Mission

First and foremost, we dedicate ourselves to spreading the name of Jesus Christ and sharing testimonies of salvation through the singing and playing of Gospel music. We believe the performance of Gospel Music to be a ministry that knows no boundaries such as denomination, race, financial or personal prejudice. Gospel music is a means for us to praise, spread the name of Jesus Christ and win the lost for Kingdom of God

Second, this organization is dedicated to serve the nations. To sponsor singing concerts and events which promote Gospel Music. We will share positive experiences, training, support and prayer for each member of the ministry

The Heirs of Harmony is a registered and recognized non-profit organization, working together to support and promote gospel music internationally in order to uplift each other and our Savior Jesus Christ and to win souls for Him.

What We Need & What You Get

The Heirs of Harmony we would like to solicit your assistance in helping us raise $2500 in phase 1 of our $25,000 goal to purchase vans in support of our Transportation Ministry. These vans will serve to accommodate our traveling ministry and also provide to seniors in need of transportation to Doctor's appointments, grocery stores, etc.
The Impact

With your help, our vision to reach the lost and tearing down the walls of religion and tradition will come into fruition. Our Transportation Ministry will serve as one of the major vehicles of this vision, seeking to service those that lack transportation, as well as seek out those persons residing in retirement homes & communities, homeless shelters, transitional housing and elsewhere within the boarders of Grand Rapids, Michigan who are undeserved and who would benefit from the availability of the vans.  They will never sit idle in between our ministry trips. They will always be put to good use, helping others in need.

Even though we are a religious institution focusing on inspiring people through the gospel, we also believe strongly in reaching outside our circle by extending a helping hand to those that are in need with our "feed-a-family" program and supporting our community at large by building awareness in education, violence, domestic abuse, and linking these families to community services.  We are happy to say that The Heirs of Harmony do more than just sing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us get the word out by telling your friends and family about our campaign or even posting the campaign on your social media pages. Feel free to use the share tools available through this website.
  • Most importantly, continue to pray for our efforts and our ministry.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello, we are 'Between California and Summer' from beautiful Orange County, CA. Over the past 6 months, we have recorded a brand new EP and have played amazing shows all over Southern California. Now, we need your help to get us on the road, and share our music to the rest of the country. 

For us, being able to play music is a blessing on its own. The fact that we can positively impact someone's life or make them feel a certain way, is more important than anything. It still blows our mind, that three or four minutes of what we created, can take someone to another time or place in their life. 

We know that there are people, and places in the world, who rely on music just to get by. For them, it's a way to survive a life that sometimes makes you want to quit. Those are the people we want to connect with, and they are the reason why we do this. Even if it's for one night, we want to share our music, and share every feeling along with you. We don't want to just play music, but we want to interact and connect with everyone we meet. We want to create memories, and positively impact lives. Everyone has a story, and we want to be a small part of it. 

In 2015, we would like to reach out to more people, and more places by going on tour. Through the help of some dedicated people, we have been absolutely BLESSED with the opportunity to tour the Southwest and Pacific Northwest of America this year. Right now, we really need to purchase a van, to get us to and from the venues. Please support us in any way that you can, because it will get us one step closer to our dream.

All our love,

-Adam, James, Legend, Tyler, Connor

Between California and Summer

story:
Who we are
We are passionate performers and promoters of traditional Icelandic music, dance and handcraft. We all live in North Iceland and are members of the folk dance group Vefarinn, the societies of traditional musicians, Rima and Gefjun, and a society for handcraft, Handraðinn. We are farmers, managers, store workers, hospital staff, engineers, fishermen and teachers joining hands to celebrate our cultural heritage. You can email us at info@tradition.is


Our project: Vaka
We are organizing Vaka, a truly Icelandic folk festival, in the town of Akureyri, on the north coast of Iceland, 10 - 13 of June, 2015. Our mission is to show the whole world how remarkable Icelandic traditional music, dance and handcraft really is. We don't want our deep-rooted and personal music, dance and handcraft to be thrown aside and forgotten. We've been surviving in isolated and small societies for far too long - it's time we make our selves be noticed. Vaka is where we can show who we are and what it's all about; it's organized by us, according to our priorities and standards; Vaka is where we celebrate our heritage and have an opportunity to grow. 
We have invited folk artists from our neighboring countries to join us. They're all eager to come, share their music and dance and experience ours. We are very excited to get them here to north Iceland where we can see how they work with their traditions and to enjoy their dedication and skill. 
The organizing team for Vaka is: Sigurlaug (Silla) for Vefarinn, Guðrún (Rúna) for Ríma, Anna for Gefjun and Guðrún (Hadda) for Handraðinn.
Website: www.vakafolk.is


What we need
In order for us to celebrate our heritage in the manner it deserves, we need to reach our goal of $6000. Travel and lodging is a big expense since Iceland is far away from any other country and  we also want to pay our visiting artists for coming to Vaka to perform and teach. But our work and performances are voluntary. 

What you get
By supporting Vaka you are joining us in our celebration of Icelandic folk traditions and helping us prevent the loss of a valuable cultural heritage. 

As a heart felt Thank you for your support we have prepared several "perks" for you to chose from:

  • a CD with Icelandic tvísöngvar* performed by the members of Rima in Fjallabyggð**
  • a booklet with notated tvisongvar
  • hand- knitted Icelandic wool mittens with old Nordic og modern patterns
  • bracelet made of fish skin 
  • a 52 page booklet with notated Icelandic folk songs from North Iceland and accompanying CD
  • then of course you could get season tickets to Vaka and a signed Vaka 2015 poster

-----------------------------------

 * Tvísöngvar is undoubtedly the most remarkable of Iceland's musical traditions. It was practiced for at least 700 years, but the 20th century almost managed to drive it to extinction.

** Fjallabyggð is a small town in the center of Iceland's north coast, flanked by steep and tall mountains. The town is often snowbound in the winter months, but in the summer it's adorned by delicate wild flowers and a haven for migrating birds.

story:
My YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/JonnyDSax

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JonnyDSaxophone

My journey to the point of producing this album started in 2008. I was a young boy with an interest in playing a musical instrument, never knowing that 6+ years down the line I would be pursuing it as a career and a way of life.

I was pretty intent on playing the trumpet but my Mum suggested that I try the saxophone and from the moment I did, I was in love. Sadly, Mum passed away very suddenly in 2009 and I struggled every single day. My only comfort in playing the sax was that it was for her .. but at the same time, knowing she could no longer hear it made it almost unbearable to play.

With the support of my family, I pushed on and passed my Grade 8 exam before the age of 16. I was beginning to love my attachment to my, what had now become, three saxophones (Tenor, Alto and Soprano) and regularly practiced up to 5 hours a day.

I started busking at the age of 15, mostly for experience and received very positive feedback. Within no time, I was being asked to attend functions, weddings and corporate events, culminating in me organising my own charity event in July 2014 and getting my first taste of professional playing (and the nerves that came with it).

In 2015, I made a massive leap and left schooling to pursue playing the saxophone as a full time career. Some people have hinted that I must be crazy but I feel a huge, burning desire to push my abilities as far as they can go and the feedback I have had has been quite humbling.

I have made small time recordings in a very basic studio but I feel now is the time to move up and push for an album that I can sell. Most of the songs will be covers and some of the money will be used for the initial copyright fees but I do have an original song or two in the pipeline, so hopefully that will make it into the album.

I would love for you to accompany me on this journey and upload videos of my progress as we go through the various stages, from design and artwork to recording and mastering.

What the money is going toward/what you'll be watching me do over the course of this Project:

- Play

- Mix

- Master

- Design and CD production (including copyright fees)

- Promotion

Thank you for making it this far. I know it's a lot to absorb and from all of the projects on here, why me?

I have a massive passion for what I do. I'm only 18 years old and have a lot to learn about the music industry but I love it and push myself every day to be as good as I can be. Hopefully I'll be able to make everyone who contributes to this proud and be able to see that their kindness changed a young man's life forever.

Most of all, I hope I can make Mum and my family proud. I wouldn't be here without them.

Thank you

Jonny

story:
Short Summary

The Detroit Medical Orchestra is excited to showcase the Detroit fine arts community in an exciting performance of Stravinsky's Firebird Suite on May 3, 2015. This free concert will be a collaboration between the orchestra and local dancers and visual artists to provide a fantastic immersive experience into the magical world of the iconic Firebird. 
In order to bring this project to its pinnacle of musical expression, we are enhancing the experience with stage props and set design that will interact with the orchestra while it plays. We are also involving professional dancers and a director and choreographer to coordinate the visual aspect of the performance. Props, set design, costumes, professional artists, and stage personnel all require financial support, so the Detroit Medical Orchestra needs your help! Please donate today and come to our performance at 4pm on May 3, 2015 at the Ford Auditorium located in the Detroit School of Arts. 
Donors will be honored in our concert program and on promotional materials. The Detroit Medical Orchestra is a recognized 501(c)(3) non-profit Private Foundation, so all donations are tax-deductible. EIN 45-3183266.

More about the orchestra and this project

Since our beginning in 2009, the DMO’s mission to “bring healing through music” has been realized by  presenting high-level classical concert performances in the heart of downtown Detroit performed by Detroit-area medical professionals – medical students, nurses, resident and attending physicians, and professionals from other health-allied fields. As such, there is no other community orchestra like the DMO in Michigan. The DMO performances have reached thousands of appreciative concert-goers. Concert donations benefit several central Detroit health and social initiatives such as the Robert R. Frank Student-Run Free Clinic, Cass Community Clinic, The Horizons Project and Clinic, the Detroit School of Arts, and others.  The orchestra members are all volunteers, giving generously of their time and extraordinary talent.

And now the DMO has proudly announced its most ambitious and exciting concert program ever: the monumental ballet and orchestral concert work The Firebird by Igor Stravinsky. The performance will produced by a highly-respected director and choreographer and will feature professional ballet soloists as well as dance students from Wayne State University and students from the Detroit School of Arts. High-energy rehearsals are going on now for this May 2015 performance. We have never done anything like this before and we can’t wait!

Creating a performance like this requires costumes, props, set design, and experienced stage personnel, and we believe strongly in paying guest artists for their work. So as you can imagine, the DMO is going pretty far out on a financial limb here – and that’s why we are calling on your support in this special way. We are counting on the same source of strong support that we’ve always had: many kind, generous contributors who appreciate the work we do. We have always managed our funds very carefully – and this concert is no different – but this time we need just a little bit more!  By April 1, we hope to have raised $10,000 to cover the concert expenses. 

And in keeping with our mission, all of the costumes and props together with a portion of donations accepted at the concert will be donated to the Detroit School of Arts to enhance the very fine programs of art development available for talented Detroit youth. 

As always, as a DMO supporter you can be assured that:

  • All your contributions stay local and directly benefit City of Detroit and nearby citizens and their charitable causes
  • Your gifts add to the gifts that the members of the orchestra also generously provide (besides their talent and time!)
  • Your DMO will continue to provide free public access to the people of Detroit to enjoy some of the world’s finest classical music

I truly hope that you will join our orchestra as we continue to strive towards bringing healing through music.

Sincerely yours,

YoungKey Chung

President, Detroit Medical Orchestra

MD Candidate 2015

Wayne State University School of Medicine

story:
Summary Of Who We Are

3 years ago, 3 guys: Brent, Jarrett, and Thom set out to create a place that musicians and bands in the Long Beach, Orange County, and LA area could come with their imagination, talent, and creativity and make and record music. Unfortunately, we lost one (Thom) along the way but two of us remained and persevered. We had the idea of a place without pretense, stuffiness, or music snobbery but a notion that if you had a couple songs or a full album and wanted to preserve it forever, you could come here and we'd help you realize that dream. 
A lot of really talented people have been to our little spot and together we've put a lot of good music out into the world. Including bands like:
Sister Crowley, Northern Youth, Yukon Gold, Adam Fight, Kyle Michael Neal, We are Traitors, and many more.....and we would like to keep putting out great music with better and better recording tone and quality.
What We Need & How You Can Help

Recently, as we are remodeling, upgrading, and improving and have run into some costly issues. We have learned that there are some electrical problems that are causing surges and ruining some expensive recording equipment, not to mention generating a noticeable amount of interference during recording. This issue can and will be rectified, however with a hefty cost. This is unfortunately cutting into our operating and improvement budget and therefore we are asking that our friends and supporters help us continue offering the best possible recordings for artists and bands that don't have tens of thousands of dollars to record at major recording studios in Hollywood.

The Impact

We feel that we contribute the city of Long Beach and the surrounding areas in quite a few ways. Firstly, we love music as I'm sure you do. But we really love music, writing it, playing it, recording it, mixing it...etc. We know how powerful and important it is to so many people. When i was a kid of 13 or 14 years old I dreamt about going into a recording studio and recording my dumb little songs (I was young, they weren't very good yet, don't know if the are any good now :) but growing up a poor kid that idea wasn't even remotely possible. 
We want to be able to provide an amazing, fun, and memorable recording experience for any band or artist on a budget nearly anybody can afford. Plus you'll get an amazing sounding album at the end of your recording experience.
Risks & Challenges 
Running and keeping a studio together is a lot of hard work as you can imagine. There are quite a bit of operating costs like overhead, new equipment, equipment failure, consumables, etc. Scheduling can be a challenge. Getting the best performance from clients and having them relax and be comfortable when the red light comes on can sometimes be a lesson in patience. But let me stop complaining those are our problems and let us worry about that.
You just come record, play and sing your very best, and leave it all on the floor.

Incentives

We would like to offer a few incentives for your donations:

$20 donation - Spring Street Coffee cup

$50 donation - Spring Street T-shirt

$100 donation - 4 hours recording

$250 donation - 1 recorded and mixed song
story_txt:
Summary Of Who We Are
3 years ago, 3 guys: Brent, Jarrett, and Thom set out to create a place that musicians and bands in the Long Beach, Orange County, and LA area could come with their imagination, talent, and creativity and make and record music. Unfortunately, we lost one (Thom) along the way but two of us remained and persevered. We had the idea of a place without pretense, stuffiness, or music snobbery but a notion that if you had a couple songs or a full album and wanted to preserve it forever, you could come here and we'd help you realize that dream. 
A lot of really talented people have been to our little spot and together we've put a lot of good music out into the world. Including bands like:
Sister Crowley, Northern Youth, Yukon Gold, Adam Fight, Kyle Michael Neal, We are Traitors, and many more.....and we would like to keep putting out great music with better and better recording tone and quality.

What We Need & How You Can Help

story:
To whom it may concern

Our son Raphael Papo, a truly gifted violinist, began year 10 in the Wells Cathedral School as a Specialist Musician in September 2014

The school was very impressed when he auditioned in December 2013 and he was awarded a scholarship to cover the Specialist Musician fees and a partial scholarship to cover his Boarding fees. We were not eligible for a government grant to cover the Academic fees for the year (£15,000) and so Raphael's Grandmother kindly offered to pay this through an equity release on her house.

Government grant criteria indicate that we will only be eligible to receive support for Academic fees for the school year 2016-17, thus we are on a mission to secure Raphael's place in the school for the academic year 2015-16. 

Any contribution will bring us nearer to the sum required and will be thankfully received.

Please note that paypal charge a FEE for CREDIT CARD PAYMENTS, so try and pay using your bank account within paypal to avoid this. Thanks

Thanks

story:
The Mississippi Onward PAC is a 527 Political Action Committee designed for one purpose, changing the Mississippi State Flag. Our goal is to finance a successful campaign, through mainstream media, social media and grassroots organizing, to influence our state leaders into having a serious conversation about changing the flag, and ultimately doing so. 

We believe changing the flag will make us more competitive in the global economy.

We believe changing the flag will be a symbolic gesture that will lead to more substantive policy changes.

We believe changing the flag will create a more united Mississippi that is respectful of the cultural diversity that has shaped this state.

We believe changing the flag will send a clear message to the nation that Mississippi is ready to fully take its rightful place in the 21st Century.

If you believe in what we believe, join the campaign to change the State of Mississippi Flag!

story:
RECLINER 

If you don't know us, we're an indie band out of San Francisco. We've been around well over ten years now. In that time we've had some great successes as a band. We've put out five releases. We've played in Japan and various music festivals. We even had a nice run with one of our music videos on TV. Heck, we've even gotten better at our instruments. But we've never put our music out on vinyl. 

HELP US MAKE OUR RECORD 

That's what this campaign is all about: getting our music out on vinyl. Of course we'll produce plenty of digital options for the new school kids (CDs, digital downloads, streaming, etc.) as perks for contributors and when the campaign is over. But our real goal is to make a record! The kind that spins around a turntable—that you have to turn over in anticipation of side two. One that comes in a big beautiful sleeve to read as you listen. Yes, it's old school. But so are we. 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

We've already written and recorded everything. It sounds fantastic. Fact. Perhaps the best we've ever done. Yeah, we know everyone says that. We're not Fleetwood Mac, but we did spend a lot of time and money (for Recliner) making it sound just right. We'd like you to be a part of it and give you something in return. Here's where your contributions will go:

  • Mixing / Mastering 
  • Vinyl pressing + CD pressing
  • T-shirts (what's a record release w/o a T-shirt?)
If we don't make our goal, well we'll do the best we can. The campaign isn't designed to come close to covering our costs. We just want to make some cool stuff on the backside for people like you to enjoy.

PERKS FOR EVERY CONTRIBUTOR

You won't be handing out money for nothing. in fact, right off the bat EVERY contributor will get an (almost) instant download of "A Recliner Primer" – digital selections from our catalogue over the years. And every contribution comes with another perk of your choosing–a record, CD, t-shirt  etc. Have a look at our the list of goodies to the right. PLUS, every contributor will be invited as a GUEST of RECLINER to our record release show in September or October! 
THE IMPACT

We've never done a campaign like this. But we've never made a record like this. We want to push these songs to as many people as we can. You're contribution will help us do that.

RISK. WHAT RISK?

There's no risk to you...other than not liking the record. But we sincerely doubt that. The risk to our band is that we don't raise any money, we look like idiots, and our music sits languishing on a hard drive. You can see it spiraling out of control from there. 

¡ GET THE WORD OUT !

Can't make a contribution? No problem. Help us spread the word. Pass this along to anyone you know. Every bit helps. Use the Indiegogo share tools or post a link to your Facebook, Pinterest, or Twitter. Heck, take an ad out in the paper. 

¡THANK YOU!

We've never done anything like this, and we're quite frankly nervous as hell to put it out there like this. It's would be easy to quietly print up a few copies, put it up on iTunes, etc. and call it a day. But we really feel this is a special record and want to share it with as many people as we can. Thanks for your support.

story:
Hi

Hi. My name is Rue. I write songs and play them for people, which is a pretty fantastic way to spend my time. We may have met at one of the 91 shows I played on the road last year. I've been recording and performing since 2012, honing my craft and getting in front of as many people as possible. I released an EP, "Losing Her," in 2012 then a full length album, "Alone Again Relax," in 2014.  I've been working on my second record, "Leaving To Returning" at Studio 76 in Brooklyn, NY one day a week for the last 8 months.  

Here's the deal

I've funded all my recording projects, including this record, myself. I bartend when I'm not on the road and pay for the studio time, engineer, and musicians out of pocket. Recently the well ran dry, just like California*. I need resources for the final mixing, mastering, and pressing. Also to pay some musicians who need to be compensated before the record comes out, art for the album, and initial promotion.

Why?

I remember growing up and waiting with feverish anticipation for records to come out by bands I loved. Sometimes I would go to midnight sales and wait in line to be the first to buy the record. I would be like a kid on Christmas morning the entire drive home and when I got there I would play my new music all night even though the sun was almost up. I imagine a lot of people have those kind of memories attached to their favorite songs and records. 

Midnight sales and record stores have mostly disappeared. Records and CDs have become more collectible artifacts than means of enjoying music. The dismantling of the music industry has made it much more difficult for songwriters to get their tunes into people's ears, which can be frustrating. 

Making records is achievable at an ultra-indie level nowadays because of technology, but that doesn't mean it's easy or affordable. The scarcest part of the equation is time, and it's what's needed most. Time to practice. Time to sit at home alone and book shows dreaming of a booking agent who is interested in helping. Time to write songs. Time to record. Time to make money to do all of the things that you need the time you're spending making money to do. It is a vicious circle.

Patronage used to work for artists. Real artists. Spectacular artists. The best who ever lived. Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, Shakespeare, Mozart, Beethoven, etc. etc. I'm not suggesting that my records should be in the same sentence as any of those people (I'm not Kanye). I'm saying very simply that some of the greatest art that exists wouldn't exist if people of means hadn't decided to support artists. Maybe, you want to be a patron of the arts. If you read this far hopefully it's not just for ammunition to make fun of me. (The first record I ever bought was "Soldiers Under Command" by Stryper. You're welcome.)

I love music. I love making records. I would be so pleased to have your help finishing this one.

* I know California didn't run out of water. But jokes about the environment are topical and play into liberal guilt AND conservative apathy. Think about helping me cure cancer. **
** My songs do not cure cancer.

story:
Hi there!

I’ve been an independent artist for the better part of last 6 years. I’ve made 2 albums and have toured across Canada numerous times, connecting with listeners through the sincerity and energy of my songs, but it's been a struggle financially to keep the wheels moving. Well now I’ve written 10 new songs that I believe are the best songs I’ve ever written and I whole-heartedly believe that making this new album would give me a real shot at reaching my wildest musical dreams. I can’t wait to get in the studio with producer Derek Downham (Serena Ryder, Kevin Drew) and engineer John Critchley (Elliot Brood, Dan Mangan)!

Making a professional album has it’s financial challenges and this is where I need your help! I’ve teamed up with Indiegogo to crowd fund this album and I want you guys along for the ride! Your contribution will go toward:

. Studio Rental/Engineer 

. Producer 

. Mixing  

. Mastering 

. Additional hired studio musicians

———————

Total: $20,000

There are lots of fun rewards for anyone who pre-orders the album including perks such as a personalized song written from me to you, a Skype guitar lesson, or hanging out in the studio during the making of the album! Check out the “Perks” section on the right! —>

I will be covering manufacturing and marketing costs and will be working hard with my team to create the most innovative ways to get the music along with videos to you, the listener and viewer! We will cover the following costs which will cost even more than the making of the album!

. Manufacturing 

. Music Video 

. Radio Promoter 

. Publicist 

Thanks for taking the time to read this. I will be posting regular video updates of this journey! It’s going to be a wild ride to say the least! 
If you can’t donate financially, please share this with a friend. I really appreciate all the support and look forward to creating something beautiful together! 

Sincerely, 

Freddie Mojallal / The Autumn Portrait

story:
I Think I'm Special (I.T.I.S) Entertainment’s solo artist KOJO STONE will have 9 electrifying performances during the Make Music New York, Summer Solstice extravaganza.

I.T.I.S Entertainment is a full-service entertainment company, inclusive of both performance and visual artists. Founder and CEO, Jazmin Sharelle McCain, serves clients by providing project management, consultations and artist bookings in order to support independent artist in creating a sustainable brand.

Jazmin and her team has taken a unique marketing approach by booking KOJO STONE for 9 shows, for the Make Music New York event- the most shows booked by any artist. In fact, there is a pending application for The Guinness World Records for most shows performed in New York City in one day!

In collaboration with Make Music New York, I.T.I.S Entertainment is harnessing this platform to introduce singer/songwriter KOJO STONE to the NYC area by creating innovative ways to enhance promotions and marketing. We have 9 performances booked with a full on creative entourage, including:

Personal Styling- Adryan Sterling 

Videography Services- Mickella Solutions

Photography Services- Timothy Smith    

Live Streaming- Mickella Solutions

Fitness & Stamina Training- JMW Home Fitness  

Press/Media Services- Drakeford PR

KOJO STONE will be playing live at the follow venues & times:

Bridge Plaza Community Garden 11:15 am – 11:30 am

Target Brooklyn Community Garden 12:00 am- 12:15 am

Willoughby Plaza 1:00 pm- 1:15 pm

Common Grounds: A Neighborhood Coffee House 1:45 pm- 2:00 pm

House of Art Gallery 2:45 pm – 3 pm

Dr. Ronald McNair Park 3:15 pm-3:30 pm

Muchmore’s 5:30 pm—6:00 pm

NiLu 6:30 pm-7:00 pm

The Mothership Connection at Bellevue Park 8:00 pm- 8:15 pm



CHARITABLE PARTNERS

Additionally, I.T.I.S Entertainment is a huge proponent of giving back!  In the vision of influencing communities through the arts, we have decided to donate to:

·  Mind-Builders.org  – A creative arts center that provides quality Music, Dance, Theater, Voice, and Martial Arts classes for 400 students a year.

http://www.mind-builders.org/

FUNDING
Through Indiegogo.com and personal contributions, we are asking for $5000 with 20% going directly to Mind-Builders.org  in order to supply equipment for their arts programs. After the cost of transportation and food has been reimbursed, the remaining balance will be divided up between all the team members who supplied there time and services to make this project come to life.

The successful execution of this event will change the landscape of the Make Music New York experience by changing the way in which Independent Artist both market and view themselves and the audience.  We hope to continuously support Indie Art by creating a culture of collaboration and brand development.

“Being an independent artist isn’t about competition but more about contributing to the art”- Kojo Stone

story:
Super Deluxe - new album!!!

Last time I asked for funds we made the video "Saraswati - a reggae tribute to the Goddess." This time we are making a whole album! We have some very special tracks recorded both in Delhi and Goa as well as here in Bali waiting for the final polish. I've already spent a lot of money out of my own pocket, but to make this album a reality I could need some help.

Super Deluxe made a big impact on the traveller scene in India in 2006 with the album "Best Quality" including the hits "Full Power" and "Connection" (Chai Chillum Chapati). Put together videos with songs from this album has more than 250 000 hits on YouTube.

The basic work has been done, but we need to add instruments and mix and master the lot. That takes time in studio, and studio time does not come for free even though it is much cheaper here than most places. Therefore, with the humble sum of 1200 dollars we can pretty much do the rest of the work.

We are currently working on a new version of "I love my life" as well as songs such as "Happy go lucky," "Decisive moment," "Mahadev" and "Sab kuch milega." Some of these songs have been my favourites for years and have been waiting to be recorded since 2006!! Other tracks are brand new like "This moment" and "After a high." Even with only the rough mix to listen to, I can safely say that this is the best music I have ever made. Help me get it out of the mixing room!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need money to finish this album
  • You will get all the music we've released so far, and some special perks if you help us a lot....
  • Whatever money we get will go to studio work, and if we don't get all we need at least we can release some of the songs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you have money to spend on this project or not, we would love some help sharing this campaign on Facebook, through mail and word of mouth. Most things we can't do on our own, and this is one of those things....we are all interconnected and all dependent on each other and that is beautiful!
story_txt:
Super Deluxe - new album!!!
 Last time I asked for funds we made the video "Saraswati - a reggae tribute to the Goddess." This time we are making a whole album! We have some very special tracks recorded both in Delhi and Goa as well as here in Bali waiting for the final polish. I've already spent a lot of money out of my own pocket, but to make this album a reality I could need some help. Super Deluxe made a big impact on the traveller scene in India in 2006 with the album "Best Quality" including the hits "Full Power" and "Connection" (Chai Chillum Chapati). Put together videos with songs from this album has more than 250 000 hits on YouTube. The basic work has been done, but we need to add instruments and mix and master the lot. That takes time in studio, and studio time does not come for free even though it is much cheaper here than most places. Therefore, with the humble sum of 1200 dollars we can pretty much do the rest of the work.We are currently working on a new version of "I love my life" as well as songs such as "Happy go lucky," "Decisive moment," "Mahadev" and "Sab kuch milega." Some of these songs have been my favourites for years and have been waiting to be recorded since 2006!! Other tracks are brand new like "This moment" and "After a high." Even with only the rough mix to listen to, I can safely say that this is the best music I have ever made. Help me get it out of the mixing room!
  What We Need & What You Get  We need money to finish this album You will get all the music we've released so far, and some special perks if you help us a lot.... Whatever money we get will go to studio work, and if we don't get all we need at least we can release some of the songs.    Other Ways You Can Help Whether you have money to spend on this project or not, we would love some help sharing this campaign on Facebook, through mail and word of mouth. Most things we can't do on our own, and this is one of those things....we are all interconnected and all dependent on each other and that is beautiful!

story:
Short Summary

The Greek young metallers Simplefast are about to record their new album.If you can help us,we will appreciate it very much and we will reward you.So if you can spare some money check below for details!

But first some introduction facts for someone not familiar with our work or who we are:

1) Simplefast is a thrash/heavy  metal band from Athens,Greece formed in late 2011.          

2) In 2014 we self-released our debut album ''Cursed'' in a CD Format and via all of digital stores(Spotify,Rdio,Google Play etc.) . 

3) Our debut album got great critics from webzines,fanzines and magazines with an average score of 90/100. 

4) We are more active than ever regarding live performances and we have metalized all around Athens(our hometown) and we are getting ready to metalize the rest of Greece in the next few months.

What We Need & What You Get

We need that amount of money for just do the recordings of our new album.
So we ask for the minimum money that the site makes available.
Your money, is very important  for us to know, that they are safe and we will not use them for another reason.
We are greatful in advance for every donation, and we ll try to show that to you by providing some perks for every donation made.

Risks & Challenges

  • Simplefast is first of all a family and then a band.So there isn't any risk.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can share it to social media that's a great help to us too.

story:
Welcome to San Francisco’s Jerry Garcia Amphitheater, This outdoor amphitheater in John McLaren Park has been here for 44 years. In 2005 we named it after our local neighbor, a boy who used to play here and became the legendary guitar player of the Grateful Dead --Jerry Garcia. The first San Francisco Blues Festival was here, too. The park setting is beautiful; the acoustics are excellent; this is a perfect stage for musicians, dancers and artists to perform.

Sadly, except for one or two concerts each year, the Jerry Garcia Amphitheater sits empty. Why?

Free concerts cost money. Even though this beautiful outdoor stage sits in the city's 2nd largest park, a single concert costs from $3,000 for a small gathering to $60,000 or more a day. These special events must pay for use permit fees, security, sound and production help, flyers, social & public media and the performers.

In 2013 & 2014 Friends of the AMP presented 13 free concerts. Called “Saturday in the Park McLaren” it was the first ever music series held in the Jerry Garcia Amphitheater. It was professionally produced, family-friendly, free to attend, and open to all. It showcased local San Francisco and Bay Area musical talent of all styles and abilities.

Imagine a community that keeps this underused stage busy, with art, music, youth and children shows and offers the music community a place to perform at an affordable rate year after year.

That’s where YOU come in.

Come join our community. Help us fund an annual concert series which builds on itself, and becomes a self-sustaining free San Francisco event that everyone can enjoy.

story:
Howdy. If you're reading this, chances are you're already a fan or friend, so I won't tell you too much about myself. I will tell you I've been a full time professional musician (lead player, singer, writer, tour manager, midnight to 6 AM driver) for over thirteen years. I'm based in Austin, Texas but I often tour the USA and Europe. Most of my creative energy goes toward writing and recording my own original songs, but this time I've decided to pay tribute to one of my favorite heroes of country music, the great Lefty Frizzell.

I released my latest solo album in 2009. Due to high overhead and a rigorous touring schedule, I haven't been able to come up with funds to finish anything new since then. To be honest, until now my pride has kept me from reaching out to fans for support. 

Below is an approximate breakdown of costs to record the entire album. You might notice the highest dollar amount will be going to the musicians. It looks like a lot when you add it all together, but in my opinion they're the most important part of any album project. It is imperative they get paid fairly. I look forward to experiencing the unfolding the of this project with my bandmates, who have given me so much of themselves over the years, have encouraged me even when my ideas were crazy, and who have enthusiastically put in extra hours for me many times when they probably just needed to go home and sleep. For this project, every track will have the usual bass (electric or upright) and drums.  Our lovely rhythm section will be Brad Fordham and Lisa Pankratz, Noel McKay will be lending guitar skills, and T Jerrod Bonta will be playing piano.  I also plan to include a lot of fiddle and steel (lap and pedal) and a few other nice surprises.

These numbers are based on past projects I've done and are by no means exact:

Studio time and engineer fee: $1500
Musician pay: $4000
Radio Promoter fee: $2500
Postage for radio mail outs: $700
Artwork and photography: $600

story:
Short Summary:

We've started this campaign because we need your help funding our first demo! We've been a band for a little over a year now, and we've been working hard every day to prepare songs that are sure to make you bang your head; We know you won't be disappointed. Helping us achieve this goal would mean the world to us, and it would help us take the band to a whole new level, so please donate what you can! We are set to record with Mayhemness Studios in Sacramento, CA on April 12th.


What We Need & What You Get:

We're asking for 2,000$ to help fund the recording/mixing/mastering process. All proceeds we make will go into making the demo as great as it can be. We have plenty of unique perks that won't be available anywhere else as our way of sayings thanks, so check them out!

Other Ways You Can Help: 

If you can't make a donation, please try to spread the word about our campaign, we can't do it without you!

story:
#FFGent Alan Silvestri album 


Alan Silvestri is the central guest of the 15th edition of the World Soundtrack Awards on 24 October 2015. Film Fest Gent annually releases an album with work the main guest of the #WSAwards. So this year we are honoured to be releasing Silvestri’s best known scores from Back to the Future, Forrest Gump, Night at the Museum and many others on this unique and exclusive compilation album. 


The World Soundtrack Awards is honoured to be inviting Alan Silvestri, one of the most multifaceted and contemporary composers who has shown great mastery in multiple genres ranging from the subtle tunes in Forrest Gump to the sweet music of The Polar Express and his roller coaster driven soundtrack for Back to the Future. His outstanding creativity has been celebrated internationally and he has won 37 awards and has been nominated for another 32. By selecting his best work, our album will offer the best possible idea of the importance of symphonic scoring in American Cinema and and oversight of Silvestri’s grand career.

                Who are we?


 The World Soundtrack Academy (WSAwards) was launched in 2001 by Film Fest Gent and with its 15th anniversary coming up on 24 October 2015, we're very excited to be launching this album containing a balanced selection of Alan Silvestri’s best film scores!

Over the years the WSAwards has successfully shined a spotlight on both established and up and coming film music composers and have promote their work worldwide not only by showcasing their work a the annual event but also by releasing their unique albums. 

As always we will be collaborating with the acclaimed Brussels Philharmonic  and the Flemish Radio Choir conducted by music director Dirk Brossé. We are looking for your extra funds so that Silvestri's impressive scores can be performed and recorded in the best possible ways. So just like Marty needs Doc to get Back To The Future in the eponymous film, so do we need you and your help to achieve our goals because 'where we are going, we don’t need roads!' 

The next clip will give you an idea of what #WSAwards and its community stand for. It was shot during the 13th #WSAwards (Oct 2013), starring Alexandre Desplat, Riz Ortolani, Brussels Philharmonic, music director Dirk Brossé and artistic director Patrick Duynslaegher.

#ffgent & #WSAwards

- our digital presentation: http://presentation.filmfestival.be/en/film-music-events
- our websites: www.worldsoundtrackawards.com & www.filmfestival.be

     

         Why fund this album? 

  • The importance of film music is easily forgotten

Although film music enhances the expressive power of film, it's one of the trades in the business that doesn't always gets the credit it deserves. With the WSAwards we aim at giving film music composers the international attention they deserve. By means of an album with Silvestri's best-known scores, performed by the distinguished Brussels Philharmonic and the Flemish Radio Choir, we intend to celebrate his impressive musical career. 

  • Compilation albums of film music dedicated to one composer 

As we have already created similar albums dedicated to and with scores by Angelo Badalamenti, Gabriel Yared, Craig Armstrong, Mychael Danna, Howard Shore, Cliff Martinez and Shigeru Umebayashi, we are convinced that a grand maestro as Silvestri, who has already written scores for over 100 films also deserves an album that is dedicated to the many highlights of his extensive career!

  • You want this album in your collection 

Who can resist an album with Silvestri’s scores for Forrest Gump, Back to the Future, Death Becomes Her, Cast Away,The Polar Express and many more?

  How will my donation be used? 

Thanks to your support, we will be able to cover a part of our essential operating expenses and record Silvestri’s marvellous scores performed by a superb orchestra and an excellent choir. With your funding, you will contribute to the jubilee-edition of the World Soundtrack Awards and help it thrive even more. 

                   Be to us what Doc is to Marty! 

             Sharing = Caring 

If you cannot support us financially but you want to help either way, do help to create a buzz around our project by sharing and liking it on social media such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Youtube and tag us with #filmfestalbum #ffgent & #WSAwards.

story:
Hello Folks,

we are the Band "Oscar and the Peak Prices" and we just recorded our debut album. This is a big story for us and two of our bandmembers even founded their own recording studio in the process of our band recordings.

We did all we could to make this happen, but now we need some financial help, to take the last hurdle on the way to our debut album. We would be very thankful, if you could help us out. For that reason we created this campain, where you can preorder our cd, so that we can pay the pressing of the cds.

We`d like to do 300 pieces in nice little cases and some artwork. The pressing will cost 590 € and the rest of the money would be for the artwork.

If we reach the goal of the campain, we can do the amount of 300 pieces. If we don´t reach the goal, we´ll find some way to produce a smaller amount so we can send the music to you anyways.

One nice side effect if we reach the goal is, that this cd pressing will help the new foundet recording studio of our two band members to acquire a label code, so they can release music f.ex. on streaming sites.

If you can´t afford to help us in a financial way, don´t worry. You can still share this campain with friends and family. That would be so cool.

Thanks to all of you out there *OPP*
