story:
￼Hello World, Friends, and Fans of Detroit Techno,

This is an opportunity for you to help progress the advancement of technology dealing with audio/visual & multimedia arts presentations.

I am Juan Atkins (aka) “The God Father of Techno music” this title was given to me by Face magazine & Record Mirror from London in a feature story they acquired when coming to Detroit in 1989 to cover this new and exciting music that was catching on in London called techno. And, because I am the originator of the music genre called “Techno music” which is the precursor to what we now call Electronic Dance Music (EDM) today.

I started my professional music career with an electronic synth band called Cybotron, which is a group formed in 1980 by myself and Rik Davis (aka) 3070. Cybotron released America’s first all electronic dance music record called “Alleys of your mind” on our own label “Deep Space Records”. The record was a smash hit in Detroit which subsequently led to a national record deal with Fantasy records out of Berkeley California. Cybotron released an album with Fantasy and 2 singles from the album “Cosmic cars” and “Clear” which became international hits and put me on the path to become known worldwide as the “Originator” of techno music.

I left Cybotron in 1985, because of musical differences between me and Rik, and started to record and release music under the name “Model 500”, on my own label “Metroplex Records” that I both created. I have been recording and performing live as Model 500 ever since. Thus, I have honed and developed Model 500 into a global brand and international icon for electronic music with no help from anywhere. Needless to say, it has been hard work and a financial challenge to achieve all this with no support other than you electronic music lovers,fans & patrons.

Technology has recently changed the landscape of virtually everything we see and hear now, so it’s time and imperative that Model 500 stay on the cutting edge and ahead of the curve in terms of how the new progression of audio/visual multimedia live shows are presented and perceived. Basically, moving Model 500 into the next level of live presentations.

So as you know, Model 500 will be playing live at Movement 2015 in a few weeks. Because of the City of Detroit’s relevance in the world of dance music, I want to make this year’s performance, and future performances, a show that you will never forget, and bringing Model 500 to the next level. With that said, I have some ideas marinating in the Metroplex laboratories to make these shows the most cutting-edge and memorable performances I’ve ever done in my 35 years in this business. To do it, however, it’s going to cost me a lot of money, around $50,000. But, an out of pocket expense for me to spend that much money, that we can’t really afford to float right now, doesn’t make much business sense, I am told by my advisors. So I’m reaching out to all of you to say, if you want to truly experience Model 500 as it should be experienced, and make a contribution towards the advancement of forward thinking technological music & art, then let’s do it together Detroit and fans across the world. This will be the show you won’t ever forget. Juan


Budget forecast for Model 500 multimedia live show

1) 5.1 3D sound system for 2500 capacity =                                              $15,000

2) 3D visual production + content  =                                                            $10,000

3) Lighting =                                                                                                          $5000

4) Staff/technical support, transportation, catering, lodging=          $15,000

 5) Misc. expenses/ incidentals, etc.                                                            $ 5000    

                                                                                                             __________________ 

                                                                                                       Total Budget  $50,000

Perks

Option 1) $100 contributors will receive one (1) free admission pass to any Model 500 live performance. $200 will get you two (2) free admission passes, and so on.  

Option 2) $500 contributors will receive two (2) VIP, all access, and backstage passes to any Model 500 live performance. $1000 contributors will receive four (4) of the same, as described above, and so on.

Please bare in mind that general admission tickets to Model 500 live will not be cheap after the 3D audio/visual upgrade. The options above, should you decide to partake, will definitely be a discount compared to what you will normally pay as general public after the upgrade.

Option 3). Any contributor willing to contribute $5,000 or more will be entitled to share in a percentage of  the fees earned from all Model 500 live performances for the the next two (2) years. Prior to making a contribution under this Option 3, the contributor should contact us via email to discuss, and negotiate this arrangement. All negotiations under this Option 3 shall remain private between both parties. 

In the unlikely event that our goal is not met by the time outlined herein. Funds already collected will remain frozen in our account, unless a contributor request a return, until we eventually reach our goal, which we have every confidence in doing. We have to.

Thank you all in advance,

The Impact

This is an opportunity for you to help progress the advancement of technology dealing with audio/visual & multimedia arts presentations.

We will aim to use the latest technology available to implement this progression in 3D audio/visual presentations. Thereby, demonstrating to the world, on a level everyone can understand, how technology is moving forward in terms of how we experience new, innovative, evolutionary, advanced, and spectacular, multimedia presentations. 

Brand new innovations. Brand new ideas. Changes all around us. The future is here.

Detroit. 1985. It begins. Post-industrial revolution, Detroit crumbles as businesses close and its motor industry implodes – but from its decaying streets the sound of the future is born when genuine human spirit becomes entwined with technology to prevail in the face of economic decline. After the split of his group Cybotron Juan Atkins utilizes the synthesizer technology at his hands to usher in a new wave of electronic music. Inspired by the novels of Alvin Toffler, Juan sets about creating a futuristic electronic soundscape and names this new sound techno. There is no doubt about my experiences, to help bring this evolution of technology into fruition. 

AS A LIVE PERFORMER, AUDIENCES OFTEN WONDER WHY IT'S SO EXPENSIVE TO ATTEND EVENTS.  WHEN YOU CONSIDER THE COSTS TO TRAVEL, ACCOMMODATIONS, BEING AWAY FROM FAMILY, YOU CAN SEE THINGS ADD UP.  I WANT TO GIVE MY AUDIENCES THE BEST EXPERIENCE POSSIBLE AND WHEN FOLKS DON'T SEE HOW MUCH A PIECE OF AUDIO OR VISUAL EQUIPMENT COST, THEY JUST ASSUME THE PERFORMER CAN "AFFORD IT."  I'M ALL ABOUT OPENNESS AND HONESTY, AS WELL AS GIVING IT MY ALL FOR PEOPLE WHO ARE PAYING TO SEE ME PLAY.  THIS IS THE FIRST TIME I'VE EVER REACHED OUT LIKE THIS BECAUSE I THINK THIS IS SOMETHING THE WORLD WOULD WANT TO EXPERIENCE AND YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL ONLY BACK ME UP ON THAT.  

I'M SPENDING A LOT OF MY OWN MONEY ON VARIOUS ELEMENTS OF THE MODEL 500 SHOW, I ALWAYS HAVE.  BUT WHEN I SEE SOMETHING GROUNDBREAKING AND REALIZE THERE'S THE RISK THAT I COULD BE BANKROLLING SOMETHING THAT I'M THE ONLY ONE THAT THINKS IS IMPORTANT, IT MAKES ME WONDER. DO THE FANS FEEL THE SAME WAY ABOUT THIS AS I DO?  THAT IS WHY I AM MAKING THIS PUBLIC REQUEST. HELP ME PROVE THAT I AM RIGHT ABOUT CONTINUING TO PUSH THE ENVELOPE AND CHANGE THE WORLD THROUGH LIVE MUSIC EVENTS.

If you can't contribute financially? No worries, you can still help by spreading the word about our campaign, and you can use the Indiegogo share tools.
PS: IT IS A CHALLENGE, TO GO THIS ROUTE BECAUSE THE POWERS THAT BE WILL NOT SUPPORT AN URBAN AMERICAN ARTIST NOT TALKING ABOUT MURDER,SELLING DRUGS&STRIP CLUBS!  

THANK YOU

JUAN ATKINS/MODEL 500
story_txt:
￼Hello World, Friends, and Fans of Detroit Techno,
This is an opportunity for you to help progress the advancement of technology dealing with audio/visual & multimedia arts presentations.
I am Juan Atkins (aka) “The God Father of Techno music” this title was given to me by Face magazine & Record Mirror from London in a feature story they acquired when coming to Detroit in 1989 to cover this new and exciting music that was catching on in London called techno. And, because I am the originator of the music genre called “Techno music” which is the precursor to what we now call Electronic Dance Music (EDM) today.
I started my professional music career with an electronic synth band called Cybotron, which is a group formed in 1980 by myself and Rik Davis (aka) 3070. Cybotron released America’s first all electronic dance music record called “Alleys of your mind” on our own label “Deep Space Records”. The record was a smash hit in Detroit which subsequently led to a national record deal with Fantasy records out of Berkeley California. Cybotron released an album with Fantasy and 2 singles from the album “Cosmic cars” and “Clear” which became international hits and put me on the path to become known worldwide as the “Originator” of techno music.
I left Cybotron in 1985, because of musical differences between me and Rik, and started to record and release music under the name “Model 500”, on my own label “Metroplex Records” that I both created. I have been recording and performing live as Model 500 ever since. Thus, I have honed and developed Model 500 into a global brand and international icon for electronic music with no help from anywhere. Needless to say, it has been hard work and a financial challenge to achieve all this with no support other than you electronic music lovers,fans & patrons.
Technology has recently changed the landscape of virtually everything we see and hear now, so it’s time and imperative that Model 500 stay on the cutting edge and ahead of the curve in terms of how the new progression of audio/visual multimedia live shows are presented and perceived. Basically, moving Model 500 into the next level of live presentations.
So as you know, Model 500 will be playing live at Movement 2015 in a few weeks. Because of the City of Detroit’s relevance in the world of dance music, I want to make this year’s performance, and future performances, a show that you will never forget, and bringing Model 500 to the next level. With that said, I have some ideas marinating in the Metroplex laboratories to make these shows the most cutting-edge and memorable performances I’ve ever done in my 35 years in this business. To do it, however, it’s going to cost me a lot of money, around $50,000. But, an out of pocket expense for me to spend that much money, that we can’t really afford to float right now, doesn’t make much business sense, I am told by my advisors. So I’m reaching out to all of you to say, if you want to truly experience Model 500 as it should be experienced, and make a contribution towards the advancement of forward thinking technological music & art, then let’s do it together Detroit and fans across the world. This will be the show you won’t ever forget. Juan
   
Budget forecast for Model 500 multimedia live show
1) 5.1 3D sound system for 2500 capacity =                                              $15,000
2) 3D visual production + content  =                                                            $10,000
3) Lighting =                                                                                                          $5000
4) Staff/technical support, transportation, catering, lodging=          $15,000
 5) Misc. expenses/ incidentals, etc.                                                            $ 5000    
                                                                                                             __________________ 
                                                                                                       Total Budget  $50,000


Perks


Option 1) $100 contributors will receive one (1) free admission pass to any Model 500 live performance. $200 will get you two (2) free admission passes, and so on.  


Option 2) $500 contributors will receive two (2) VIP, all access, and backstage passes to any Model 500 live performance. $1000 contributors will receive four (4) of the same, as described above, and so on.


Please bare in mind that general admission tickets to Model 500 live will not be cheap after the 3D audio/visual upgrade. The options above, should you decide to partake, will definitely be a discount compared to what you will normally pay as general public after the upgrade.


Option 3). Any contributor willing to contribute $5,000 or more will be entitled to share in a percentage of  the fees earned from all Model 500 live performances for the the next two (2) years. Prior to making a contribution under this Option 3, the contributor should contact us via email to discuss, and negotiate this arrangement. All negotiations under this Option 3 shall remain private between both parties. 


In the unlikely event that our goal is not met by the time outlined herein. Funds already collected will remain frozen in our account, unless a contributor request a return, until we eventually reach our goal, which we have every confidence in doing. We have to.


Thank you all in advance,


The Impact
 This is an opportunity for you to help progress the advancement of technology dealing with audio/visual & multimedia arts presentations.


We will aim to use the latest technology available to implement this progression in 3D audio/visual presentations. Thereby, demonstrating to the world, on a level everyone can understand, how technology is moving forward in terms of how we experience new, innovative, evolutionary, advanced, and spectacular, multimedia presentations. 
Brand new innovations. Brand new ideas. Changes all around us. The future is here.

story:
Hey guys, I'm in the studio today recording covers for Monday and Wednesday new video releases on my Youtube... https://www.youtube.com/user/macykatemusic

FRANZ! It's Macy Kate! I am a pop rock artist from St. Petersburg, Florida. I am confident that the years of maturing and growing have helped me to create the sound that I have developed and want to share with you today. You all have been apart of this journey from the beginning and have been growing with me. That is honestly amazing to me. So this is all for YOUUU!

If you are new to the family, my music is pure Macy Kate. I believe it will speak to you, for you, and with you and will add something meaningful for everyone involved.

 I will be partnering with Indie Gogo, who is reinventing the record label for artists like me. A firm that is reinventing the business model for raising funds by helping me connect with my fans, allowing me to raise funds to tour to my fans for live performances, engage in community service and support and help me to create awareness of our beautiful country through travel.


Being on Vans Warped Tour has ALWAYS been a dream of mine! Soooo many of my favorite artists and bands have been on this tour. From Fallout Boy, and Paramore to Katy Perry!!! Like whaaaaa?!?! With all of your tweets and posts about Macy Kate being on Warped Tour..... WE FINALLY DID IT! I am officially a Vans Warped Tour 2015 performer. MAMA WE MADE IT! All thanks to your support.


Indie Gogo is an amazing way to connect me with you guys and help support this project.


With every donation there are different perks! This is a way for me to get closer to you. Whether it may be a t-shirt, a wristband, a poster, or even a Skype call, a BUS TOUR HANGOUT WITH ME, or exclusive video, songs, or photos!!


Every donation counts! With your help we will be able to not only be best friends, but also help the community and ones in need!


I am running a campaign to raise funds to support my music, live performances for a Vans Warped Tour Bus as well as reach our communities in need of help through food bank donations! We can do this! I know it!

I hope you will join me  in the realization of the creative exploration of this concept. #TeamMK

story:
NEEDS OF THE MANY

 We've been given a once in a lifetime opportunity to be coached and produced by John Moyer of Disturbed. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

 We don't just need your money we need your voice! Like and Share this with your friends on social media networks. Every little bit helps!

The Impact

The music business is a very hard business to break into. Helping us get this album produced ensures more success for Unconfined. PERIOD. The doors that will open could be endless.  

We have plenty of momentum going already. We have broken records on the 96.5 ZRock cage match(Lewiston, ID). We have opened for national acts such as Orgy, Steel Panther, Bleeding Through, and more.

So we are moving forward...but now we need your help more than ever.

Risks & Challenges

This is a once in a life time opportunity.

The chance to have the door is opened to us to record with a multi-platinum selling artist. All we need now is a little help (from our friends) ;]  

Our only real risk is not meeting our goal; so without you, this ISN'T possible.

We realize this is a lot of money to ask for, but with YOUR help, it IS possible.  

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Share with all your friends!!! Get them a copy too! Invite them to a show!

Indiegogo has multiple sharing tools to make it easy to help us!!!

www.facebook.com/weareunconfined

www.twitter.com/unconfinedmusic

story:
Hi! My name is Owen Robinette and I'm currently a student at Lafayette College. I’ve had a serious passion for music for my entire life– I learned to read and write listening to John Lennon and The Beatles, and music has been an integral part of my life ever since. To me, music is a way into another person’s mind and a way to express your thoughts and opinions. That expression of feelings is what I love most about music, because you can use it to cheer you up, to keep you going, etc. It helps to create and build a connection that with someone you've never met before.

Because of my deep love for music, I began to develop an interest in the industry. In the Hip-Hop genre, I began to notice the oversaturation of new music and new artists, which meant few got recognition or compensation for their work, let alone record deals. Basically, even if the product artists had to offer was both genuine and high-quality, most artists were going unnoticed. It made me want to create a space for artists to freely express their voice while gaining both recognition and compensation for their art. And thus, Royal Dynasty was born.

The goal of Royal Dynasty is to provide artists with the ability to create the music they want, while being compensated in a way that promotes their own creative independence. We will split the profits 50-50 with the artist, something that no other company in the music industry does. Most importantly, we hope to better connect artists with their fans. Music builds connections- imagine how impactful it could be if we work to build and strengthen those bonds. Royal Dynasty will provide a more immersive, open experience for fans of growing artists and focus on the heart of music. By utilizing a pay-what-you-want model for purchasing music, combined with a tiered system of rewards, fans have the opportunity not only to support their favorite upcoming artists, but to participate in personal, meaningful interactions with the artists they enjoy.

To do this, we need your help!

In order to begin this project, we need startup money to buy the website domain and software, as well as pay a designer to develop the site. We are seeking to utilize WordPress’ business site plan, which costs $300 a year and provides many of the features we would need to run an effective (and awesome) website.

Finally, we need money to build up inventory. This allows us to attract artists and send out awesome rewards (such as the ones we’ve offered for this IndieGoGo campaign). A list of our current ideas are listed below, and we are always looking for new ways to connect our artists with fans in a meaningful, impactful way.

Our Mission:

Hip-Hop music which is popular today tends to stray from the genre’s original intentions. While it is still alive in a few artists (such as Kendrick Lamar, J-Cole, Run the Jewels, Big K.R.I.T.), it appears that the days of political storytelling are fading away. As a result, artists tend to lose some control over their music and their message, feeling the need to conform to what’s popular in order to make it big.

Because of this phenomenon, one of our core goals is to create an organization which provides artists with agency within their craft. This includes providing more compensation so that artists have more control over their creative material. Artists we have selected have a unique sound and message, and we wish to enhance an artist’s style rather than stifle it. Basically, we want artists to be able to create quality music without interference from corporations who only care about the bottom line. Instead, Royal Dynasty would offer a supportive community composed of artists and music lovers that can provide thoughtful feedback and guidance.Together, this combination of artistic independence and guidance will result in an overall higher quality of music.

And, of course, Royal Dynasty wants to provide fans with an immersive experience the likes of which has never been seen before. Fans will have unique opportunities to interact with artists from discussions with the featured artists of the week and a pay-what-you-want model for purchasing music. All artists will have their music available for streaming on the site, so those fans who prefer not to pay can still easily access all music. Once again, all advertising revenue that comes from streaming will be split 50-50 between the artists and Royal Dynasty. However, for those fans who wish to support their favorite artist by purchasing music, there will be multiple reward tiers. Not only will this directly benefit artists, but the rewards will allow fans to connect with their artists. As a music fan, this kind of program is something I’ve always wanted- it makes music that much more personal.

The tiers will vary based at the discretion of the artists. Rewards will include, but not be limited to:

■  The MP3 of the album (comes with any level of purchase)

■  Desktop wallpapers/CD covers

■  Posters (Some Autographed)

■  Awesome buttons

■  A T-shirt/Hoodie (Some autographed)

■  A signed CD (Printed with booklet and case, in addition to the MP3s which come with all purchases)

■  A handwritten letter from the artist

■  A Skype call with the artist

And this is just the beginning. We look forward to the feedback of both artists and fans so that we can ensure we’re offering the best experience for everyone. We’ll be communicating with you, which includes a weekly newsletter to keep you updated on any new developments. In addition, we will have an active customer service line dedicated to questions and comments from the site’s users. We can’t wait to offer you a unique music experience and want to hear your thoughts throughout the process!

More ways you can help!

Even if you can’t monetarily contribute to the project, there are still many other ways that you can help us succeed! If you like the idea, spread the word! Post this on your Facebook, Twitter, and use Indiegogo’s share tools!

We would also love feedback and suggestions for future features. Like we said, feedback from fans is key to providing an excellent product. We are open to discussing any and all suggestions, and, if it’s a good one, you could even be featured on the site.

Finally, if you or a friend is an upcoming artist in any genre (while our focus is Hip-Hop, we hope to expand our reach to other genres as well) contact us at royaldynastyincorporated@gmail.com and send in your work! While we can’t promise you a spot on the site when we launch, we are always willing to offer our feedback and remain in contact as you progress as an artist.

story:
Sills & Smith, led by Ottawa singer-songwriters Jeremy Sills and Frank Smith,  has independently released four studio albums of music that boldly blend and bend elements of folk, alternative rock, progressive rock, blues and even jazz. On the heels of their critically acclaimed album "Etched" they are poised to re-enter the studio with legendary producer Phillip Victor Bova (Bova Sound) to record 13 powerful, melodic original songs; their boldest musical adventure to date. But they need a little help to support the costs of the new album "Echoes In Time" that will be released in October, 2015.

The beauty of this campaign is that depending on the level of support, donors will receive a gift of music -- the new album and previous recordings by Sills & Smith. Funds raised will assist with costs of studio time, musicians' session work and the production of the digipak CD edition.

"Echoes in Time" will feature a stellar cast of players, with the core group: Jeremy Sills (music, vocals, guitars, piano, crystal bowls); Frank Smith (words/music, vocals); Phillip Victor Bova (producer, bass), T. Bruce Wittet (drums/percussion). Brilliant supporting musicians include:  Kevin Breit - electric guitars (at his studio in Guelph), Blair Michael Hogan - electric guitars, Roddy Ellias - guitars, Jim McDowell - Hammond, synth, Wurlitzer, Don Wallace - electric guitars, Linsey Wellman - saxophones, Tara Holloway - vocals.

Grace Smith will provide her amazing, beautiful photographic art and graphic design skills to create a full colour, four panel digipak CD edition of the album.

"Sills & Smith are an alternative rock band based out of Ottawa who released their fourth full-length record, Etched, in August 2014. If you like intelligent, folk-influenced alternative rock in the vein of The Tragically Hip, then the 13 eclectic tracks that make up Etched will be a perfect fit for you."  - Lisa Fiorilli, Confront Magazine (Apr 29, 2015)

"Sills & Smith are joined by various musicians who contribute dobro, mandolin, drums, cello and other instruments. Collectively, the songs on Etched rock less than they roll. But this is still the DIY group's most accomplished and memorable album. (4/5 stars)" - Michael Popke, Sea of Tranquility (Apr 04, 2015)

Sills & Smith have made Etched an obvious labour of love, and this effort permeates the entire album." Tristin Norenberg-Goodmanson, Earshot - The National Campus Community Radio Report (Feb 27, 2015)

“This Ottawa band is growing by leaps and bounds with each new song. Living On An Island - Sounds like: A plea.” - Larry Lootsteen, Alan Cross - A Journal of Musical Things (Dec 11, 2013)

“These guys deserve some attention and are contributing to a renaissance of sorts in Ottawa’s ever changing music scene.” - Chris Saracino, Standard Media music blog (Aug 19, 2013)

“On The Glorious Ache, Sills & Smith have stepped up their game in all of the right ways. From a more cohesive track order to increased utilization of vocal harmonies and less traditional song structure, Frank Smith and Jeremy Sills are finding a sound that’s truly all their own, with the multi-instrumental and production talents of Jonathan Edwards on hand.”  - Amber Waves, Open 'Til Midnight (Sep 04, 2013)

Sills
& Smith, led by Ottawa singer-songwriters Jeremy Sills and Frank
Smith,  has independently released four
studio albums of music that boldly blend and bend elements of folk, alternative
rock, progressive rock, blues and even jazz. On the heels of their critically
acclaimed album "Etched" they are poised to re-enter the studio with
legendary producer Phillip Victor Bova (Bova Sound) to record 13 powerful,
melodic original songs; their boldest musical adventure to date. But they need a little help to support the costs of the
new album "Echoes In Time" that will be released in October, 2015.

The
beauty of this campaign is that depending on the level of support, donors will
receive a gift of music -- the new album and previous recordings by Sills &
Smith. Funds raised will assist with costs of studio time, musicians' session
work and the production of the digipak CD edition.
"Echoes
in Time" will feature a stellar cast of players, with the core group:
Jeremy Sills (music, vocals, guitars, piano, crystal bowls); Frank Smith (words/music,
vocals); Phillip Victor Bova (producer, bass), T. Bruce Wittet (drums/percussion).

story:
Summary

Hi, my name is Andy Qunta. I'm best known for playing keyboards with Australian
band Icehouse, with hits like Electric Blue & Crazy, which I helped to write, &
John Farnham's hit You're the Voice, which I also co-wrote, but before all that,
back in the '70's, I was in a band from Hastings, England, called Factory, with
my brother Tony on lead guitar & electric violin, drummer Laurie Cooksey &
original bassist Geoff Peckham, who eventually left & was succeeded by Steve
Kinch, who is now a member of MMEB. Factory had a reputation as a great live
band. We played all over the UK & opened for many of the top bands of the day.
Roger Daltrey of The Who heard about us & invited us to his home studio many
times, & came to see us play, so I think we were pretty good!
BUT there are 2 things we never got to do - 1, make an album & 2, get a video of our live show. So last year, 34 years after Factory broke up, the 4 original members got back together to finally achieve those 2 goals. This October we're going into the
studio to record an album of our original songs, & on Friday 16th October we're
playing a gig at The Carlisle in our old hometown of Hastings, which will be
professionally filmed! What a great come-back story, right? We've put a deposit
down on the studio time, but we are looking for some support to help complete
the project.

What We Need & What You Get

We're aiming to raise $12000, about 8000 GBP, or 17000 AUD. Studio costs are
about 50% of that, costs relating to videoing the gig 20%, 10% for travel expenses. That leaves 20% for mastering the album, producing sleeve & artwork for CD & DVD, & pressing copies ready for sale. We also have to pay for the hire of the sound and lighting companies for the live gig, which we are promoting ourselves If we have anything left, it will be used for promotion. We hope to get a distribution company involved, & hopefully an agent to get us some gigs wherever we would be welcomed!

Perks:

For your donation of $25US or more (approx 16GBP, 34AUD)
we will send you a CD copy of the finished album, and a thank you note!

For your donation of $50US or more (approx 32GBP, 68AUD) we will send you, in
addition to the finished CD & thank you note, a copy of the live gig
video!

For your donation of $100US or more (approx 65GBP, 138 AUD) we will
send you a CD copy of the finished album, plus the copy of the live gig video, &
both of these will be personally signed by all four band members. In addition we
will print your name in the credits on both the CD & the live gig video
packaging! We will also send you a specially designed Factory T-shirt, and car
sticker. As an added bonus, we will give you a free ticket the next time you
want to come to one of our gigs. (Right now, we only have the one gig in
Hastings, but if you can't make that one, the offer stands for one of our future
shows!)

The Impact

Factory's songs feature a high standard of musicianship and great
vocals. Their songs are very varied, covering everything from melodic rock to
folk-rock to prog-rock to heavy rock, with some rocked-up Irish jigs for good
measure! Something for everyone! They are well-known for their high-energy,
all-action live shows, presented with liberal doses of tongue-in-cheek humor!
You're going to love it!

Risks & Challenges

If we don't reach our goal, we will find a way to cover the shortfall ourselves. We've come this far, we're not going to be put off now!

Other Ways You Can Help

"Like" Us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Factory/677552145651766?fref=ts

story:
Some info about Giant Head Collective..
Giant Head Collective (GHC) is a Scottish rock band with a strong celtic influence.  We are a band that consists of musicians who appreciate that having a strong collection of songs is paramount.  Our music is different from most other Celtic Rock bands in that we feel that the songs have to work as rock songs and bring in the Celtic influence through instrumentation.  Over the past couple of years
we have already achieved a very positive reception in the UK as well as in Germany and Australia.  All our previous recording have been home produced but we are now stepping up a league on the back of our last single "This Time I'll Fight" which was No. 1 for two weeks in the popular German Celtic Station Schotten Radio. This song has in fact been the most requested song so far in 2015! It has also received airplay in the UK including on BBC Radio Scotland's Tom Morton show.

Why crowdfunding is needed?

For us to capitalise on our growth in popularity as well as the evolution of our sound and songwriting, we are at the stage where we need to professionally produce our next album by recording in an established studio with an established producer.

We are estimating that it will cost us a min of £2500 to record and a further £500 to produce artwork and physical copies of the CD as well as online promotion to increase our visability in the market and establish our credentials with live music promoters and venues.

We have already attracted attention of a couple of established music producers who have worked with very successful acts on both sides of the Atlantic and are keen to work with us and lend their support to furthering our music.  We have the songs and the talent, more than anything we need to use professional recording services to provide us with the polish to help our music stand against other artists who are funded by record labels. We also have a BAFTA award wining Director looking to work with us to produce a music video to one of the tracks off the new album.

It is all exciting times and without the backing of a record label we are ultimately relying on crowdfunding to help us take the next step.

What do you get?

For everyone that contributes £10 they will receive a copy of the Album in CD format signed by all the band.
For everyone who contributes £15 in addition to the signed copy of the album they will receive a limited edition print of the album artwork.
What's the risk?

If we fail to reach our target figure we will contact everyone who has supported our crowdfunding event and thank them for the support. We will either arrange to refund their money in full or allow them to decide if we can proceed on basis of recording an EP as opposed to a full album (min 10 songs). 

Once funding has been achieved we will send out regular updates of the progress, photo's of the band in the studio, short video's of the recording process to let you see that your money is helping us achieve something positive with our music!

What if you can't afford to help us?

We know that not everyone can help us by giving to this crowdfunding event. That's OK, we understand what it's like, in a perfect world we would be able to fund the recording ourselves.  If you can't donate anything we would apprerciate if you could at least help us by spreading the word to people that may be interested in helping us

Thanks for taking the time to check us out

All the guys at Giant Head Collective.

story:
A few years ago we started Lungs and Limbs.  After turning an old horse stable into a recording studio, paying off our Guitar Center credit cards, and chaining our guitarist/engineer Nick Tudor to a computer for six months, we have a finished EP (listen here)!

We want you to hear it. We want LOTS of people to hear it! We're ready to share it with the world.

But we need some help.

Lungs and Limbs is moving forward - fast! We play more often beyond our city limits than within. Our debut EP "Lifelike", released Nov. 13th, has received great national and local press:  VANYALAND (Boston) NorthBay Bohemian (S.F.) Free Bike Valet (L.A). We're proud of what we've accomplished so far on our own. We want to take this band to its full potential so we are asking for financial help.  

Please consider making a contribution to our campaign.  Even a small amount, or just sharing with friends is a big help! This project means everything to us. Thank you for being a part of it too.

Love,

Chris, Karina, Matt and Nick

Lungs and Limbs

story:
PROJECT DESCRIPTION

CACTUS MUSIC HALL MERIDA

I want to tell you about a project that has been spinning in my head for over twenty-five years and now through Indiegogo and your excitement, I see the opportunity to bring it to life!

It’s a fantastic project taught by nature, based on its architecture and its incredible organic structures. The desert cactus is a clear example: gorgeous and resistant to the extreme desert conditions where many organisms cannot live; it invites us to copy its daring geometric shapes and apply them for the human use.

Ferocactus

Watch its bold and vast geometry, so perfectly achieved to be worthy of life. Now is the time to study and apply its designs to develop ecological structures that can adapt to nature.

Though the years I have analyzed these shapes and developed a few architectural projects with different sizes and functions. The one that I am going to introduce you its the one with a basic shape for a Music Hall that will be built in the immediacy of Merida, Yucatan, Mexico, city of Mayan ancestors. The function of this compound will be to host a forum for great music and art, under an impressive roof, architectonically inspired in a “Ferocactus”… A delight to every sense…!

This project is about a structure in patent process, built with steel tubes connected to each other making different layers at the same time, all of them simulate the cactus shape and resistance as it elevates until 10m height, 32m interiors length and 14m of exterior height.

Its like if it was an inclined five stores building! This campaign will be to raise funds to build only the first stage of the tubular structure. In other campaigns we will raise funds to cover the structure with a thin cover of a special material called ETFE (or similar) and mesh shade in cones shape that will give its cactus appearance. On top of every cone a knot will be placed with incredible flat thorns, inclined and in leaf shape. Like the ones that the real Ferocactus of the desert has!

When illuminated through LED computerized systems, also collected in later stages, so as the interior like the exterior will cause a spectacular result.

As the base or floor of the structure, there will be removable plaques that will prevent damaging the floor permanently. On another note, there will be special avant-garde light, sound and visual effects, worthy of this new construction for entertainment. With time it will be able to integrate robotic technology, drones and anything that the imagination reaches to maintain the spectators’ awe throughout time.

It will also have plenty of space for the visitors to enjoy the show sitting around tall tables bar style, or without that furniture and standing up to fit more public.

Another feature will be additional tables in the outdoor space to enjoy the same show retracting the sides of the structure.

Also, connected to the central space there will be a kitchen, restrooms and storage space continuing with the same dynamism that has the evolving exterior.

And if that wasn’t enough, one of the goals of the total structure is to be a beautiful stage for huge outdoor events! This will be achieved by adapting its surroundings with green landscape in different levels so people can lay down similar to a roman theater under the stars.

The Cactus Music Hall will be an eco-friendly compound, friend of nature because it won’t damage its surroundings like a normal construction would; there is more, its structure will invite others to protect and respect the place. As part of its technology, it will produce its own energy through the wind and sunlight. Our objective is to imitate, as close as possible the beauty and intelligence that nature has placed in the cactus to be an auto-sufficient, resistant and beautiful masterpiece.

As you can see in Indiegogo, there is an awaking new culture, just like it happened in the Renaissance. Enthusiastic and innovative people face these times and they need a little support to make their dreams come true.

With your trust, support and enthusiasm we will see this project alive in just a few months. Everybody that participates will receive great satisfaction when they see it in postcards, social media and some gratification of some sort will be revealed later in time.

This music hall will be dedicated to a close friend of my community. When in live, he was named Javier Fuentes; he was a great musician and he shared his gift to everyone that surrounded him.

FUTURE PLANS

As a variant, the structure of the Ferocactus can be perfectly adaptable to be an exotic inn, tucked in rocks, on a beach or under the sea!

Another variant could be of a structure, yet again inspired by our loved cactus, this new shape will mirror the shape of a “whale”. It would be a direct variant of the Music Hall, but this time consolidating a larger compound and one of more capacity.

I have also worked on a design for a huge and incredible hotel, well thought out to be built on the skirts of a mountain in front of the sea. The design is exquisite, unique…. The spaces are bold with inclined walls, restaurants on the upper levels with glass floors on top of a sphere of 50m height! Imagine having breakfast or spend an evening there!

FIRST STAGE PROCEDURE OF CONSTRUCTION

The first stage of construction, is the one to be backed, it consist in the buy of all the steel needed to build the structure (including the spines that give the appearance of a cactus), the shadow mesh, the ETFE or a similar coating for housing the public , the kitchen, bathrooms and storage area, only the structure.

Also included pay the workers, their health insurance, the construction licence and other expenses relating to this stage.

In the budget there is not included, the cover of a special material called ETFE (or similar), lighting facilities, sound and special facilities, sunlight and wind powered systems, outdoor furniture, and the conditioning of other areas as parking, access between others. In order to build these elements there will be a new Indiegogo campaign, the second stage.

If the sponsorship goal to bring this cactus alive is exceeded, the facilities described above will be added on the first stage.

This beautiful and innovative structure will be built on a property owned by me, located on the surroundings of the city of Mérida Yucatán, México, because it concentrates the ideal features for operation and acces. You can see the place on the following maps:

THANK YOU!
CREDITS
Alejandro Concha - Architect, CEO & Project's Founder
Arlette Concha
Dianelly Concha
Kevin Arias
Alejandro Concha Jr.

huge and incredible hotel, well thought out to be built on the skirts of a
mountain in front of the sea. The design is exquisite, unique…. The spaces are
bold with inclined walls, restaurants on the upper levels with glass floors on
top of a sphere of 50m height! Imagine having breakfast or spend an evening
there!







FIRST STAGE
PROCEDURE OF CONSTRUCTION
The first stage
of construction, is the one to be backed, it consist in the buy of all the
steel needed to build the structure (including the spines that give the
appearance of a cactus), the shadow mesh, the ETFE or a similar coating for
housing the public , the kitchen, bathrooms and storage area, only the structure.
Also included pay the
workers, their health insurance, the construction licence and other expenses
relating to this stage.
In the budget
there is not included, the cover of a special material called ETFE (or similar), lighting facilities, sound and special facilities,
sunlight and wind powered systems, outdoor furniture, and the conditioning of
other areas as parking, access between others. In order to build these elements
there will be a new Indiegogo campaign, the second stage.
If the
sponsorship goal to bring this cactus alive is exceeded, the facilities described
above will be added on the first stage.
This beautiful
and innovative structure will be built on a property owned by me, located on
the surroundings of the city of Mérida Yucatán, México, because it concentrates
the ideal features for operation and acces. You can see the place on the
following maps:






THANK YOU!

CREDITSAlejandro Concha - Architect, CEO & Project's FounderArlette ConchaDianelly ConchaKevin AriasAlejandro Concha Jr.

story:
Welcome to Mannequin Planet, an insane concoction of industrial dance metal music, sci-fi b-movies, and orgiastic spectacle. Think the B-52's if they were produced by Nine Inch Nails for the music; Marilyn Manson and Alice Cooper for the show - but sleazier and cheesier than all the above combined. 


Our philosophy in one alliterative phrase: 
MANNEQUINS, MUSIC, MODELS, MOVIES!!!

 Check out our progress as we rehearse the vocals (and live guitars) for one of the new songs in the video below! 

Recording the vocals isn't just a process of singing into a mic though... We need to pay an expert producer who can help us produce, mix, engineer, and master the finished product! Normally, this would cost a minimum of several thousands of dollars to have it done at the level of professional quality that we are determined to meet (and met for our first album). In our case though, we have done this before and know what we are doing, and we have someone who believes in the project who is enthusiastic about working with us on a limited budget for his love of the music! 

 THE CAMPAIGN: 

Share in the Creation and the Rewards of Our Project! 

The music of Mannequin Planet is just as sensational and epic as its crazy and fantastic shows (more on that below!). We have not one, but TWO complete new albums, completely mastered, engineered, and produced - but no vocals! This fundraiser is to raise the necessary funds to finish these two new maniacal mannequin masterpieces.

Look us up on Spotify, and you'll find Mannequin Planet's first album, Humannequin. You can also check out various songs from the many incarnations of Mannequin Planet on www.reverbnation.com/mannequinplanet

This should give you a taste - We believe though that the new stuff is even better! 


For $35, you can have all three albums, plus a chance to appear on stage with Mannequin Planet. 

IF JUST 28 PEOPLE DONATE AT THE $35 PERK LEVEL, WE WILL HAVE MET OUR GOAL AND WILL COMPLETE BOTH  NEW ALBUMS!!!

STRETCH GOALS: 

We would also like to buy t-shirts and pressed CDs with artwork for the albums. Please check out the perks you can get if we exceed our goal! 

If Mannequin Planet raises $1300, everyone who donated at the $35 level receives a Mannequin Planet t-shirt! 


If Mannequin Planet raises $1700, everyone who donated at the $35 level receives a t-shirt, and a pressed physical copy of Soul Plasticity, with awesome artwork! 

And if Mannequin Planet raises $2000, everyone who donated at the $35 level will receive a t-shirt, plus a pressed physical copy of both The Planet Clitoris and Soul Plasticity, with awesome artwork! 

PERKS ABOVE $35

The perks only get better as the donations get higher... For $40, we'll include lyrics books with detailed accounts of the songs' inspirations, plus annotations detailing the movies that the samples in the songs are from!

For  $50, we will send a digital download of a collection of Mannequin Planet rarities - this exclusive album contains unheard covers, remixes, alternate versions, outtakes, and new songs! 

AT THE $60 LEVEL, WE INVITE YOU TO COME TO A CD LISTENING PARTY AND DINNER AT THE MANNEQUIN MANSION, home to the Handy Mann and his hundreds of mannequins and props. 

At $75, add two bootleg live performances of Mannequin Planet's 2011 shows!

For $100, receive all the above, plus an autographed mannequin head! 

The $200 level is a Jesus personal favorite: a signed vintage 2011 poster of Mannequin Planet's last show with the original lineup of the band. The show was performed at the Red Devil Lounge, which has since closed due to the gentrification and raised tax rates in the Nob Hill neighborhood. Designed by W)Rong Sounds, the poster is a high-def glossy portrait of a red mannequin's face in a blue moon... A beautiful sci-fi psychodramatic landscape. 


The $300 level gets you an executive producer credit on each album.

For $400, receive one of the Handy Mann's locally famous art bikes! 


At the $500 level come in and record an alternate version of one the songs! We will even include it on the rarities compilation - plus, receive our everlasting gratitude... $500 would finance the completion of one whole album! 

At each perk level, you receive all previous perks of lesser value. 

Thank you so much for reading! If you can't afford to contribute to the creation of our new albums, please LIKE US ON FACEBOOK, AND COME SEE US AT A SHOW IN 2016! 

ACCOUNTABILITY AND TRANSPARENCY / PERKS FULFILLMENT

We are keeping our costs low... Every cent of the first $1000 goes into music production. After Indie Go-Go's 5% cut, and 3% payment processing fees, every cent of the money after that goes into fulfilling the stretch goals! 

If we do not meet our goal through the fundraiser, we will meet it on our own, but with normal costs of living and bills, it will take longer to make it happen. These albums have been incubating for a few years... We are bound and determined to make them happen! If we do not meet our goal, we guarantee that perks will be fulfilled, however probably not in the predicted time frame. 

We believe we can do this! You'll notice that we have offered awesome perks for reasonable value. We are able to do this because all perks up to $50 are digital, and yet, you are donating about as much money as it would cost to buy music outright. After $60, all physical perks can be fulfilled when we meet at the Mannequin Mansion listening party. We are eliminating shipping costs, but still offering some awesome stuff, and in the process, we are ensuring that as much of your donation as possible goes into the project itself! 


STORY

THE HISTORY OF MANNEQUIN PLANET

Mannequin Planet released its first album Humannequin in 2011. After the album and a series of shows, founding singers Jesus:v. buddha 3.9 and Satori departed in pursuit of other ambitions while founding musician and producer W)Rong Sounds carried on with the Handy Mann, the creator of Mannequin Planet. They released one EP, Insane Experiments, with W)Rong Sounds taking over vocal duties. 

NOW, Mannequin Planet is back. Joining the Handy Mann, Jesus: version buddha 3.9 returns to the mic, along with new co-vocalist Mourning Glory, and on guitars, Poison enVy. New actors and performance artists Kabal Inferno, Danica Knight, and Anipso round out the group!

The Handy Mann has been collecting, assembling, and deconstructing mannequins for almost a decade, and now, his collection, which comprises the population of Mannequin Planet, numbers in the hundreds. We take these crazy machinations on stage with us everywhere we go! 

Featuring an incredible new light show, also joining us onstage are juggling (and drinking) clowns, erotic body painters, unicyclists, demolition crews, dancers, crazy props and costumes, and creative types of all kinds. Also joining us could be YOU! 

Mannequin Planet is a band for the people. We are always looking to collaborate with new creatives, and anyone is welcome to bring their talents to our stage.



MANNEQUIN PLANET 2016 is: 

THE MUSICIANS

Jesus: version buddha 3.9 (vocals, lyrics), Mourning Glory (vocals), Poison enVy (live guitars), W)Rong Sounds (music composition and production)

THE ACTING TROUPE:

The Handy Mann (showrunner), Anipso, Danica Knight, Kabal Inferno 

ALBUM TRACKLISTS and DESCRIPTIONS

HUMANNEQUIN

1. Hummannequin, Pt. One 2. Shit for Brains 3. Window Shopping 4. Insomniac 5. Confession 6. The Square Box of Glowing Fuzz 7. Destroy the Earth 8. Power Exchange 9. The Eagle and the Sunbird (T.E.A.T.S.) 10. Spring of '95 11. Hot Primogeniture Nights 12. Black Widow 13. Weaver 14. Humannequin, Pt. Two

SOUL PLASTICITY

1. Disconnected 2. Space Lords 3. Desert Talkers 4. Crab People (Climbing Out of Buckets with Snapping Claws) 5. Starcut Paths 6. Lost in Space 7. Mother Nature's Gumbo Oil 8. Machinations 9. O Great Destroyer 10. The Memory Moons of Planet Robotica 11. Shakespearean Cosmonaut 12. The Big Bang 13. Soul Plasticity

THE PLANET CLITORIS

1. West of Wild Space 2. Scrap with Satan 3. Brainwash 4. Sex Up Your Shadow       5. Police State of Mind 6. Not Your Dope! 7. Driving Fast (Is What I Like To Do)       8. The Hard Hat Funk of the Driller Killer 9. Magic is Fun! 10. California Women
