story:
The Mission

Music is a universal language.  Music unifies, provides comfort, makes us feel good, highlights moments, makes us all feel alive and it can take us into the depths of our imagination or pull us strongly into the present moment. It's this power and potential of music that drives me to write songs and share them with the world.

I’ve spent years growing as a songwriter, recording artist and live entertainer.  It is one of the best feelings in the world to impact other people with melodies, stories and connection; to use music to help people feel happy and free – and it’s time to do this on a much bigger scale.  Over the past 5 years I’ve written more than an album full of songs.  Myself, people on my team, trusted ears in the industry and fans at shows over the past 2+ years feel that these songs and this album will fulfill on that purpose.  We just need to come together to enable top-notch production of the music and to get these melodies/messages/songs out in as big a way as possible.

Check out everything on the page to learn more about how we can help people feel happy and free with The Wow Project.  Contribute and let’s bring this mission to the world :)

Ways You Can Help

These are HUGE ways to help out.

1. Share via Email & Facebook

A personal email and outreach to your network with a heartfelt message is a great way to help this campaign.  This link makes it easy to do both:

http://bit.ly/1g4HX89

2. Make a Contribution Today

See the section below this one or the column on the right for details on all the Perks, then contribute today.  Thank you!

3. Reach Out via Phone

There's nothing like a phone call for someone to know how important this is.  For those you are close to or think would really love to support The Wow Project, give them a call.

4. You May Know Someone Like This...

If you know others that would be inspired to contribute to this campaign and/or help get the word out, ask them to take a look (the video is 3.5 minutes).  Speaking in person, phone calls and direct text messages feel the most personal and would show how important this is to look at and be a part of.

If you know of business owners / executives that could be inspired by this campaign and be in a position to make a larger contribution, please connect us with them at hello@johntayles.com

Make a Contribution Today - The Perks

Contribute today to help make this dream a reality.

Pay-It-Forward Rewards

Rewards $45 and above come with a gift-able “Pay-It-Forward-Reward” to share with someone you love.  For example the Physical Pay-It-Forward gives you 2 CDs and 2 digital download one week before the album release - and that is included for the other perks from that point on.

For the second digital download:  I’ll send you an email form once the project is complete, just reply with the email and first name of the recipient.  We will automatically send them your Pay-It-Forward-Gift!

The whole point is it makes this project a reality, you get to enjoy contributing and we get to give someone else a gift … Awesome x3!

Album Credits:

Put your name on the Wow Album forever by having your name in the CD booklet artwork.  We're building this together and this is a HUGE way to impact this campaign.

Acoustic House Concert:  

Something you can do with your friends and family, that would be different than a party and most things experienced the rest of the year.  An intimate setting with 20+ people in a living room, common room, backyard, etc. I'll play music off the new album and other releases, tell stories, and create moments of laughter, excitement and being moved. I promise a Wow Experience for your friends and family.

Company / Client Appreciation Concert:

If your organization's value line up with being happy and free, then it's time to create that experience for your teams or for your clients.  This is NOT background cover music at a Christmas party, where's the Wow in that?  I have experience in boardrooms helping groups in a company come together with music.  We will create an event that truly unites a team.  And we can also share this same vibe with the customers that make your work possible.

Your Very Own Wedding Song:

Want to do something crazy unique for your / your friend's wedding?  How about I write you a song, professionally record it and come to your wedding to play it live!  Here's a custom wedding song, unveiled for the first time on their big day...

Videos

Single from 'Thoughts Out Loud', Get It Right - filmed in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico:

We Are Ready - this whole recording, done in Nashville, and the video filmed over 2 days were created by several passionate people on a slim budget.  Imagine what we'll be able to do with The Wow Project videos and release...

The $'s

Professionally recording an album is expensive.  Professionally releasing an album is VERY expensive.  I’ve invested $5000 of my own savings so far and will invest at least double that over the course of the project.  This has allowed for the recording of the first single, Wow, and the putting together of the production team, creating the project plan, and the initial development of an industry-standard promotional plan.  I will cover all travel costs associated with creating this album.  Now we need to raise the rest of the funds to create an amazing album and give it wings around the world.

We are starting by raising $33,300, which is the minimum needed to achieve world-class sound quality.  To begin meaningfully promoting the project nationally would entail a total budget of $50,000+.  And to really achieve the dream and promote the album INTERNATIONALLY we would need upwards of $70,000.

When we surpass the first goal, I’ll share with you more about how the extra funds above that will be distributed in spreading the word Nationally, and then Internationally :)

The Team

Darren Grahn (Vancouver - Production / Mixing):

Based in Vancouver with over 20 years of experience in the recording studio, Darren has worked on over 175 albums as either an engineer or producer.  These include popular major artists such as Metallica (4 albums), Elvis Costello, Bryan Adams, The Cult, Bon Jovi, David Bowie, Blask Eyed Peas, Nickelback, Sarah McLaughlin, Michelle Branch, Christina Aguilera, Hedley and Cher.  Darren produced John’s first full length, Thoughts Out Loud and in regards to this project he remarks, “life changing success for John is just a matter of the right team behind him with great sounding recordings. It’s very achievable with focused work.”

Marcus Bell (LA - Production / Mixing): 

Artist, producer and entrepreneur; Marcus causes people to fulfill their dreams.  He has marketed, produced, mentored and developed some of the world’s biggest superstars including Usher, Britney Spears and the Black Eyed Peas.  Bell has written and produced hits in Turkey, Lebanon, Asia and Europe.  He is developing unique projects with NASA, Toyota and Virgin Galactic to engage youth in Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math (STEAM).  His promise is, “A world happy, healthy and creatively self-expressed.”

Johnny Simmen (Toronto - Production / Mixing):

As owner/producer at A Stare Away Studios, and as a songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and recording artist in his own right, Johnny Simmen brings a unique set of talents to every project he takes on. Simmen’s natural instincts in the studio and his ability to draw out the best possible performance he can from the artists he works with are a product of his intimate understanding of the dynamic between producer and artist.

Richard Yagutilov (Music Photographer & Video Director):

Having worked with Lady Gaga Directing her Video Tour Diaries and being her Toronto music tour photographer for a week, Richard has also worked with Kardinal Offishall as his personal photographer, album cover designer, music video director on several hit videos under Kon Live and Universal’s label.  Hailed at Toronto’s leading music photographer and music video director, Richard brings incredible experience and originality to the Wow Project.

TV/Film/Commercial Song Placement (Syncing): Bellringer Music Library

PR & Radio: As the recordings progress and we are ready to begin this phase of the project (3-4 months from funding), we will announce the full team we’ve partnered with to enhance and carry out our plan to spread the music around the world.

The Plan - Creation

My team and I have put together a detailed concrete plan and budget for creating full-length album that is high quality and a true expression of the word ‘Wow’.  Here are the components of the recording / creation process in order of size.

Production & Mixing – This is where it all starts, with a great song being turned into a great recording.  Two-thirds of what is raised in our initial $33,300 goal goes directly to making that happen.  There’s studio time and compensating our amazing, experienced producers / mixers.

Music Video – As our budget grows, more will be allocated to the music video.  Furthermore, we will be applying for every grant possible in Ontario and Canada to create a budget above and beyond what we raise here so that we can add more impact to those melodies and lyrics in a world class music video.

Behind-the-Scenes & Exclusive Videos – We will document this process, the highs, lows, the interesting, special and funny moments.  Some of the videos will be released first or even exclusively to those who contribute to the The Wow Package. But everyone will definitely be updated and sharing in this process every step of the way.

Mastering – This is what takes great recordings and makes them sound loud, pleasant and oh so sweet on any type of speaker (iPod, car, radio, ghetto blaster, phone, laptop, etc).

Duplication – Gotta press those album copies.  An initial 1000-CD run will allow us to fulfill your Indiegogo Perks in exchange for your Contributions.

Artwork & Design – Making the CD, insert booklet, digital image and other materials look pretty.

Guest Musicians – We may need violin, string players or other talented musicians to help bring these songs to life in the studio.

Equipment Rental – We demand perfection of our sound vision!  There will likely be an exotic amp, synth keyboard or other piece of audio gear for us to rent that will be the icing on the cake for a song or two.

The Plan - Release

As we surpass $33,300 and I add more of my own savings, we’ll be able to implement the Wow Release Plan.  Depending on what is raised will determine how big we can go, and for how long.  Regardless of what that is, the Wow Project will be the biggest event I have been apart of as a recording artist – and it’s exciting to be creating it together.

Publicity – A great music PR firm is essential for a release.  They get high priority editorial features in magazines, blogs and newspapers.  They get you on television shows, web concert series, radio performances.  Essentially they build awareness of an artist & their music by taking them EVERYWHERE around the media landscape.

Radio – Yes, it ain’t what it used to be when radio, TV and the newspapers were the unchallenged mass marketing pillars for label releases.  BUT it’s still one of the popular ways for people to find music.  We’re fortunate to be connected with major radio promoters in the US and Canada who are able to push the music to their contacts and get it on college and mainstream radio.  This is easily the most expensive thing to do in a campaign, and we will scale up as we raise funds.

Videos – The first music video, behind-the-scenes and exclusive video content is included in the Creation Plan, and there are subsequent videos we envision creating.  We’ve created a catalogue of ideas for cover videos, funny clips, live videos and more sweet music videos of songs from the album.

Advertising – There’s a way to use online advertising most effectively, and we’ve gotten incredible insight and planning advice from some of the world’s best internet marketers … which is just someone that knows how to reach the right person, with the right message (or song ;) at the right time.  We have some best in class ideas to implement here on Facebook and online/offline magazines.

Mailings – Licensing songs from the album helps build awareness and our ability to re-invest in amplifying our efforts.  Getting songs in film/television/commercials will be a focus of the release and we will be mailing out the music and press kits to influencers and decision-makers in those fields.

Tour – This will be the final stage of the entire process … there will be shows throughout, but an organized, expertly crafted and smoothly run tour is vital to actually creating those moments that make people say ‘Wow’, in person.  Booking the dates and generating local press for each show and appearance will be vital to this fully involved campaign.

Experience

I feel so confident about making this a success.  I've had lots of experience executing a big projects.

  • I co-led 2 fundraiser dinners and missions trips to Uganda, where we donated the funds and our time to the Missionaries of the Poor in Kampala, Uganda.
  • I, along with some close team members and an army of supporters, won the $30,000 singer/songwriter contest at Slice The Pie.  We coordinated an ambitious campaign on Facebook and added to that with print coverage and TV appearances to win the contest.  We then recorded 'Thoughts Out Loud'.
  • I recorded the single 'We Are Ready' in Nashville and pulled a team together of 50+ to help create the music video, standalone website and We Are Ready Challenge campaign.

Read below to see how these experiences will make this project the biggest of all, and how we will help people around the world feel happy and free with music.

Risks & Challenges

What if…

So what happens if we don’t raise well above $33,300 to implement the widespread release plan?  Regardless, everyone that contributes will be getting an amazing album and the totally awesome experiences associated with the perk you generously contributed to.  Mark my words, this is happening, 100% ... the idea is to raise as much as possible with this Indiegogo campaign, then build further support, expand our resources and implement from there.

What’s Already Happened…

In 2009 I released my first full length record, Thoughts Out Loud – it was recorded with $30,000 won in an online songwriting contest for singer songwriters at SliceThePie.com (the site is very different now than it was in 2008).  People loved the sound and the songs, and it turned out great – I was (and still am) so proud of it.  BUT I had no idea what to do to get the music out on a wider scale.  Last year into this one I completed an intense 8-month program called Starbootcamp, which has filled in all the blanks.  With clarity in the formerly ‘muddy’ aspects of successfully releasing new music, I am so excited as I work with great people to implement what I now know.

The Music Biz…

We have a concrete plan and I’m very confident that it will create more waves than anything I’ve ever done and it will result in a successful album release.  Now, we all know that this is show biz … nothing is fully guaranteed.  Should we not get the initial results we’re looking for in our release plans, we will be agile and make adjustments along the way (yep, the big record labels do that too).  There will be course corrections no doubt.  The important thing is, we’re working with experienced professionals that are enthusiastically committed to the Wow Project, every step of the way.  Our intention and resolve is to use our creativity, our positive attitudes and the wisdom of our experiences to overcome any challenge and treat every step as an opportunity.

Let's use music to help people feel happy and free.

Much love and gratitude,

- John Tayles

THANK YOU!!!
story_txt:
The Mission
Music is a universal language.  Music unifies, provides comfort, makes us
feel good, highlights moments, makes us all feel alive and it can take us into the
depths of our imagination or pull us strongly into the present moment. It's this power and potential of music that drives me to write songs and share them with the world.
I’ve spent
years growing as a songwriter, recording artist and live entertainer.  It is one of the best feelings in the world
to impact other people with melodies, stories and connection; to use music to
help people feel happy and free – and it’s time to do this on a much bigger
scale.  Over the past 5 years I’ve
written more than an album full of songs. 
Myself, people on my team, trusted ears in the industry and fans at
shows over the past 2+ years feel that these songs and this album will fulfill on that
purpose.  We just need to come together
to enable top-notch production of the music and to get these
melodies/messages/songs out in as big a way as possible.
Check
out everything on the page to learn more about how we can help people feel
happy and free with The Wow Project. 
Contribute and let’s bring this mission to the world :)

 
Ways You Can Help

These are HUGE ways to help out.

1. Share via Email & Facebook


A personal email and outreach to your network with a heartfelt 
message is a great way to help this campaign.  This link makes it easy 
to do both:
http://bit.ly/1g4HX89
2. Make a Contribution Today

See the section below this one or the column on the right for details on all the Perks, then contribute today.  Thank you!



3. Reach Out via Phone
There's nothing like a phone call for someone to know how important this is.  For those you are close to or think would really love to support The Wow Project, give them a call.
4. You May Know Someone Like This...

If
you know others that would be inspired to contribute to this campaign and/or
help get the word out, ask them to take a look (the video is 3.5 minutes).  Speaking in person, phone calls and direct
text messages feel the most personal and would show how important this is to
look at and be a part of.
If
you know of business owners / executives that could be inspired by this
campaign and be in a position to make a larger contribution, please connect us
with them at hello@johntayles.com



Make a Contribution Today - The Perks

Contribute
today to help make this dream a reality.
Pay-It-Forward Rewards
Rewards $45 and above come with a gift-able “Pay-It-Forward-Reward” to share with someone you
love.  For example the Physical
Pay-It-Forward gives you 2 CDs and 2 digital download one week before the album
release - and that is included for the other perks from that point on.
For the second digital download:  I’ll send you an email form once the project
is complete, just reply with the email and first name of the recipient.  We will automatically send them your
Pay-It-Forward-Gift!
The
whole point is it makes this project a reality, you get to enjoy contributing
and we get to give someone else a gift … Awesome x3!
Album Credits:
Put your name on the Wow Album forever by having your name in the CD booklet artwork.  We're building this together and this is a HUGE way to impact this campaign.
Acoustic House Concert:  
Something you can do with your friends and family, that would be different than a party and most things experienced the rest of the year.  An intimate setting with 20+ people in a living room, common room, backyard, etc. I'll play music off the new album and other releases, tell stories, and create moments of laughter, excitement and being moved. I promise a Wow Experience for your friends and family.
Company / Client Appreciation Concert:
If your organization's value line up with being happy and free, then it's time to create that experience for your teams or for your clients.  This is NOT background cover music at a Christmas party, where's the Wow in that?  I have experience in boardrooms helping groups in a company come together with music.  We will create an event that truly unites a team.  And we can also share this same vibe with the customers that make your work possible.
Your Very Own Wedding Song:
Want to do something crazy unique for your / your friend's wedding?  How about I write you a song, professionally record it and come to your wedding to play it live!  Here's a custom wedding song, unveiled for the first time on their big day...


Videos
Single from 'Thoughts Out Loud', Get It Right - filmed in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico:
We Are Ready - this whole recording, done in Nashville, and the video filmed over 2 days were created by several passionate people on a slim budget.  Imagine what we'll be able to do with The Wow Project videos and release...

The $'s
Professionally
recording an album is expensive.  Professionally releasing an
album is VERY expensive.  I’ve invested
$5000 of my own savings so far and will invest at least double that over the
course of the project.  This has allowed
for the recording of the first single, Wow, and the putting together of the
production team, creating the project plan, and the initial development of an
industry-standard promotional plan.  I
will cover all travel costs associated with creating this album. 
Now we need to raise the rest of
the funds to create an amazing album and give it wings around the world.
We
are starting by raising $33,300, which is the minimum needed to achieve
world-class sound quality.  To begin meaningfully promoting the project
nationally would entail a total budget of $50,000+.  And to really achieve the dream and promote
the album INTERNATIONALLY we would need upwards of $70,000.
When
we surpass the first goal, I’ll share with you more about
how the extra funds above that will be distributed in spreading the word
Nationally, and then Internationally :)
The Team
Darren
Grahn (Vancouver - Production / Mixing):
Based
in Vancouver with over 20 years of experience in the recording studio, Darren
has worked on over 175 albums as either an engineer or producer.  These include popular major artists such as
Metallica (4 albums), Elvis Costello, Bryan Adams, The Cult, Bon Jovi, David
Bowie, Blask Eyed Peas, Nickelback, Sarah McLaughlin, Michelle Branch,
Christina Aguilera, Hedley and Cher.  Darren
produced John’s first full length, Thoughts Out Loud and in regards to this
project he remarks, “life changing success for John is just a matter of the
right team behind him with great sounding recordings. It’s very achievable with
focused work.”
Marcus
Bell (LA - Production / Mixing):  
Artist,
producer and entrepreneur; Marcus causes people to fulfill their dreams.  He has marketed, produced, mentored and
developed some of the world’s biggest superstars including Usher, Britney
Spears and the Black Eyed Peas.  Bell has
written and produced hits in Turkey, Lebanon, Asia and Europe.  He is developing unique projects with NASA,
Toyota and Virgin Galactic to engage youth in Science, Technology, Engineering,
Arts and Math (STEAM).  His promise is,
“A world happy, healthy and creatively self-expressed.”
Johnny
Simmen (Toronto - Production / Mixing):
As owner/producer at A Stare Away Studios, and as a songwriter, 
multi-instrumentalist and recording artist in his own right, Johnny 
Simmen brings a unique set of talents to every project he takes on. 
Simmen’s natural instincts in the studio and his ability to draw out the
 best possible performance he can from the artists he works with are a 
product of his intimate understanding of the dynamic between producer 
and artist. 
Richard
Yagutilov (Music Photographer & Video Director):
Having
worked with Lady Gaga Directing her Video Tour Diaries and being her Toronto
music tour photographer for a week, Richard has also worked with Kardinal
Offishall as his personal photographer, album cover designer, music video
director on several hit videos under Kon Live and Universal’s label.  Hailed at Toronto’s leading music
photographer and music video director, Richard brings incredible experience and
originality to the Wow Project.
TV/Film/Commercial
Song Placement (Syncing): Bellringer
Music Library
PR
& Radio: As the recordings progress and we are ready to begin this phase of
the project (3-4 months from funding), we will announce the full team we’ve
partnered with to enhance and carry out our plan to spread the music around the
world.
The Plan - Creation
My
team and I have put together a detailed concrete plan and budget for creating
full-length album that is high quality and a true expression of the word
‘Wow’.  Here are the components of the
recording / creation process in order of size.
Production
& Mixing – This is where it all starts, with a great song being turned into
a great recording.  Two-thirds of what is
raised in our initial $33,300 goal goes directly to making that happen.  There’s studio time and compensating our
amazing, experienced producers / mixers.
Music
Video – As our budget grows, more will be allocated to the music video.  Furthermore, we will be applying for every
grant possible in Ontario and Canada to create a budget above and beyond what
we raise here so that we can add more impact to those melodies and lyrics in a
world class music video.
Behind-the-Scenes
& Exclusive Videos – We will document this process, the highs, lows, the
interesting, special and funny moments. 
Some of the videos will be released first or even exclusively to those
who contribute to the The Wow Package. But everyone will definitely be updated and
sharing in this process every step of the way.
Mastering
– This is what takes great recordings and makes them sound loud, pleasant and
oh so sweet on any type of speaker (iPod, car, radio, ghetto blaster, phone,
laptop, etc).
Duplication
– Gotta press those album copies.  An
initial 1000-CD  run will allow us to fulfill your Indiegogo Perks in exchange
for your Contributions.
Artwork
& Design – Making the CD, insert booklet, digital image and other materials
look pretty.
Guest
Musicians – We may need violin, string players or other talented musicians to
help bring these songs to life in the studio.
Equipment
Rental – We demand perfection of our sound vision!  There will likely be an exotic amp, synth
keyboard or other piece of audio gear for us to rent that will be the icing on
the cake for a song or two.




The Plan - Release
As
we surpass $33,300 and I add more of my own savings, we’ll be able to implement
the Wow Release Plan.  Depending on what
is raised will determine how big we can go, and for how long.  Regardless of what that is, the Wow Project
will be the biggest event I have been apart of as a recording artist – and it’s
exciting to be creating it together.
Publicity
– A great music PR firm is essential for a release.  They get high priority editorial features in
magazines, blogs and newspapers.  They
get you on television shows, web concert series, radio performances.  Essentially they build awareness of an artist
& their music by taking them EVERYWHERE around the media landscape.
Radio
– Yes, it ain’t what it used to be when radio, TV and the newspapers were the
unchallenged mass marketing pillars for label releases.  BUT it’s still one of the popular ways for
people to find music.  We’re fortunate to
be connected with major radio promoters in the US and Canada who are able to
push the music to their contacts and get it on college and mainstream
radio.  This is easily the most expensive
thing to do in a campaign, and we will scale up as we raise funds.
Videos
– The first music video, behind-the-scenes and exclusive video content is
included in the Creation Plan, and there are subsequent videos we envision
creating.  We’ve created a catalogue of
ideas for cover videos, funny clips, live videos and more sweet music videos of
songs from the album.
Advertising
– There’s a way to use online advertising most effectively, and we’ve gotten
incredible insight and planning advice from some of the world’s best internet
marketers … which is just someone that knows how to reach the right person,
with the right message (or song ;) at the right time.  We have some best in class ideas to implement
here on Facebook and online/offline magazines.
Mailings
– Licensing songs from the album helps build awareness and our ability to
re-invest in amplifying our efforts. 
Getting songs in film/television/commercials will be a focus of the
release and we will be mailing out the music and press kits to influencers and
decision-makers in those fields.
Tour
– This will be the final stage of the entire process … there will be shows
throughout, but an organized, expertly crafted and smoothly run tour is vital
to actually creating those moments that make people say ‘Wow’, in person.  Booking the dates and generating local press
for each show and appearance will be vital to this fully involved campaign.



Experience
I
feel so confident about making this a success.  I've had lots of experience executing a big projects.

I co-led 2 fundraiser dinners and
     missions trips to Uganda, where we donated the funds and our time to the
     Missionaries of the Poor in Kampala, Uganda.
I, along with some close team members
     and an army of supporters, won the $30,000 singer/songwriter contest at
     Slice The Pie.  We coordinated an
     ambitious campaign on Facebook and added to that with print coverage and
     TV appearances to win the contest.  We then recorded 'Thoughts Out Loud'.

I recorded the single 'We Are Ready' in Nashville and pulled a team together of 50+ to help create the music video, standalone website and We Are Ready Challenge campaign.

Read below to see how these experiences will make this project the biggest of all, and how we will help people around the world feel happy and free with music.


 Risks & Challenges 

What
if…
So
what happens if we don’t raise well above $33,300 to implement the widespread
release plan?  Regardless, everyone that
contributes will be getting an amazing album and the totally awesome experiences
associated with the perk you generously contributed to.  Mark my words, this is happening, 100% ... the idea is to raise as much as possible with this Indiegogo campaign, then build further support, expand our resources and implement from there.
What’s
Already Happened…
In
2009 I released my first full length record, Thoughts Out Loud – it was
recorded with $30,000 won in an online songwriting contest for singer
songwriters at SliceThePie.com (the site is very different now than it was in
2008).  People loved the sound and the
songs, and it turned out great – I was (and still am) so proud of it.  BUT I had no idea what to do to get the music
out on a wider scale.  Last year into
this one I completed an intense 8-month program called Starbootcamp, which has
filled in all the blanks.  With clarity
in the formerly ‘muddy’ aspects of successfully releasing new music, I am so
excited as I work with great people to implement what I now know.
The
Music Biz…
We
have a concrete plan and I’m very confident that it will create more waves than
anything I’ve ever done and it will result in a successful album release.  Now, we all know that this is show biz …
nothing is fully guaranteed.  Should we
not get the initial results we’re looking for in our release plans, we will be agile
and make adjustments along the way (yep, the big record labels do that too).  There will be course corrections no doubt.  The important thing is,
we’re working with experienced professionals that are enthusiastically
committed to the Wow Project, every step of the way.  Our intention and resolve is to use our
creativity, our positive attitudes and the wisdom of our experiences to
overcome any challenge and treat every step as an opportunity.
Let's use music to help people feel happy and free.Much love and gratitude,- John TaylesTHANK YOU!!!

story:
We’re creating our first EP as a pop-rock duo and we need your help finishing it! That’s why we’re here -- and hopefully why you're here too.

Not ready to fund us just yet? Here's our story...

Verity 

My name is Rachelle Call and I got my start in the Christian Music Industry at the age of 29 when I was a wife and young mother to two daughters.  I have been performing and writing music for over a decade.  

I met Jessie Funk eight years ago at a recording session in Utah:  Jessie was laying vocal tracks to a song of mine that she would be including on her next studio project.  When I met Jessie Funk, I had recently moved to Utah from Colorado.  I was very interested in engaging Utah's music industry and knew that Jessie was the best of the best.  I loved her amazing voice and hearing her sing my music was a personal champion moment for me.  Her rich and strong vocals somehow strengthened me and added value to my life as I was searching for my own recovery from co-dependency and domestic abuse.  

As I made Utah my new home, Jessie became a bigger part of my life.  I turned to her more often to sing for my latest music projects and at live concert events.  It was at these events that Jessie and I quickly noticed the powerful impact our collaboration had on the audience.  There was an instant connection that almost seemed magical to us as musicians, and we wondered if the listeners were experiencing the same healing from our music that we knew was there.  

With this question in mind, Jessie and I began to take our partnership more seriously by laying out plans to start a female pop-rock duo.  We took the idea of what "The Judds" had done over the span of their career and adapted that to our own unique gifting and talents:  I would write/co-write the music and Jessie would be the voice.  

Together, our intention now is to weave a story of friendship and support that has been the foundation of our relationship and music. Jessie and I are women who are passionate about living truthful lives and we hope that comes across in our music.  As we discussed our vision for becoming a duo, we wanted "truth" to be a major part of our branding. Jessie and I understand that life is very dynamic and what may be true for each of us differs based on circumstances, understanding and life purpose.  

With that in mind, Jessie named our group Verity.  Defined, verity means "the quality or condition of being true, factual, or real."  With so much pain and chaos going on in the world, the qualities of being true, real and genuine are important to cultivate.  Jessie and I want to present music that has come from a space of substance and value so that it lifts the listener to another realm of awareness and hope.  Jessie and I perform Verity's music from the perspective of women who are wives, mothers, friends and advocates for other women in the world who experience poverty, despair, sexual abuse, domestic abuse, inequality, mental illness and addictions.  It is our goal to create music that ignites a force for change, creativity, courage, and hope to those who seek their own unique purpose in life.

What We Need 

  • We have our music and now we need your help to begin production on our first project! Jessie and I have created so much music together over the years but now it is time to bring it all together under one purpose. Jessie and I are passionate about pop/rock music and we have a producer who understands this genre and can match our vision with his talent. The estimated cost for an EP ("extended Play", i.e., longer than a single but not an entire album) of those tracks including mastering will be approximately $2,500 per completed song.   We have hired a PR management company to help us get our brand going, which includes photo's, website, iTunes distribution and indigo go campaign. This initial investment is $4,000. All-in, we would like to reach a goal of $16,500 to get us started. 
  • What you get with your contribution to VERITY:  Here's the cool thing about Verity as a duo act---we don't just perform music!  Jessie is the founder of Ivy Girls Academy which is a non-profit company that teaches young teenage girls the importance of confidence, composure and high standards for getting a start in life.  Rachelle is a social worker with years of experience mentoring women trapped in abusive relationships and addictive cycles.  Rachelle founded the Recovery concert tour and co-produced Recovery. The Music.--a concert experience designed to address the problems of addiction and mental illness in our communities. We are eager to reach out and connect with our fans and we are excited about the information we can share about recovery through our music.
  • If we don't completely reach our goal, we will still produce the music.  Jessie and I are so proud of the music we create together that even if we only get enough for producing one song, we're happy to get started!

The Impact

Jessie and I feel a strong connection to women who are looking for a support system as they move through lives that are constantly changing.  Verity's music comes from very raw and personal experiences that so many women can relate to.  Our music assists the listener to address feelings and emotions that may be buried or just at the surface.  Music is a creative force for change and when used properly, it can be a remedy for increasing strength, insight and awareness. Jessie and I have felt this impact in our own lives as we create music together and we believe our listeners will have similar experiences.  

Jessie and I are both creative entrepreneurs who are passionate about improving the human condition throughout our world.  We have both launched successful businesses/projects that focus on various issues our families and individuals are faced with.  Jessie and I are both  respected professionals and leaders in our community and have served in many capacities.  We have a natural love and appreciation for others and our desire is to inspire hope and healing in everything we create.  

Risks & Challenges

Jessie and I are realists.  We have been funding our own passion projects for years so we understand the pressure of finding the money for another project.  With that said, Verity is the culmination of all those years we have worked to fine tune the product that represents our vision.  

Being in the music industry for decades, Jessie and I know how many acts can come and go.  We understand how saturated the music scene can get with new artists coming and going.  Jessie and I are different in the timing of our project.  We have been carefully crafting and shaping our goals for over two years.  We have been patient with the process of understanding our fans and their needs.  We have written and sung our music from that space and we think this sets us apart from the constant hype of the music industry.  Jessie and I understand the need to connect with our fans on a one on one level. We plan to tour extensively to build trust and create connections with our fan base.  We plan to weave our music into a community support system that will be strong and stable.  From that stability, Jessie and I will stretch into new territory throughout the United States and in other countries as the message of our music begins to resonate with a broader population.  

Our vision is wide but we are willing to start small and build.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may want to help, but don't have funds to contribute. That is ok! We would love your help in getting the word out. Share this project across your social channels (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc). We appreciate your help!!!
